commentary.comment: The first half has just begun.
Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the left post.
The Stuttgart players halt their celebrations as referee Christian Dingert makes the VAR signal to review the goal, most likely to ascertain if there was an offside in the build-up play.
The Stuttgart playersâ€™ celebrations are quickly cut short after referee Christian Dingert signals NO GOAL following the VAR review due to an offside.
Golden chance! Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.

Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) wastes a huge opportunity. He attempts to knock a rebound into the middle of the goal with a delicate header, but Rafal Gikiewicz dives to keep the ball from hitting the net.
Steven Zuber (VfB Stuttgart) has an effort from distance and sends the ball towards the right post, but the goalkeeper is equal to it. Corner kick. Stuttgart will have an opportunity.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Nico Willig has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) comes on the pitch for Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez.
A yellow card for a tackle by Manuel Schmiedebach (Union Berlin). Christian Dingert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Nico Willig prepares a substitution. Anastasios Donis is replaced by Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart).
Suleiman Abdullahi (Union Berlin) fires a brilliant shot from the edge of the box, but the effort rattles the right post! It could have been a superb goal.
Urs Fischer has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Joshua Mees replacing Marcel Hartel (Union Berlin).
Suleiman Abdullahi (Union Berlin) fires a rebound from close range only onto the right post.

It's been a while since that incident in the box, but the ref must have received some information as he makes the VAR signal. He's going to review that earlier penalty shout! What a chance for Union Berlin.
The Union Berlin players canâ€™t believe it after referee Christian Dingert signals NO PENALTY after the VAR review. Play to continue.
A substitution has been made. Steven Zuber goes off and Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Urs Fischer decides to make a substitution. Suleiman Abdullahi will be replaced by Akaki Gogia (Union Berlin).

Benjamin Pavard (VfB Stuttgart) had a great opportunity from mid-range. His powerful volley was directed towards the right side of the goal, but Rafal Gikiewicz was alert and made an astonishing save! Stuttgart force their opponents to concede a corner.
Christian Dingert shows the yellow card to Marvin Friedrich (Union Berlin) for a heavy challenge.
Urs Fischer has decided to substitute Robert Zulj and he is replaced by Michael Parensen (Union Berlin).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.

Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads towards the bottom right corner, but Rafal Gikiewicz shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him. Stuttgart have been awarded a corner kick.
Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though.
Sebastian Andersson (Union Berlin) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Ron-Robert Zieler.
Goal! A precise cut back on the goal line from Anastasios Donis finds Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) right in front of goal, and he easily buries the ball low into the middle of the goal. 1:0.

Suleiman Abdullahi (Union Berlin) scores a goal after nicely controlling a pass and unleashing a powerful close-range shot into the bottom right corner. The keeper couldn't do anything to stop this wonderful effort.
Bastian Dankert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Nico Willig decided to make a change. Daniel Didavi is replaced by Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart).
GOAL 2:1! Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) brilliantly slaloms his way forward past a few defenders and unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which is deflected and goes into the back of the net.
Christopher Trimmel (Union Berlin) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
The referee signals a substitution. Joshua Mees (Union Berlin) is brought on as a substitute for Marcel Hartel.

What a goal-scoring opportunity! Grischa Promel (Union Berlin) finds some space inside the box and gets in a strike, but the shot is brilliantly blocked by one of the defending players sliding in. The ball is out of play and Union Berlin manage to earn a corner.
GOAL! The corner is whipped in and Marvin Friedrich (Union Berlin) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header straight into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:2.
It is time for a substitution. Steven Zuber (VfB Stuttgart) is on for Chadrac Akolo.

Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) attempts to score as he rises near the penalty spot and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Rafal Gikiewicz pulls off a comfortable save to stop the ball from hitting the net.

Sebastian Andersson (Union Berlin) releases a powerful first-time effort from the edge of the box which goes in the direction of the crossbar, but the keeper leaps like a salmon to deny him. Excellent goalkeeping! The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Union Berlin.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Marc-Oliver Kempf (VfB Stuttgart) for his blatant foul.
Akaki Gogia (Union Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Suleiman Abdullahi.
Here is a change. Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez is going off and Nico Willig gives the last tactical orders to Alexander Esswein (VfB Stuttgart).
Urs Fischer is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Manuel Schmiedebach suffers an injury and Felix Kroos (Union Berlin) comes on.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Felix Kroos (Union Berlin) was quite harsh and Bastian Dankert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Sebastian Andersson (Union Berlin) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the roof of the net. His effort, however, is blocked by Ron-Robert Zieler, who pulls off a stunning save! The ball goes out of play. Union Berlin are awarded a corner kick.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he fails to change the score as his effort deflects away off the bar.
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Manuel Grafe didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Thomas Delaney (Dortmund) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Goal! Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 0:1.
Wait! Referee Manuel Grafe has indicated he is going to review the Dortmund goal using VAR. Itâ€™s probably to see if the ball went out of play in the build-up.
Here comes the VAR decision. The goal is given and Dortmund players have a reason to celebrate!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Manuel Grafe blows his whistle and the second half starts.
A pass into the box finds Marco Reus (Dortmund) unmarked. He carefully places a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Yann Sommer denies him.
It's a goal! Christian Pulisic plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Marco Reus (Dortmund). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 0:2.

A wild pass somehow finds Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) in space, he steadies himself and shoots from mid-range but sends it just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Dortmund will have a goal kick.
The substitution has been made. Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) has replaced Christoph Kramer.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Ibrahima Traore.
Substitution. Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Mario Gotze walks off.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Thorgan Hazard.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Marco Reus can be given a rest.
Lucien Favre decides to make a substitution. Jadon Sancho will be replaced by Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund).
That's it for today, Manuel Grafe has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Goal - 1:0! Thomas Muller tees up Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Kevin Trapp.

David Alaba (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom right corner. Kevin Trapp has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. Good work from Bayern Munich as they win a corner.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the bottom right corner. However, Kevin Trapp anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save. It will be a corner kick for Bayern Munich.
Goal! Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) displays his shooting ability and the ball sails inside the back of the net!
Wait a minute! The referee has decided to review the goal using the VAR system.
Here comes the VAR decision. NO GOAL, the ref disallows it due to offside.
A long pass into the box is latched onto by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who looks up and slams a terrific shot past the keeper but onto the crossbar. He did everything right but score!
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Martin Hinteregger (Eintracht Frankfurt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Leon Goretzka is being substituted because of an injury. Niko Kovac sends Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) on the pitch.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Jonathan de Guzman comes off for Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Goal! Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Sascha Stegemann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Kevin Trapp is alert and denies him with a nice save.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) takes a brilliant touch after he latches on to a pass on the edge of the box and strikes the ball to the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper dives low and saves his attempt.
Goal! A rebound wrong foots everyone except David Alaba (Bayern Munich), and he slams the ball into the open net from close range. 2:1.
Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Kevin Trapp with a strike into the right side of the goal. He makes it 3:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kingsley Coman trots off the pitch and is replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Here is a change. Ante Rebic is going off and Adi Hutter gives the last tactical orders to Lucas Torro (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Here comes a substitution. Serge Gnabry is given a rest as he is replaced by Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich).
Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
Today's referee Sascha Stegemann rightly decides to book Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) for his harsh tackle.
Goal! Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) skips past challenges and from close range brilliantly chips the ball over Kevin Trapp. 4:1. Wonderful individual effort.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) receives a yellow card.
It's in the back of the net! David Alaba sprays a pass out to Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 5:1.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Kevin Trapp leaps like a salmon to deny him. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Bayern Munich will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.
Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Samuel Radlinger.
Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) latched on to a cross and struck a header just wide of the left post.
Benjamin Cortus shows the yellow card to Edgar Prib (Hannover) for a heavy challenge.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Linton Maina (Hannover) shows his willingness to get forward and blasts a shot towards goal. Unfortunately for him, the shot isn't precise enough and hits the crossbar!
Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home inside the left post. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Samuel Sahin-Radlinger.
Goal! 2:0. The ball rebounds to Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) after a melee in the box, and he easily beats the keeper from close range.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Andre Hoffmann (Dusseldorf) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Edgar Prib trots off the pitch and is replaced by Florent Muslija (Hannover).
Thomas Doll has decided to make a change. Nicolai Muller (Hannover) replaces Walace.
Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Benjamin Cortus ignores the protests.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Linton Maina as he is replaced by Miiko Albornoz (Hannover).
Nicolai Muller (Hannover) produces a stunning solo effort and slams the ball past the goalkeeper and into the middle of the net. Absolutely amazing!
Kenan Karaman goes off the pitch and Oliver Fink (Dusseldorf) comes on.
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Aymen Barkok (Dusseldorf) replacing Dodi Lukebakio.
What a chance that is! Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the right post!
Benjamin Cortus shows a yellow card to Kevin Stoger (Dusseldorf), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The substitution is prepared. Alfredo Morales (Dusseldorf) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Kevin Stoger.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg) is in the right place at the right time and perfectly hits a rebound into the bottom left corner.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Dominique Heintz (Freiburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
A yellow card for a tackle by Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg). Markus Schmidt doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) scores a very lucky goal with a knuckleball of a shot from outside the penalty area after the ball changes direction in the air and results in the goalkeeper making a complete howler!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Boris Schommers makes a half-time substitution. Timothy Tillman (Nurnberg) comes on in place of Simon Rhein.
Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the left post. It's 3:0.
What a wonderful finish! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and smashes the ball inside the left post. There are not enough superlatives to describe that goal.
Spectacular goal! Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) brilliantly darts into the box to latch on to a cross and buries the ball into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper stunned!
Here comes a substitution. Sebastian Kerk is given a rest as he is replaced by Ivo Ilicevic (Nurnberg).
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Amir Abrashi (Freiburg) replaces Mike Frantz.
Absolutely fantastic goal! Eduard Lowen (Nurnberg) hits a perfect volley from far out and the ball flies into the top right corner. Take a bow.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Mikael Ishak will be replaced by Torless Knoll (Nurnberg).
Marco Terrazzino just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Roland Sallai (Freiburg) replaces him.
Roland Sallai (Freiburg) looks up on the edge of the box and rifles in a screamer of a shot that flies just over the bar.
Lucas Holer (Freiburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Vincenzo Grifo.
Ivo Ilicevic (Nurnberg) gets a yellow card.
Robin Koch (Freiburg) hits the crossbar with a rebound from just outside the box.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) gets to the rebound outside the penalty box and unleashes a long-range shot towards the top of the net, Thomas Kraft makes a decent save to stop the effort. Bayer Leverkusen force a corner. They send men into the box.
Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) rises highest from the corner and heads at goal, but his effort towards the bottom right corner is saved by Thomas Kraft.
Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a perfect pass for a great chance inside the box and slots the ball past the goalkeeper.
Goal! Ondrej Duda passes the ball to the feet of Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 1:1.

A superb goal from great team play! Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot into the middle of the net. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant foul.
Maximilian Mittelstadt comes onto the pitch because Lukas Klunter (Hertha Berlin) simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Marco Fritz has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Per Skjelbred is replaced by Javairo Dilrosun (Hertha Berlin).
Goal! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) shows perfect technique and produces a first-time effort from just outside the box that goes into the top left corner. It's 1:3.
Peter Bosz has decided to make a change. Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Sven Bender.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) heads the ball towards the goal from close range, and his effort makes it home! What a goal!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Vedad Ibisevic trots off the pitch and is replaced by Pascal Kopke (Hertha Berlin).
Peter Bosz has decided to substitute Aranguiz and he is replaced by Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen).
Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
We are about to witness a substitution. Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) is replacing Mitchell Weiser.

Javairo Dilrosun (Hertha Berlin) finds himself in space on the edge of the box and smashes a glorious looking effort towards the bottom right corner, but Lukas Hradecky thwarts him with a great two-handed save.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. It will be a corner kick for Hoffenheim.
A sweet pass inside the box gives Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) time to measure a shot, but it's slightly mishit and goes just wide of the right post. That really was a great chance!
Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) collects a good pass and slams the ball from mid-range into the top right corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
A yellow card for a tackle by Chistoph Baumgartner (Hoffenheim). Deniz Aytekin doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Caution goes to Joelinton (Hoffenheim).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) is coming onto the pitch as Ishak Belfodil cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Pierre Kunde Malong (Mainz) sees a yellow card from Deniz Aytekin after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) shows what an intelligent of a player he is after hitting a low shot from a free kick that goes under the defensive wall and into the bottom left corner!
Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) gets to the rebound and shoots, but the effort is blocked.
Chistoph Baumgartner (Hoffenheim) makes a bad challenge and is given a second yellow card which means he's off.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) replacing Anthony Ujah.
Here comes a substitution. Pierre Kunde Malong is given a rest as he is replaced by Alexandru Maxim (Mainz).

Danny Latza (Mainz) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots low towards the middle of the goal. Oliver Baumann is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save. Corner kick. Mainz will have an opportunity.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
What a chance that is! Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.

Aaron Caricol (Mainz) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads towards the bottom left corner, but Oliver Baumann shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him. The ball goes behind for a corner. Mainz will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
One of the Mainz players is in on goal but gets upended by the defender in the box. That could be a penalty, but the ref says NO! Play continues.
Referee Deniz Aytekin gets a signal in his ear and goes over to the VAR monitor to check whether itâ€™s a penalty!
Referee Deniz Aytekin is happy with his original decision after the VAR review. Itâ€™s a PENALTY to Mainz!
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) beats the goalkeeper with a precise penalty kick.
The substitution has been made. Lukas Rupp (Hoffenheim) has replaced Joelinton.
Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) receives a well-taken defence-splitting pass inside the box and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom left corner.
Referee Deniz Aytekin makes the VAR signal and is going to check whether the goal can stand. Letâ€™s see what happens!
The referee looks satisfied after his VAR review and duly disallows the goal for handball!
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Danny Latza.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot inside the right post. His attempt was beyond the reach of Oliver Baumann, so the score changes to 2:2.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) replaces Joshua Brenet.
Goal! Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz).
Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the bottom right corner.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
A neat pass is well received by Alexander Esswein (VfB Stuttgart), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball on goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.

Daniel Didavi floats a good corner into the box that Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) gets on the end of, but his effort on goal scorches just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.

Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) drifts into the box to meet the ball from the free kick and plants a header towards the bottom right corner. One of the defending players gets in its way and blocks it. Corner kick. Schalke will have an opportunity.

Benjamin Pavard (VfB Stuttgart) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Alexander Nubel shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Robert Schroder has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Nico Willig makes a switch. Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart) is coming on in place of Christian Gentner at the start of the second period.
The game is over for Daniel Didavi. Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) comes on for the second half.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Rabbi Matondo (Schalke) for Breel Embolo.
Today's referee Robert Schroder rightly decides to book Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart) for his harsh tackle.
Here comes a substitution. Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) is brought on as a substitute for Mario Gomez.
Benjamin Pavard (VfB Stuttgart) connects with the ball in the six-yard box after the resulting free kick and shoots towards the top right corner, but Alexander Nubel makes a magnificent save!
That's the end of the game for Suat Serdar, who is replaced by Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).

Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a low shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Alexander Nubel made an astonishing save!
Substitution. Daniel Caligiuri makes his way off the pitch and Sascha Riether (Schalke) comes on as his replacement.
Bibiana Steinhaus is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) for his blatant foul.
Referee Felix Brych makes the VAR signal and is going to check whether itâ€™s a penalty for Werder Bremen. Letâ€™s see what happens!
Here comes the VAR decision: PENALTY to Werder Bremen!
Goal! Yvon Mvogo gets a hand on the penalty from Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen), but can't stop it from flying into the bottom left corner.
Marco Friedl (Werder Bremen) has tested the patience of referee Felix Brych and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Felix Brych blows his whistle to start the second half.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) comes on the pitch for Nuri Sahin.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Marcelo Saracchi (RB Leipzig) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.
Marco Friedl (Werder Bremen) touches the ball with his hand inside the box! PENALTY to RB Leipzig! Great chance to score.
Bruma (RB Leipzig) doesn't keep his cool and fails to convert the penalty. He skies the ball way over the bar and into the stands.
Here's the change. Tyler Adams leaves the pitch and Emile Smith-Rowe (RB Leipzig) comes on as a substitute.
We are about to witness a substitution. Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) is replacing Konrad Laimer.
Ralf Rangnick has decided to substitute Jean-Kevin Augustin and he is replaced by Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig).
The referee signals a substitution. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Yuya Osako.
Marcelo Saracchi plays a terrific cross over to Nordi Mukiele (RB Leipzig), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Kevin Mohwald as he is replaced by Aron Johannsson (Werder Bremen).
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and curls the ball inside the right post in trademark fashion.
Felix Brych is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
There's a break in play and referee Felix Zwayer must have got a signal in his ear as he indicates he will check that earlier penalty claim by Wolfsburg using VAR. This could be interesting!
The Wolfsburg players canâ€™t believe it after referee Felix Zwayer signals NO PENALTY after the VAR review. Play to continue.
GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 1:0.
A yellow card for a tackle by Andre Hahn (Augsburg). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) meets a perfect cross from Admir Mehmedi deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike inside the right post. The score is 2:0.

Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner kick and scores with a great header aimed low into the middle of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is 3:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Zwayer has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Jeffrey Gouweleeuw comes off the pitch to be replaced by Kevin Danso (Augsburg).
The game is over for Christoph Janker. Jan Moravek (Augsburg) comes on for the second half.
Goal - 4:0! Elvis Rexhbecaj laid the ball off to Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg), who shot from close range into the top right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Admir Mehmedi is replaced by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg).
Goal! Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 5:0.
Dong-Won Ji goes off the pitch and Julian Schieber (Augsburg) comes on.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner of the net.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Simon Asta (Augsburg).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch so that Jerome Roussillon can be given a rest.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Felix Klaus (Wolfsburg) for Elvis Rexhbecaj.
Julian Schieber (Augsburg) gets on the scoresheet! He latched on to a precise pass and coolly slotted the ball into the top left corner.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power inside the right post.
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. Kevin Danso (Augsburg) puts the ball into the back of the net but, unfortunately for him, it's into his own goal!
That's all for today as the game is over.

commentary.minute: Â Â The match will be delayed due to rioting fans. It looks like they didn
commentary.comment: t come to watch football. Crazy scenes here.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The first half has started.
Danny da Costa (Eintracht Frankfurt) latched on to an accurate pass deep into the box and attempted to fire the ball past the keeper, but the shot is way off target. What a miskick!

Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Mainz win a corner.

A sweet pass finds Danny Latza (Mainz) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the left side of the goal. Kevin Trapp is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second.
Filip Kostic plays a short pass through to Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) inside the box, but he balloons his effort high over the bar.
Pierre Kunde Malong (Mainz) receives a pass and fires a shot in from long range, but it's blocked. The linesman points to the corner flag, Mainz are going to take it.
Moussa Niakhate (Mainz) picks up a yellow card for a foul.

Kevin Trapp doesn't have to worry about this one. Jean-Philippe Mateta plays a pass into the feet of Anthony Ujah (Mainz), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes high over the bar.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Sandro Schwarz has made a change at the break. Giulio Donati (Mainz) has come on in place of Daniel Brosinski.
Goal - 0:1! Jean-Philippe Mateta laid the ball off to Anthony Ujah (Mainz), who shot from close range into the right side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Goal! Jean-Philippe Gbamin plays a pass to the feet of Anthony Ujah (Mainz), and he shoots inside the left post from inside the box. It's 0:2.
Anthony Ujah (Mainz) controls a cross inside the six-yard box, but unbelievably sends his shot wide of the left post.
Adi Hutter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Simon Falette.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Gelson Fernandes.
A yellow card for a tackle by Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt). Harm Osmers doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Here comes a substitution. Luka Jovic is given a rest as he is replaced by Goncalo Paciencia (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Here is a change. Danny Latza is going off and Sandro Schwarz gives the last tactical orders to Bote Baku (Mainz).

Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) shakes off the attention of a defender and from mid-range lets fly towards the left side of the goal, but Florian Muller is well positioned to make a comfortable save. Eintracht Frankfurt force their opponents to concede a corner.
Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his shot flies just wide of the right post.
We are about to witness a substitution. Niko Bungert (Mainz) is replacing Anthony Ujah.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom left corner.
It will be a substitution. Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Ja-Cheol Koo walks off.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Guido Winkmann has ended it.
The second half has just started.
What a hit! Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) gives away a foul for a clumsy challenge. Referee Guido Winkmann saw the whole situation. Augsburg are awarded a penalty kick!
A yellow card for a tackle by Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin). Guido Winkmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Goal! Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) puts the ball into the bottom right corner past the outstretched arm of Thomas Kraft.
Philipp Max is substituted due to injury. Martin Schmidt gives a chance to Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg).
Unlucky! Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) hits a thunderous volley on the edge of the box that just flies just wide of the left post.

Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) connects with the ball from the resulting corner and places a precise header past the stranded goalkeeper and into the top left corner. The opposing players are staring at each other, unable to understand what happened. Who will take the blame for that one? Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) has a reason to celebrate!
A substitution has been made. Lukas Klunter is replaced by Javairo Dilrosun (Hertha Berlin).
It's 3:2! Marco Richter feeds Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom left corner.
Martin Schmidt decides to make a substitution. Jan Moravek will be replaced by Christoph Janker (Augsburg).
Goooooal! Valentino Lazaro beats his man and slings in a cross towards Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin), who evades his marker and plants a fine header into the bottom left corner from close in. 3:3.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Vedad Ibisevic as he is replaced by Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ondrej Duda leaves the pitch and Pascal Kopke (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) connects well with the free kick, but heads the ball just wide of the right post from close in.
Reece Oxford (Augsburg) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Guido Winkmann signals. The referee's verdict is crystal clear. A penalty is awarded to Hertha Berlin!
Goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty low past Gregor Kobel into the middle of the goal.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
A great pass puts Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) clear inside the box, he sidesteps the keeper but inexplicably hit his shot off the crossbar.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) looks on in disbelief after missing his chance. He fires the rebound onto the right post!
What a hit! Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot low into the middle of the net. 1:0.
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) for a heavy challenge.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Peter Bosz makes a switch. Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on in place of Lars Bender at the start of the second period.
GOAL! Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Lukas Hradecky, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 1:1.
Schalke score a goal, but referee Deniz Aytekin has now indicated he wants to check if the goal can stand using VAR!
Referee Deniz Aytekin points to the centre spot to indicate that the goal stands after the VAR review. The Schalke players celebrate.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) makes an overly-aggressive challenge and Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle for a foul. Schalke have been awarded a penalty kick!
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Deniz Aytekin didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) steps up to the penalty spot. He attempts to confuse the goalkeeper by stopping in the middle of his run up and sends the ball to the bottom right corner, but Lukas Hradecky keeps his cool to thwart him. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Schalke.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Alexander Nubel (Schalke).

Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) commits a rough challenge and Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle for an infringement. The referee blows his whistle and awards Schalke a penalty after chaos inside the box.
Referee Deniz Aytekin makes the VAR signal and is going to check whether itâ€™s a penalty. Letâ€™s see what happens!
After the VAR review the referee signals NO PENALTY, play can continue.
We are about to witness a substitution. Paulinho (Bayer Leverkusen) is replacing Lucas Alario.

PENALTY APPEAL after Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) goes down under a challenge from the defender. All players chase the referee but he's not interested in the penalty claim. Play continues.
Huub Stevens has decided to make a change. Rabbi Matondo (Schalke) replaces Breel Embolo.

Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Alexander Nubel, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) will replace Julian Baumgartlinger.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His almost perfect header hits the bar and ricochets away off it.
Substitution. Guido Burgstaller will be replaced by Cedric Teuchert (Schalke).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) has a goal ruled out for offside!
It's a goal! Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) does well to meet a cross inside the box and produces a stunning header that goes inside the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Oliver Fink (Dusseldorf) leaps to meet a beautiful cross and produces a header which goes low inside the left post.

It's in the back of the net! Mario Gotze has a shot blocked, but the ball falls to Thomas Delaney (Dortmund) who finds some space inside the box and buries the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 2:1.
The referee isn't 100% sure if it's a penalty to Dusseldorf, he's going to review using VAR.
The penalty decision stands after the VAR review. It's a penalty to Dusseldorf!
Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) can't convert the spot kick. It goes narrowly wide of the right post.
Lucien Favre has decided to substitute Jacob Bruun Larsen and he is replaced by Jadon Sancho (Dortmund).
Substitution. Markus Suttner will be replaced by Benito Raman (Dusseldorf).
Oliver Fink goes off the pitch and Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) comes on.
Adam Bodzek (Dusseldorf) makes an ugly tackle on his opponent and is sent off by the referee!
The substitution is prepared. Alfredo Morales (Dusseldorf) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Dodi Lukebakio.
Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Substitution. Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) on for Christian Pulisic.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Mario Gotze (Dortmund) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Michael Rensing. 3:1.
Dawid Kownacki (Dusseldorf) finds some space inside the box to meet a beautiful cross and slams the ball inside the left post. What a wonderful strike!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) is coming onto the pitch as Mario Gotze cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Edgar Prib (Hannover) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
What a big chance! Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Waldemar Anton (Hannover) celebrates a stunning goal. He manages to win himself just enough space inside the box to meet the free kick and produces a low header into the bottom left corner.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Dominique Heintz (Freiburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Robert Hartmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Christian Streich has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) comes on the pitch for Florian Niederlechner.
Christian Streich makes a switch. Roland Sallai (Freiburg) is coming on in place of Pascal Stenzel at the start of the second period.
Goal! Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 2:0. He was ably assisted there by Linton Maina.
Roland Sallai (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Hartmann ignores the protests.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pirmin Schwegler leaves the pitch and Walace (Hannover) comes on.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Nils Petersen as he is replaced by Lucas Holer (Freiburg).
Thomas Doll decides to make a substitution. Ihlas Bebou will be replaced by Miiko Albornoz (Hannover).

Walace (Hannover) scores one of the best goals in his career. His rocket of a shot from distance goes straight inside the right post. They will be showing this on every football show for some time to come.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) comes onto the pitch for Edgar Prib.
Lucas Holer (Freiburg) gets into a great position in the box after a pass, but sends his shot just wide of the left post.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Florian Kohfeldt is forced to make a change. Theodor Gebre Selassie is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Marco Friedl (Werder Bremen).

Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header into the middle of the goal. Excellent finish, which the keeper got nowhere near.
Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and fires into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Celebrations by Werder Bremen are cut short as the referee signals that the legality of the goal will be checked using the VAR. Hopefully this wonâ€™t take too long.
After what seems an eternity, referee Bastian Dankert decides there was a foul after using VAR to review the goal! NO GOAL, play to continue.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Julian Nagelsmann gives a chance to Chistoph Baumgartner (Hoffenheim) and Nadiem Amiri is off.
Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Chistoph Baumgartner (Hoffenheim) picks up a caution.
Substitution. Joelinton (Hoffenheim) has come on for Adam Szalai.
Substitution. Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) makes his way off the pitch and Claudio Pizarro comes on as his replacement.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) replaces Kerem Demirbay.
A yellow card for a tackle by Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim). Bastian Dankert doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Bastian Dankert shows the yellow card to Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) for a heavy challenge.
Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) has too much to say to the referee and receives a yellow card.
Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) gets a yellow card.
That's the end of the game for Johannes Eggestein, who is replaced by Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen).
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Frank Willenborg rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach).
Frank Willenborg has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
The game is over for Florian Neuhaus. Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) comes on for the second half.
Louis Jordan Beyer (B. Monchengladbach) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Frank Willenborg didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Goal! Jonas Hofmann provides Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
Substitution. Sebastian Kerk did his best and is replaced by Timothy Tillman (Nurnberg).
What bad luck! Lukas Muhl (Nurnberg) got in the way of a pass and unintentionally sent the ball past his own goalkeeper. The score is 0:2.

Goal! Ibrahima Traore displays great vision and sends a pass to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:3.
Substitution. Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) has come on for Ibrahima Traore.
Here is a change. Vura is going off and Boris Schommers gives the last tactical orders to Ondrej Petrak (Nurnberg).
Substitution. Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) in, Christoph Kramer out.
Boris Schommers has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Torless Knoll (Nurnberg) replacing Eduard Lowen.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the bottom right corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.
Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) does well to meet a cross from Tobias Strobl, but he directs his shot just wide of the left post.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
A pass into the box finds Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the bottom right corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Peter Gulacsi denies him.
Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) wins himself just enough space to meet the resulting corner and shoots towards the left post, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and gets the ball under control.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

David Alaba (Bayern Munich) was close to scoring after a great solo effort and unleashed a promising shot from the edge of the penalty area. The ball went towards the bottom left corner, but Peter Gulacsi showed his agility and saved this one.
Goal! Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 0:1.
Itâ€™s tense out there as referee Manuel Grafe has decided to review the goal using the VAR. He makes his way over to the monitor.
The goal by Bayern Munich is DISALLOWED on the advice of the video assistant referee due to an offside.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) for a tough tackle.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) for a heavy challenge.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Serge Gnabry as he is replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Here is a change. Thiago Alcantara is going off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical orders to Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Amadou Haidara (RB Leipzig) has come on for Diego Demme.

Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Peter Gulacsi is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Konrad Laimer is substituted due to injury. Ralf Rangnick gives a chance to Nordi Mukiele (RB Leipzig).
It is time for a substitution. Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) is on for Kingsley Coman.
Emile Smith-Rowe (RB Leipzig) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Emil Forsberg.
Manuel Grafe is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart) finds the back of the net and gets on the scoresheet.
Play continues despite the shouts by some Stuttgart players for a penalty. Wait! Referee Felix Brych interrupts the game right now and he will review that decision using VAR! Let's see what happens.
NO PENALTY after a VAR review! The Stuttgart players are visibly unhappy with the call.
Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Wolfsburg will have a goal kick.
Alexander Esswein (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Goal! Anastasios Donis takes aim and his effort deflects off Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart) to beat the goalkeeper. 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) has come on for Felix Klaus.
Nico Willig has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Alexander Esswein.

Goal! A terrific long pass from Daniel Didavi picks out an unmarked Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) inside the box. He has time and space to pick his spot and slams the ball into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
Here is a change. Yannick Gerhardt is going off and Bruno Labbadia gives the last tactical orders to Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg).
Marcel Tisserand (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card for infringement.
It will be a substitution. Josip Brekalo is ready to enter the pitch as William (Wolfsburg) walks off.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Chadrac Akolo walks off the pitch to be replaced by Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart).
Nico Willig decides to make a substitution. Anastasios Donis will be replaced by Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart).
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect low shot that goes into the middle of the goal and past the goalkeeper.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
What a beauty! Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) makes contact with a cross on the edge of the box and finishes clinically with a low shot into the bottom right corner.
Goal Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen)! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) was put through by Aranguiz and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
It's in the back of the net! Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) tries his luck from the edge of the box and his shot takes a deflection and goes past the stranded Lukas Hradecky. He makes it 2:1.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a yard for himself and attempts to endanger the goalkeeper with a long-range shot. His great effort, however, goes a whisker wide of the left post.
It's a goal! Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) bursts into the box to get on the end of a whipped in cross from Lucas Alario and scores magnificently from close range into the middle of the goal. 3:1.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Kevin Trapp with a strike into the top left corner. He makes it 4:1.
Goal! Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) scores after an assist by Kevin Volland that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 5:1.
OWN GOAL! The free kick is whipped in and Martin Hinteregger (Eintracht Frankfurt) is unlucky enough to head the ball into his own net. 6:1.
Adi Hutter has decided to substitute Jetro Willems and he is replaced by Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) in, Obite Evan N'Dicka out.
Martin Hinteregger (Eintracht Frankfurt) is cautioned by the referee.
David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Hartmann has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Problems for Peter Bosz as Sven Bender is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces him.
A substitution has been made. Lars Bender goes off and Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.

Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out. The ball goes out of play. Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
That will be all from Danny da Costa who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Timothy Chandler (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Lucas Alario leaves the pitch and is replaced by Paulinho (Bayer Leverkusen).

CHANCE! Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Kevin Stoger (Dusseldorf) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending the ball towards the bottom right corner only for Alexander Schwolow to dive and make a save. Dusseldorf have a corner.
Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) makes an overly-aggressive challenge and Tobias Welz blows his whistle for a foul. That is a penalty kick for Freiburg.
Goal! Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Michael Rensing to commit before slotting the penalty into the left of the goal.

What a great touch by Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. The linesman points to the corner flag, Freiburg are going to take it.
Dawid Kownacki (Dusseldorf) collects a pass and fires a strong shot that ricochets in off the inside of the left post.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Janik Haberer (Freiburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) makes a bad challenge and is given a second yellow card which means he's off.
