The match has just started.
Goal! Mario Gotze (Dortmund) ran onto a clever lofted pass from Jadon Sancho and easily beat the keeper with a header into the top right corner from close range. 1:0.
Julian Weigl (Dortmund) appears to handle the ball in the box, but the referee wasn't in the best position. Let's see what he decides.

It's been a while since that incident in the box, but the ref must have received some information as he makes the VAR signal. He's going to review that earlier penalty shout! What a chance for Schalke.
Referee Felix Zwayer awards a PENALTY after the VAR review!
Goal! Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Roman Burki into right side of the goal.
Daniel Caligiuri takes over corner duties and expertly finds Salif Sane (Schalke), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the left side of the goal. The score is now 1:2.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Suat Serdar (Schalke) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Breel Embolo (Schalke) makes a really bad tackle on his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Felix Zwayer starts the second half.
Substitution. Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) in, Thomas Delaney out.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and the referee shows him a deserved red card! Schalke are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) scores from a free kick after smashing the ball over the defensive wall and into the top left corner of the goal!
Marius Wolf (Dortmund) takes out his opponent with a nasty slide tackle and receives a straight red card from the referee!
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Daniel Caligiuri walks off the pitch to be replaced by Sebastian Rudy (Schalke).
A yellow card for a tackle by Weston McKennie (Schalke). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Huub Stevens has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jeffrey Bruma (Schalke) replacing Weston McKennie.
Here comes a substitution. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) is brought on as a substitute for Raphael Guerreiro.
The ball rebounds off the defender into the path of Guido Burgstaller (Schalke), who immediately strikes for goal from inside the box but sends it a whisker over the bar.
Lucien Favre decides to make a substitution. Mario Gotze will be replaced by Jacob Bruun Larsen (Dortmund).
GOAL! A cross into the box is headed down by Jacob Bruun Larsen and Axel Witsel (Dortmund) does brilliantly to get to the ball and fire home. 2:3.
A piece of footballing magic! Breel Embolo (Schalke) collected a precise pass and fired a shot towards the bottom right corner, bouncing in off the post. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Substitution. Rabbi Matondo (Schalke) replaces Breel Embolo.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Omar Mascarell (Schalke) is given a yellow card.
Sebastian Rudy (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.
Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Goal! Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a shot from the edge of the box into the middle of the net, leaving Jiri Pavlenka beaten. The score is 2:0.
Benjamin Cortus shows the yellow card to Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) for a heavy challenge.

It's been a while since that incident in the box, but the ref must have received some information as he makes the VAR signal. He's going to review that earlier penalty shout! What a chance for Werder Bremen.
Here comes the VAR decision: PENALTY to Werder Bremen!
Goal! Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Michael Rensing into the bottom right corner.
CHANCE! Nuri Sahin (Werder Bremen) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!
Today's match ends for Benito Raman who will be replaced by Aymen Barkok (Dusseldorf).
Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Benjamin Cortus ignores the protests.
Benjamin Cortus has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Florian Kohfeldt makes a switch. Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) is coming on in place of Johannes Eggestein at the start of the second period.
Substitution. Aymen Barkok makes his way off the pitch and Dawid Kownacki (Dusseldorf) comes on as his replacement.
Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) converts a killer cross with a curling shot inside the right post! What a perfect finish!
Florian Kohfeldt prepares a substitution. Davy Klaassen is replaced by Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen).

Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) is quickest to the rebound inside the box and produces a low drive towards the middle of the goal. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a spectacular save to keep the ball out. Great goalkeeping!
A yellow card for a tackle by Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf). Benjamin Cortus doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The game has come to an end for Dodi Lukebakio. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Niko Giesselmann (Dusseldorf).
Goal! Markus Suttner (Dusseldorf) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top left corner. It's 4:1.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch so that Ludwig Augustinsson can be given a rest.
The foul by Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Benjamin Cortus.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets the lofted pass inside the box with a well placed shot towards the bottom left corner, but Rune Jarstein pulls off a fantastic save to deny him.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but powers his header just wide of the left post.
Lukas Klunter (Hertha Berlin) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and releases a quick shot to the bottom left corner. His promising effort is kept out by Rune Jarstein, who pulls off a stunning save! Corner kick. Eintracht Frankfurt will have an opportunity.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Gelson Fernandes walks off the pitch and Lucas Torro (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) in, Sebastian Rode out.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) replaces Vedad Ibisevic.
Sven Jablonski shows a yellow card to Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.
Valentino Lazaro goes off the pitch and Javairo Dilrosun (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. He sends the ball into orbit.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) sees a yellow card from Sven Jablonski after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Adi Hutter prepares a substitution. Jonathan de Guzman is replaced by Goncalo Paciencia (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee signals a substitution. Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) is brought on as a substitute for Ondrej Duda.

Lukas Klunter (Hertha Berlin) must have known he would be sent off for this foul, but he had to stop the opponent at all costs. Sven Jablonski shows him a second yellow card and the game has ended for him.
A yellow card for a tackle by Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin). Sven Jablonski doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
A defender mistimes his tackle on the edge on the box and let's in Jonathas (Hannover). It's a decent effort but his shot flies just wide of the right post.
Soren Storks shows a yellow card to Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) for his blatant foul.
It's in the back of the net! Robin Quaison (Mainz) finds a way to slip the ball past the goalkeeper!
Wait! Referee Soren Storks has indicated he is going to review the Hannover goal using VAR. Itâ€™s probably to see if there was a foul in the build-up.
Here comes the VAR verdict. NO GOAL for Mainz due to a foul in the build-up play.
A header by Robin Quaison (Mainz) from very close range goes towards the bottom right corner, but doesn't get past Michael Esser, who makes a brilliant save.
Robin Quaison (Mainz) picks up the rebound and shoots. The goalkeeper was ready and denies his effort with a fine save.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Thomas Doll gives a chance to Edgar Prib (Hannover) and Nicolai Muller is off.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) was quite harsh and Soren Storks didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Goal! Linton Maina manages to prod the ball to Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) after a melee inside the box, and he needs no second invitation to slot the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
The referee signals a substitution. Levin Oztunali (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Jean-Paul Boetius.
Substitution. Oliver Sorg (Hannover) replaces Linton Maina.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Anthony Ujah (Mainz) replacing Robin Quaison.
Substitution. Jonathas makes his way off the pitch and Walace (Hannover) comes on as his replacement.
Here comes a substitution. Niko Bungert (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Giulio Donati.
Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) smashes the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but his effort flies just a few inches wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Goal - 1:0! Yussuf Poulsen tees up Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Alexander Schwolow.

Lucas Holer (Freiburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Peter Gulacsi guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Lucas Holer (Freiburg) quickly picks up the rebound and drills the ball towards the right side of the goal. The opponent's goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save to deny him. Freiburg have been awarded a corner kick.

Dominique Heintz (Freiburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Schroder didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket. RB Leipzig earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
Amir Abrashi (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Schroder ignores the protests.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Keven Schlotterbeck (Freiburg) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
The whistle blows and Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) is booked for an infringement.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Amir Abrashi departs the field of play to be replaced by Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg).
The foul by Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Schroder. Another situation results in a direct free kick for RB Leipzig.
Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up inside the left post.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Robert Schroder's book.

Mike Frantz (Freiburg) picks up a pass and tries his luck from mid-range towards the roof of the net, but Peter Gulacsi is equal to it and makes an easy save. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Freiburg.
Lucas Holer (Freiburg) is first to latch onto the rebound inside the penalty area. He sends a shot towards the left post, but it is denied by the goalkeeper with a superb save.
Here comes a substitution. Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) is brought on as a substitute for Amadou Haidara.

Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) jinks his way past multiple challenges and fires the ball from the edge of the box to the right side of the goal, but Peter Gulacsi shows his agility and makes a save. Good work from Freiburg as they win a corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Lukas Klostermann (RB Leipzig) comes onto the pitch so that Nordi Mukiele can be given a rest.

Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the roof of the net, but Alexander Schwolow was alert and the score remains the same. The ball goes out of play. RB Leipzig are awarded a corner kick.
Handball! A player from Freiburg handled the ball. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for RB Leipzig!
Goal! Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Alexander Schwolow into the bottom left corner.
Here's the change. Mike Frantz leaves the pitch and Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) comes on as a substitute.
Ralf Rangnick has decided to substitute Timo Werner and he is replaced by Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig).
Robert Schroder shows the yellow card to Janik Haberer (Freiburg) for a heavy challenge.
A substitution has been made. Lucas Holer is replaced by Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg).
Robert Schroder has issued a yellow card to Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig).
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) meets a cross and produces a header towards the left side of the goal, but one of the defending players blocks the effort.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) drives into the box and hits a tremendous shot that, unluckily for him, flashes just wide of the left post.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

Lukas Hradecky earns applause from the crowd! He dives superbly to deny a dangerous first-time effort from the edge of the box. Marco Richter (Augsburg) was the player who tested the keeper's reflexes. Nice goalkeeping skills, indeed.
Jonathan Schmid sends in a great cross from the corner and finds Kevin Danso (Augsburg), who outjumps the defence to finish into the top left corner with a header. The score is 1:0.
Goal - 1:1! Kai Havertz tees up Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the box and he slams the ball into the roof of the net and past Gregor Kobel.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
Hold on! Thereâ€™s a VAR review to see whether there was an offside in the build up to the goal. The referee is checking now. The Bayer Leverkusen players arenâ€™t happy.
Here comes the VAR decision. NO GOAL!
Surely that's handball by one of the Augsburg players in the box, but the referee just waves play on!
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) latches onto a good pass inside the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper, but deflects off the crossbar to safety.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Peter Bosz makes a switch. Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming on in place of Sven Bender at the start of the second period.
Goal! Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Kevin Volland, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:2.
Kevin Danso (Augsburg) has scored a goal! Unfortunately for him and his teammates it's an own goal.
Referee Frank Willenborg makes the VAR signal and is going to check whether the goal can stand. Letâ€™s see what happens!
Referee Frank Willenborg takes one last look at the VAR monitor and decides there was an offside. NO GOAL, much to the annoyance of the Bayer Leverkusen players!
Frank Willenborg shows a yellow card to Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
Goal! Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:3.
Substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) in, Kevin Danso out.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Julian Schieber (Augsburg) comes onto the pitch so that Marco Richter can be given a rest.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Philipp Max will be replaced by Georg Teigl (Augsburg).
Peter Bosz has decided to make a change. Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Lucas Alario.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
It is time for a substitution. Lars Bender is on for Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.
The game is interrupted.
Everything seems to be alright after the game was interrupted, the referee blows his whistle and the match can continue.
Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) unleashes a powerful shot towards goal, but it is bravely blocked by a self-sacrificing defender.

Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot on goal, but the ball curls just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Wolfsburg.

Goncalo Paciencia (Eintracht Frankfurt) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball towards the roof of the net. Pavao Pervan shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Marco Fritz has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Sebastian Rode (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
Wait! The referee makes the VAR signal and he's going to review that incident from earlier. This could be a red card for Sebastian Rode (Eintracht Frankfurt)! Let's see what he decides.
Sebastian Rode (Eintracht Frankfurt) can breathe easy after referee Marco Fritz shows him a yellow card based on the VAR review.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
A cross arrives in the goalmouth from the resulting corner kick. Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the bar!
Bruno Labbadia has decided to substitute Yannick Gerhardt and he is replaced by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg).
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) has a sight of goal and fires from the edge of the box, but his strike rattles the left post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
The referee signals a substitution. Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Sebastian Rode.
Adi Hutter prepares a substitution. Luka Jovic is replaced by Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Marcel Tisserand (Wolfsburg) is arguing with the referee and is given a caution.

Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) wastes an opportunity. He finds himself in acres of space and fires in a terrific shot from long range towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one!
Goal! Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:1.
Marcel Tisserand goes off the pitch and Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Goncalo Paciencia (Eintracht Frankfurt) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
We are about to witness a substitution. Felix Klaus (Wolfsburg) is replacing Daniel Ginczek.
Goal! A precise cut back on the goal line from Felix Klaus finds John Brooks (Wolfsburg) right in front of goal, and he easily buries the ball into the middle of the goal. 1:1.
Substitution. Goncalo Paciencia leaves the pitch and is replaced by Almamy Toure (Eintracht Frankfurt).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

What a miss! The corner finds Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) unmarked in the box with the goal at his mercy, but somehow he mistimes his header and sends it just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hertha Berlin.

This shall not pass! Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) lines up a shot from the edge of the box and goes for goal, but the effort is well blocked by a defender. The ball goes out of play. Hertha Berlin are awarded a corner kick.
Sascha Stegemann shows the yellow card to Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge.
Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) outbattles the defender to win the ball from the corner, but he can't quite control his header and sends it just over the bar.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) for a tough tackle.
Today's referee Sascha Stegemann rightly decides to book Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

A great solo run by Florent Muslija (Hannover) took him deep inside the box, but his weak effort towards the right side of the goal was easily caught by Rune Jarstein. Hannover have been awarded a corner kick.
A yellow card for a tackle by Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin). Sascha Stegemann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Florent Muslija (Hannover) unleashes a mid-range direct free kick, but sees his strike well saved by the goalkeeper.
Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) pounces on a pass inside the box but flashes his shot just over the bar. That was a great chance! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) replaces Per Skjelbred.
It is time for a substitution. Nicolai Muller (Hannover) is on for Florent Muslija.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) accelerated away from the defence and took his shot early from the edge of the box. The ball flew towards the top of the net, but Michael Esser made a superb athletic save to deny him.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Javairo Dilrosun (Hertha Berlin) comes onto the pitch for Mathew Leckie.
The foul by Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Sascha Stegemann.
The referee signals a substitution. Sebastian Soto (Hannover) is brought on as a substitute for Linton Maina.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots towards the roof of the net. Michael Esser is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save. Hertha Berlin have been awarded a corner kick.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) for Niklas Stark.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal - 0:1! Marco Reus laid the ball off to Jadon Sancho (Dortmund), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

Marco Reus (Dortmund) controls the ball from the free kick on the edge of the box and releases a strike that could have ended up in the middle of the goal but for a magnificent save by Alexander Schwolow.

Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Freiburg win a corner.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom left corner. Magnificent finish!
Here comes a substitution. Omer Toprak (Dortmund) is brought on as a substitute for Marius Wolf.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Janik Haberer (Freiburg) for a tough tackle.
Here's the change. Florian Niederlechner leaves the pitch and Christoph Daferner (Freiburg) comes on as a substitute.
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg) replaces Mike Frantz.

What a huge chance for Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Dortmund.
It will be a substitution. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) is ready to enter the pitch as Raphael Guerreiro walks off.
Goal! Marco Reus rounded the goalkeeper and sent a sweet pass to Mario Gotze (Dortmund), who had an easy finish to put it into an empty net. 0:3.
Mario Gotze comes off the pitch to be replaced by Paco Alcacer (Dortmund).
Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) handles the ball inside the box. Dortmund are awarded a penalty kick!
Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Goal! Alexander Schwolow gets a hand on the penalty from Paco Alcacer (Dortmund), but can't stop it from flying into the bottom left corner.
Today's match ends for Janik Haberer who will be replaced by Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg).
That's all for today as the game is over.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) for his blatant foul.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) collects the ball from the free kick and immediately sends his close-range effort narrowly wide of the left post!

Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Alexander Nubel is just a bystander as the ball flies into the right side of the goal. The score is 0:1.
Breel Embolo (Schalke) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Christian Dingert shows the yellow card to Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) earns the yellow card.
Goal! Kerem Demirbay plays a pass to the feet of Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim), and he shoots into the bottom left corner from inside the box. It's 0:2.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Benjamini Hubner and he is replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).

Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) fires the ball from the free kick, directing it towards the top left corner, but the goalkeeper stretches to punch the ball away. What an excellent save. Schalke have been awarded a corner kick.

Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Christian Dingert signals. Schalke are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
Goal! Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Oliver Baumann into the roof of the net.
Goal! Ishak Belfodil swings the ball deep into the box and finds Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) unmarked, and his close-range header flies past the keeper into the bottom left corner. 1:3.
Here comes a substitution. Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) is given a rest as he is replaced by Joshua Brenet.

Goal! Andrej Kramaric displays great vision and sends a pass to Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:4.
The Hoffenheim players celebrate the goal but the referee immediately signals a VAR review. Let's see what happens. Big moment in the game.
Referee Christian Dingert points to the centre spot to indicate that the goal stands after the VAR review. That prompts big celebrations from the Hoffenheim players.
Suat Serdar (Schalke) latches onto a pass inside the box, steps inside his marker and smacks a shot against the left post.
What an excellent finish! Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) latched on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and rifled an unstoppable low drive into the middle of the net and past the helpless goalkeeper.
Huub Stevens prepares a substitution. Weston McKennie is replaced by Amine Harit (Schalke).
That will be all from Omar Mascarell who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Nassim Boujellab (Schalke).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nuhu Kasim comes onto the pitch for Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim).
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Christian Dingert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Goal! Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) takes a short pass from Breel Embolo in his stride in the box, jinks inside his man and unleashes an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner. 2:5.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.

A player from B. Monchengladbach brings down an opponent and commits a foul. That is a penalty kick for RB Leipzig.

The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Ralf Rangnick decided to make a change. Matheus Cunha is replaced by Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig).

A superb goal from great team play! Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the right post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Goal! Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) beautifully controls a strongly hit pass from Florian Neuhaus inside the box. He cuts inside his marker and rifles the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:2.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) for Florian Neuhaus.
Here is a change. Emil Forsberg is going off and Ralf Rangnick gives the last tactical orders to Amadou Haidara (RB Leipzig).

It's a goal! Rani Khedira (Augsburg) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Jonathan Schmid. The score is now 1:0.

The ball hits the back of the net! Jonathan Schmid delivers the corner, Andre Hahn (Augsburg) finds himself some space on the edge of the box and unleashes an unstoppable shot which goes into the bottom left corner and past the helpless goalkeeper. 2:0.

Marco Richter (Augsburg) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He latches on to a precise pass and fires a decent first-time low shot towards goal from a promising distance, but Ron-Robert Zieler denies him.

GOAL! Superb work from Marco Richter, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Philipp Max (Augsburg), who beats Ron-Robert Zieler with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 3:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jan Moravek is coming onto the pitch as Rani Khedira (Augsburg) cannot continue after picking up an injury.

A sweet pass finds Marco Richter (Augsburg) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the middle of the goal. Ron-Robert Zieler is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second.

Daniel Baier (Augsburg) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper blocks the effort.

Goal! Marco Richter (Augsburg) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box inside the left post. Ron-Robert Zieler had no chance of reaching it. The score is 6:0.

Jan Moravek (Augsburg) tries to find the back of the net with a volley from inside the penalty area, but the goalkeeper denies him with a crucial save.

Eduard Lowen (Nurnberg) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots low towards the middle of the goal. Lukas Hradecky is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save.

What a great touch by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.

OFF THE POST! Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Today's referee Martin Petersen rightly decides to book Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) for his harsh tackle.

Nico Schulz sends a slide-rule pass into the feet of Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim), who without a second thought fires a shot in on goal from mid-range which only goes just wide of the right post.

Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Oliver Baumann to get hold of the ball. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Hertha Berlin.

Jacob Bruun Larsen (Dortmund) attempts to test the goalkeeper after collecting a cross inside the penalty area. Luck doesn't appear to be on his side today as his attempt rattles the left post.

Bruno Labbadia makes a half-time substitution. Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Renato Steffen.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Substitution. Matheus Cunha makes his way off the pitch and Amadou Haidara (RB Leipzig) comes on as his replacement.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Felix Klaus (Wolfsburg) will replace Elvis Rexhbecaj.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the top of the net is smartly dealt with by Pavao Pervan. The referee signals a corner kick to RB Leipzig.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) takes the chance to have an effort at goal from inside the box but misses to the left of the target.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) unleashes a promising shot towards the bottom left corner after his wonderful solo run, but Pavao Pervan thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) replaces Maximilian Arnold.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) fires a shot from close range, but he is somehow only able to hit the right post!
Ralf Rangnick has decided to substitute Kevin Kampl and he is replaced by Diego Demme (RB Leipzig).
That will be all from Emil Forsberg who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Emile Smith-Rowe (RB Leipzig).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

The ball goes out of play and Stuttgart have been awarded a corner kick. Alexander Esswein (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a pass, lines up a shot and strikes from 14 metres out, but Lukas Hradecky thwarts the effort which is headed to the bottom right corner.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart) for his blatant foul. Bayer Leverkusen get a free kick.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Tobias Stieler blows his whistle to start the second half.

Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart) was too forceful with his tackle and Tobias Stieler interrupted the game to signal a free kick. The referee blows his whistle and awards Bayer Leverkusen a penalty after chaos inside the box.
Goal! Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) calmly steps up and smashes the ball into the bottom right corner.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Daniel Didavi.
It will be a substitution. Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) is ready to enter the pitch as Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez walks off.
A decent effort by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) from a close-range free kick! His attempt flies narrowly over the crossbar.
Substitution. Leon Bailey will be replaced by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Steven Zuber is replaced by Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart).

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the roof of the net, but Ron-Robert Zieler was alert and the score remains the same. Corner kick. Bayer Leverkusen will have an opportunity.
Red card! Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) is dismissed from the pitch by the referee.
Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen) drives into the box and hits a tremendous shot that, unluckily for him, flashes just wide of the left post.
That's it for today, Tobias Stieler has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
What a big chance! Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Amir Abrashi (Freiburg) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Half-time substitution. Florian Kohfeldt decided to make a change. Jiri Pavlenka is replaced by Stefanos Kapino (Werder Bremen).
Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen) connects with a precise cross inside the goalmouth and shoots. One of the defending players reacts in time and clears the ball to safety.
This is a yellow card! Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mike Frantz (Freiburg) is coming onto the pitch as Pascal Stenzel cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a change. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) replaces Yuya Osako.
Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Bibiana Steinhaus had an easy-decision to make.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the left post!
Mike Frantz (Freiburg) receives a yellow card from the referee, but it seems like a very harsh decision.
Goal! Milot Rashica swings the ball deep into the box and finds Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen) unmarked, and his close-range header flies past the keeper into the left side of the goal. 1:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jerome Gondorf trots off the pitch and is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg).
Christian Streich decides to make a substitution. Florian Niederlechner will be replaced by Lucas Holer (Freiburg).

Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the left side of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 2:0.
Substitution. Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) replaces Milot Rashica.
Goal! Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 2:1.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Alexander Nubel (Schalke) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Robert Kampka signals. The referee gives a penalty to Nurnberg!
Wait a minute! The referee has decided to review the penalty decision using the VAR system.
Penalty saved! Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) sends the penalty towards the left hand side of the goal, but Alexander Nubel pulls off a wonderful save to deny him.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Huub Stevens has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Breel Embolo (Schalke) comes on the pitch for Steven Skrzybski.
Tim Leibold is substituted due to injury. Boris Schommers gives a chance to Yuya Kubo (Nurnberg).
Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the bottom right corner. However, Alexander Nubel anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.
OFF THE POST! Sebastian Kerk (Nurnberg) picks up the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot which smashes against the right post.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Amine Harit will be replaced by Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke).
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Omar Mascarell (Schalke) for his blatant foul.

Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg) beats his marker and unleashes a thunderbolt of a shot from the edge of the box. Alexander Nubel sees the ball late but does well to stop it going into the bottom left corner. Nurnberg win a corner.
A yellow card for a tackle by Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg). Robert Kampka doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Breel Embolo (Schalke) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Here is a change. Nassim Boujellab is going off and Huub Stevens gives the last tactical orders to Sebastian Rudy (Schalke).

It's a goal! Yuya Kubo (Nurnberg) alters the score to 1:0. He jumps highest near the penalty spot to meet a good cross from Matheus Pereira and steers a header in off the bottom of the left post. Alexander Nubel was helpless.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) deflects his teammate's shot and the ball goes past the goalkeeper and into the back of the net!
Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Kampka had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.
A pass into the box finds Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the bottom right corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Yann Sommer denies him.
A long pass into the box is latched onto by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach), who looks up and slams a terrific shot past the keeper but onto the right post. He did everything right but score!
Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Jiri Pavlenka pulls off a great save to deny Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.
A yellow card for a tackle by Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen). Daniel Schlager doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.

It's a goal! Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach) displays superb quick feet and dribbling as he jinks his way through multiple challenges and takes a shot from inside the box, which is deflected and goes past stranded Jiri Pavlenka. 1:0.
Here is a change. Johannes Eggestein is going off and Florian Kohfeldt gives the last tactical orders to Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen).
Daniel Schlager shows a yellow card to Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) for his blatant foul.
A substitution has been made. Patrick Herrmann is replaced by Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach).

Yann Sommer receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Max Kruse (Werder Bremen), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed towards the roof of the net. Corner kick. Werder Bremen will have an opportunity.
Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Daniel Schlager lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
The referee signals a substitution. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Nuri Sahin.
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Raffael will be replaced by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Goooooal! Yuya Osako beats his man and slings in a cross towards Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen), who evades his marker and plants a fine header into the bottom left corner from close in. 1:1.
Substitution. Florian Neuhaus will be replaced by Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach).
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) replacing Milot Rashica.
A pass into the box finds Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the bottom left corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Jiri Pavlenka denies him.
That's it for today, Daniel Schlager has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) gets to the ball after a big mistake by the defending player and scores with a precise shot into the right side of the goal.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) has tested the patience of referee Robert Schroder and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Great touch by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) as he receives a precise pass deep in the box. He rips a snap shot and the ball bounces off the goalkeeper's gloves and hits the post.
Substitution. Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) in, Reece Oxford out.
Robert Schroder has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.

Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.
Substitution. Andre Hahn (Augsburg) replaces Marco Richter.
Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) gathers a perfect a cross and nods home. The ball goes inside the right post. No chance for the goalkeeper.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Nadiem Amiri and he is replaced by Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Nico Schulz walks off the pitch and Joshua Brenet (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) is penalised.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) is coming onto the pitch as Daniel Baier cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Leonardo Bittencourt (Hoffenheim) replaces Andrej Kramaric.
Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) bursts into the box after a great solo run and gets one-on-one with the keeper, who he neatly side steps and rolls the ball into an empty net. Wonderful effort!
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) smashed a volley without hesitation from near the penalty spot, but it only rattled the right post!
The resulting corner is whipped in by Thiago Alcantara and Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) is left unmarked to plant a precise header into the top of the net. The score is 1:0.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) goes on a mazy run, perfectly slipping past the opposition's defence. He aims well and places a precise low drive towards the bottom right corner, ricocheting in off the post! Wonderful goal! Total football.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting corner and steers his header into the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper pulls off an astonishing save to deny him. The referee blows his whistle, Bayern Munich are awarded a corner kick.
Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) rises highest from the corner and heads at goal, but his effort towards the bottom right corner is saved by Roman Burki. Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick.
Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) can count himself lucky for not being sent off after only receiving a caution from the referee.

Goal! Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Roman Burki is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 3:0.

Thomas Muller showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header into the bottom left corner. It's 4:0.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Manuel Grafe starts the second half.
Lucien Favre makes a half-time substitution. Julian Weigl (Dortmund) comes on in place of Dan-Axel Zagadou.
Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) receives a fine cross inside the box and attempts to score a goal, but his shot flies just wide of the right post.
Here comes a substitution. Mario Gotze (Dortmund) is brought on as a substitute for Mahmoud Dahoud.
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) replaces Kingsley Coman.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marius Wolf (Dortmund) will replace Lukasz Piszczek.
Thomas Delaney (Dortmund) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
The substitution is prepared. Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Javi Martinez.
It is time for a substitution. Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) is on for Thomas Muller.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) scores after an assist by Serge Gnabry that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 5:0.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) jumps into a tackle and Tobias Welz blows his whistle for a foul. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Bayer Leverkusen.
Goal! Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Peter Gulacsi into the bottom left corner.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the left post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) for his blatant foul.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) can showcase his brilliant free kick ability, particularly from a distance like this. He hits the ball perfectly and it ends up in the roof of the net.
GOAL! Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) got to the ball in front of the goal and he couldn't miss from there. His strike went in off the left-hand post. The score is 2:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Ralf Rangnick gives a chance to Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig) and Amadou Haidara is off.
Half-time substitution. Ralf Rangnick decided to make a change. Lukas Klostermann is replaced by Nordi Mukiele (RB Leipzig).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Tobias Welz didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) converts his chance into a goal!
Wait! Referee Tobias Welz has indicated he is going to review the Bayer Leverkusen goal using VAR. Itâ€™s probably to see if there was an offside in the build-up.
Celebrations are cut short for Bayer Leverkusen as the referee indicates NO GOAL after the VAR review shows it was offside!
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Welz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and coolly buries the ball low inside the right post.
Wait! The referee wants to check the penalty to RB Leipzig using VAR. He's heading over to the monitor now as the players anxiously wait.
The RB Leipzig players are happy as the referee awards a PENALTY after the VAR review!
Goal! Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) puts the ball into the bottom right corner past the outstretched arm of Lukas Hradecky.
Substitution. Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) has come on for Julian Baumgartlinger.
It's time for a substitution. Paulinho (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on in place of Kevin Volland.
GOAL! Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Lukas Hradecky, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 2:4.
Here is a change. Emil Forsberg is going off and Ralf Rangnick gives the last tactical orders to Diego Demme (RB Leipzig).
That's it for today, Tobias Welz has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the middle of the goal. Rune Jarstein has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) pounces on a great cross inside the box, but lashes his powerful first-time shot inches over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.

A pass into the box finds Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the left side of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Rune Jarstein denies him. The ball goes out of play. Dusseldorf are awarded a corner kick.
Goal! Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) beautifully controls a strongly hit pass from Rouwen Hennings inside the box. He cuts inside his marker and rifles the ball into the top left corner. 0:1.
Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Ondrej Duda, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 1:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The whistle blows and Kevin Stoger (Dusseldorf) is booked for an infringement.

Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) anticipates the lofted pass and races into the box with just the keeper to beat. He shoots early towards the left side of the goal, but Michael Rensing pulls off a great save to deny him.
Goal! Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:2.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The game is interrupted. Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Today's match ends for Dodi Lukebakio who will be replaced by Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf).
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Javairo Dilrosun (Hertha Berlin) replaces Ondrej Duda.
Here's the change. Oliver Fink leaves the pitch and Marcel Sobottka (Dusseldorf) comes on as a substitute.
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Palko Dardai (Hertha Berlin) replacing Mathew Leckie.
That's the end of the game for Niko Giesselmann, who is replaced by Robin Bormuth (Dusseldorf).

What a chance that is! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Dusseldorf will have a goal kick.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the middle of the goal. However, Alexander Nubel anticipates the shot and makes a decent save.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) beats the offside trap and bears down on goal. With just the keeper to beat he coolly shoots past him from the edge of the box.

Alexander Nubel gets a well deserved ovation! He pulls off a remarkable save to block a long-range effort from Martin Hinteregger (Eintracht Frankfurt) towards the roof of the net. Nice goalkeeping skills!

Breel Embolo (Schalke) outjumped the defenders to meet the ball from the free kick and plants a precise header from deep inside the box towards the net! The goalkeeper shows his reflexes and superbly keeps the ball out!
Goal! Suat Serdar (Schalke) fires the rebound low into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Sascha Stegemann ignores the protests.
Today's referee Sascha Stegemann rightly decides to book Suat Serdar (Schalke) for his harsh tackle.
Wait! The referee makes the VAR signal and he's going to review that incident in the box from earlier. This could be a penalty for Eintracht Frankfurt! Let's see what he decides.
Itâ€™s the correct decision â€“ NO PENALTY for Eintracht Frankfurt! VAR comes to the rescue of referee Sascha Stegemann and both teams have no complaints.
Martin Hinteregger is substituted due to injury. Adi Hutter gives a chance to Obite Evan N'Dicka (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Breel Embolo (Schalke) for a tough tackle.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Substitution. Goncalo Paciencia (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Jonathan de Guzman.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner, but his header is well saved by the keeper.
That will be all from Breel Embolo who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Ahmed Kutucu (Schalke).

Suat Serdar (Schalke) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Kevin Trapp makes a great save to stop the effort going low into the middle of the goal.
The manager makes a subsitution with Sebastian Rudy (Schalke) coming on for Nassim Boujellab.
RED CARD! Suat Serdar (Schalke) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Sascha Stegemann. He can have an early bath.

Play continues despite the shouts by some Eintracht Frankfurt players for a penalty. Wait! Referee Sascha Stegemann interrupts the game right now and he will review that decision using VAR! Let's see what happens.
The Eintracht Frankfurt players are happy as the referee awards a PENALTY after the VAR review!
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) is booked for saying more than Sascha Stegemann was willing to tolerate.
Goal! Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Alexander Nubel to commit before slotting the penalty into the roof of the net.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Steven Zuber (VfB Stuttgart) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the middle of the goal. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Christian Mathenia with a fabulous save.
Boris Schommers is forced to make a change. Sebastian Kerk is unable to continue due to injury, Yuya Kubo (Nurnberg) comes on.
Marc-Oliver Kempf (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to the corner kick inside the box, but his header crashes against the crossbar! The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
Great touch by Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg) as he receives a precise pass deep in the box. He rips a snap shot and the ball bounces off the goalkeeper's gloves and hits the post.
Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) misses a sitter from inside the six-yard box after striking the ball narrowly wide of the goal.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Here comes a substitution. Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) is brought on as a substitute for Andreas Beck.
Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) drives into the box and hits a tremendous shot that, unluckily for him, flashes just wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexander Esswein departs the field of play to be replaced by Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart).
The substitution is prepared. Vura (Nurnberg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Mikael Ishak.
Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though.
Goal! Ozan Kabak (VfB Stuttgart) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:1.

Thereâ€™s going to be a VAR review of the goal as indicated by referee Frank Willenborg, probably for an offside in the lead up to the goal. This is going to be an anxious wait for the Stuttgart players.
Here comes the VAR decision. The goal is given and Stuttgart players have a reason to celebrate!
Tim Leibold (Nurnberg) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Vura (Nurnberg) is cautioned by the referee.
Today's referee Frank Willenborg rightly decides to book Robert Bauer (Nurnberg) for his harsh tackle.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a change. Borna Sosa (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Emiliano Insua.
Benjamin Pavard (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Frank Willenborg had an easy-decision to make.
It is time for a substitution. Ondrej Petrak (Nurnberg) is on for Yuya Kubo.

Excellent touch by Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart)! He latches on to a precise pass deep into the box and produces a low drive towards the right post. The goalkeeper pulls off a beautiful save to deny him.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Benjamin Cortus shows the yellow card to Nicolai Muller (Hannover) for a heavy challenge.

What a save from Michael Esser! Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the left post, but the goalkeeper has pulled off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) is released by Linton Maina, he surges into the box and smashes a great shot into the top corner after a one-on-one with the goalkeeper.
Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) jumps for a cross and plants a precise header low inside the right post.
Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) is put clear inside the box by a lofted pass. He only has the keeper to beat, but Michael Esser comes out bravely to save at his feet. Great goalkeeping skills!
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Genki Haraguchi (Hannover) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the left side of the goal. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save! The linesman points to the corner flag, Hannover are going to take it.

Pavao Pervan can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Genki Haraguchi (Hannover). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net. Hannover have a corner.
We are about to witness a substitution. Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) is replacing Josip Brekalo.
Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) was close to scoring after he unleashed a powerful shot which went a whisker over the crossbar.
Thomas Doll decides to make a substitution. Nicolai Muller will be replaced by Florent Muslija (Hannover).
Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and fires into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Substitution. Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) has come on for Renato Steffen.
Goal! Yunus Malli shows great vision to find Jerome Roussillon (Wolfsburg) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails low into the middle of the goal. 3:1.
Here is a change. Marvin Bakalorz is going off and Thomas Doll gives the last tactical orders to Sebastian Soto (Hannover).
Kevin Wimmer (Hannover) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Felix Klaus (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch for Admir Mehmedi.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.

Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) had a good chance to change the score. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a shot from just outside the penalty area which went towards the top left corner, but the goalkeeper was ready and made an amazing save. Freiburg will take a corner kick.
Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) scores a stunning goal from far out. He unleashes a volley which finds its way into the back of the net and past the goalkeeper. Breathtaking!
Goal! Jean-Paul Boetius slips in Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) for a one-on-one with the keeper, and he simply dinks the ball over him into the net.
It's a goal! Aaron Caricol plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 3:0.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Pierre Kunde Malong (Mainz) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) picks up a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Christian Streich gives a chance to Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) and Lucas Holer is off.
Christian Streich has made a change at the break. Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) has come on in place of Mike Frantz.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) will replace Pierre Kunde Malong.
Danny Latza (Mainz) has tested the patience of referee Sven Jablonski and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Although Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) is just on the bench, Sven Jablonski has awarded him with a yellow card. Unsporting behavior says the referee.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to substitute Niko Bungert and he is replaced by Alexander Hack (Mainz).
Goal! Jean-Paul Boetius slips a clever pass through to Karim Onisiwo (Mainz), who moves inside the box and sends a measured shot beyond the keeper and into the bottom right corner. 4:0.

It's a goal! Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) bravely launches himself at a cross from Karim Onisiwo and gives Alexander Schwolow no chance with a close-range bullet header into the bottom left corner. 5:0.
It's time for a substitution. Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) comes on in place of Robin Quaison.
The game has come to an end for Pascal Stenzel. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Robin Koch (Freiburg).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Marc-Oliver Kempf (VfB Stuttgart) connects with a cross from out wide in the six-yard box, but only plants his header onto the bar.
Markus Weinzierl is forced to make a change. Christian Gentner is unable to continue due to injury, Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The game has begun to heat up. Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
Goal! Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the left post. He makes it 1:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) finds himself one-on-one with the keeper after a great pass by Ante Rebic. He takes the shot early and scores!
Substitution. Steven Zuber is replaced by Dennis Aogo (VfB Stuttgart).
Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes onto the pitch because Sebastien Haller simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Markus Weinzierl decides to make a substitution. Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez will be replaced by Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart).
Goal! Danny da Costa produces a great pass that finds Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 3:0.
Substitution. Ante Rebic makes way for Goncalo Paciencia (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Adi Hutter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Filip Kostic.
Felix Brych is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Alexander Nubel pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the left post, but was stopped by the goalkeeper. The ball goes behind for a corner. Hannover will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jeffrey Bruma (Schalke) was quite harsh and Sven Jablonski didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one!
Goal Suat Serdar (Schalke)! Suat Serdar (Schalke) was put through by Benjamin Stambouli and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Sven Jablonski blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Thomas Doll has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Florent Muslija (Hannover) comes on the pitch for Oliver Sorg.
Miiko Albornoz is being substituted because of an injury. Thomas Doll sends Martins Felipe (Hannover) on the pitch.
It will be a substitution. Ahmed Kutucu (Schalke) is ready to enter the pitch as Sebastian Rudy walks off.
Florent Muslija (Hannover) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the bar. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
A substitution has been made. Linton Maina is replaced by Takuma Asano (Hannover).
Huub Stevens has decided to make a change. Nassim Boujellab (Schalke) replaces Suat Serdar.
Substitution. Breel Embolo makes his way off the pitch and Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) comes on as his replacement.
Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sven Jablonski had an easy-decision to make.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Soren Storks shows a yellow card to Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.
Goal! Kevin Kampl puts a cross into the box and finds Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the top right corner. He makes it 1:0.
Goal! Timo Werner feeds Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 2:0.
Nordi Mukiele (RB Leipzig) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Soren Storks didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
Goal! A great through ball by Emil Forsberg sets up Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) inside the box, and he makes no mistake and bangs the ball into the bottom right corner. 3:0.
It's time for a substitution. Lukas Klunter (Hertha Berlin) comes on in place of Fabian Lustenberger.
Goal! Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) picks up a pass and gets to the edge of the box before clipping a brilliant lob over the goalkeeper and into the empty net. He makes it 4:0.
Goal! Amadou Haidara (RB Leipzig) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Timo Werner, then sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 5:0.
Substitution. Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) replaces Nordi Mukiele.
The manager makes a subsitution with Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig) coming on for Yussuf Poulsen.
Substitution. Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) in, Emil Forsberg out.
Here is a change. Salomon Kalou is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) will replace Arne Maier.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
A yellow card for a tackle by John Brooks (Wolfsburg). Markus Schmidt doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. It's a free kick to Dortmund in a dangerous position.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) has tested the patience of referee Markus Schmidt and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) gets on the end of a pass from Mario Gotze inside the box and quickly shoots, but the effort goes inches over the bar.

Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by Roman Burki, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Wolfsburg.
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Problems for Lucien Favre as Abdou Diallo is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund) replaces him.

Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) meets the lofted pass inside the box with a well placed shot towards the right side of the goal, but Koen Casteels pulls off a fantastic save to deny him. Dortmund force their opponents to concede a corner.
Here is a change. Felix Klaus is going off and Bruno Labbadia gives the last tactical orders to Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg).
Achraf Hakimi is being substituted because of an injury. Lucien Favre sends Jacob Bruun Larsen (Dortmund) on the pitch.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mario Gotze departs the field of play to be replaced by Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund).
Bruno Labbadia has decided to substitute Admir Mehmedi and he is replaced by Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg).
William (Wolfsburg) picks up a yellow card.
Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) converts the free kick from the edge of the box. He unloads a powerful daisy-cutter directed to the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper was too slow to stop his effort.
Goal! Jadon Sancho puts the ball across the area and Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 2:0.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom right corner. Good team effort!
Benito Raman provides Kevin Stoger (Dusseldorf) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.

Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach) went on a solo run, tricking his way past defenders, then produced an explosive blast from the edge of the box towards the roof of the net. Michael Rensing showed all his agility, however, and deflected the ball onto the crossbar! What a save!

GOAL! Superb work from Benito Raman, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf), who beats Yann Sommer with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 3:0.
Markus Suttner (Dusseldorf) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
That will be all from Thorgan Hazard who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) gets there first and whips in a shot at goal that flies just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Dusseldorf.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Dieter Hecking prepares a substitution. Florian Neuhaus is replaced by Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Andre Hoffmann (Dusseldorf) comes onto the pitch so that Kaan Ayhan can be given a rest.

Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Dusseldorf will have a goal kick.
Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Problems for Friedhelm Funkel as Adam Bodzek is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Robin Bormuth (Dusseldorf) replaces him.
Substitution. Fabian Johnson makes his way off the pitch and Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as his replacement.
Here is a change. Rouwen Hennings is going off and Friedhelm Funkel gives the last tactical orders to Dawid Kownacki (Dusseldorf).
Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Goal! Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:1.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Andre Hoffmann (Dusseldorf).
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Lucas Holer (Freiburg) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header low inside the right post. Excellent finish.
Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.
