Mike Frantz (Freiburg) expertly controls the pass inside the penalty area and shoots, but it's inadvertently blocked a defender.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Leon Goretzka, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 1:1.
Christian Gunter (Freiburg) has tested the patience of referee Christian Dingert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Amir Abrashi (Freiburg) for a tough tackle.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Christian Dingert blows his whistle to start the second half.
Here's the change. Thomas Muller leaves the pitch and Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
Dominique Heintz (Freiburg) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) picks up the rebound just outside the box and releases a weak shot that heads towards the right post, but it fails to give the goalkeeper anything to worry about.

James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Alexander Schwolow makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the top left corner.
Christian Streich decides to make a substitution. Mike Frantz will be replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg).
That will be all from Jerome Boateng who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich).
Niko Kovac has decided to substitute Kingsley Coman and he is replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Today's match ends for Lucas Holer who will be replaced by Manuel Gulde (Freiburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch for Vincenzo Grifo.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) beats his man to the lofted pass, but his header sails harmlessly well wide of the right post from close range.
Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) latches on to a superb cross into the box and hits the right post with his header. A stroke of luck for the goalkeeper!
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) takes the free kick and unleashes a strong shot from mid-range. Unfortunately for him, the ball curls inches over the crossbar. What a squandered chance!

Almeida Ewerton (Nurnberg) rose high to meet a perfectly taken corner kick and attempted to steer a fine header from inside the box towards the right side of the goal. Nobody knows what would have happened if one of the defending players hadnâ€™t pulled off a brilliant intervention to block the effort. Nurnberg have been awarded a corner kick.

Lukas Muhl (Nurnberg) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence.

Sebastian Kerk (Nurnberg) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and attempts to place his header into the middle of the goal. Gregor Kobel shows his fast reflexes, though, and makes a nice save.
Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) is booked by the referee.
Robert Bauer (Nurnberg) gets a yellow card.
Philipp Max (Augsburg) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots to the roof of the net, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Christian Mathenia. What a save!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Daniel Siebert blows his whistle to start the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Alfred Finnbogason comes off for Marco Richter (Augsburg).
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) expertly controls the pass inside the penalty area and shoots, but it's inadvertently blocked a defender.
Sebastian Kerk floats a lovely ball in from the free kick. Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) gathers the ball and strikes it into the bottom right corner, increasing the score to 1:0.
Problems for Boris Schommers as Almeida Ewerton is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Georg Margreitter (Nurnberg) replaces him.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Daniel Siebert ignores the protests.

Daniel Baier (Augsburg) collects a pass and has an effort from distance to the right side of the goal, but Christian Mathenia answers with a superb save to deny him. The ball is out of play and Augsburg manage to earn a corner.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Here is a change. Sebastian Kerk is going off and Boris Schommers gives the last tactical orders to Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg).
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Robert Bauer (Nurnberg) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Manuel Baum has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) replacing Ja-Cheol Koo.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) sees a yellow card from Daniel Siebert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
A substitution has been made. Yuya Kubo goes off and Ivo Ilicevic (Nurnberg) comes on.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) reacts well to meet the lofted pass on the edge of the six-yard box, but sends a weak header well wide of the right post.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg). Tim Leibold plays a fantastic through ball and finds Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 3:0.
Goal! Eduard Lowen (Nurnberg) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen). Max Kruse plays a fantastic through ball and finds Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
A pass into the box finds Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the bottom left corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Jiri Pavlenka denies him.
Florian Kohfeldt is forced to make a change. Niklas Moisander is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen).
Goal! Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 2:0.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Sandro Schwarz gives a chance to Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) and Levin Oztunali is off.

Jean-Paul Boetius sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Robin Quaison (Mainz) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 2:1.
A substitution has been made. Martin Harnik is replaced by Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen).
Fantastic team goal! Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) was set free in the area by Milot Rashica and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the left side of the net. 3:1.
It's time for a substitution. Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) comes on in place of Jean-Philippe Mateta.
This is a yellow card! Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Pierre Kunde Malong will be replaced by Anthony Ujah (Mainz).
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to substitute Milot Rashica and he is replaced by Joshua Sargent (Werder Bremen).
Marco Fritz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.

Andrej Kramaric passes to Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:0.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) latches onto a brilliant cross and produces a perfect header that goes inside the left post to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Peter Bosz is forced to make a change. Karim Bellarabi is unable to continue due to injury, Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the bottom left corner. However, Lukas Hradecky anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.
A yellow card for a tackle by Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim). Harm Osmers doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
A lofted pass into the box is met by Leonardo Bittencourt (Hoffenheim), who rifles a shot just wide of the left post.
The referee signals a substitution. Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Lars Bender.
Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) for a tough tackle.
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card from Harm Osmers after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Julian Nagelsmann is forced to make a change. Joelinton is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim).
OWN GOAL! Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 2:1.

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner of the net.
Substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt will be replaced by David Otto (Hoffenheim).
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 4:1. He was ably assisted there by Ishak Belfodil.
A substitution has been made. Leon Bailey is replaced by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Yellow card! It's like Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Harm Osmers agrees and books him.
That will be all from Ishak Belfodil who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
David Alaba plays a terrific cross over to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.

Unbelievable! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) wastes a huge scoring opportunity! He finds himself unmarked right in front of goal and fires in a first-time shot. Florian Muller pulls off one of the best saves of his career and stops the effort from hitting the net. Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) misses a great chance. He gets to the rebound inside the box and sees his shot smash against the left post!

Manuel Neuer doesn't have to worry about this one. Jean-Paul Boetius plays a pass into the feet of Levin Oztunali (Mainz), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes well wide of the right post.
Goal! A precise cut back on the goal line from Leon Goretzka finds James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) right in front of goal, and he easily buries the ball into the bottom right corner. 2:0.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom right corner in trademark fashion.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Frank Willenborg has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Jean-Paul Boetius as he is replaced by Pierre Kunde Malong (Mainz).
James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom left corner.
GOAL! James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Florian Muller, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 5:0.
Here is a change. David Alaba is going off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical orders to Alphonso Davies (Bayern Munich).
Here comes a substitution. Aaron Caricol (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Jean-Philippe Mateta.
Niko Kovac has decided to substitute Kingsley Coman and he is replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Goal! Alphonso Davies (Bayern Munich) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 6:0.
The foul by Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Frank Willenborg.
Niko Kovac prepares a substitution. James Rodriguez is replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
It's time for a substitution. Giulio Donati (Mainz) comes on in place of Levin Oztunali.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
A decent cross gives Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) a chance to score, but he sends his header inches over the bar from close range.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) plants a goal-bound header towards the right post after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders reacts superbly and makes a timely interception.
Goal! Martin Hinteregger (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Filip Kostic. The score is 1:0.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Goncalo Paciencia (Eintracht Frankfurt) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Goncalo Paciencia (Eintracht Frankfurt) pounces on the cross and fires in a shot on goal from close range, but Christian Mathenia is alert and makes a decent save.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.

Goncalo Paciencia (Eintracht Frankfurt) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the bar!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Edgar Salli (Nurnberg) comes onto the pitch for Timothy Tillman.
Adi Hutter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Goncalo Paciencia.

Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball is out of play. Eintracht Frankfurt win a corner kick.
Today's match ends for Mikael Ishak who will be replaced by Torless Knoll (Nurnberg).
Bibiana Steinhaus shows the yellow card to Edgar Salli (Nurnberg) for a heavy challenge.
Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) does well inside the box to bring down a pass from Danny da Costa. He gets away a decent shot but it creeps just past the right post.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Luka Jovic as he is replaced by Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Boris Schommers has decided to substitute Yuya Kubo and he is replaced by Georg Margreitter (Nurnberg).

Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) latches onto the ball after a scramble in the box, but his placed effort towards the right side of the goal is far too weak and Kevin Trapp makes a simple save. The ball is out of play and Nurnberg manage to earn a corner.
Filip Kostic is being substituted because of an injury. Adi Hutter sends Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) on the pitch.
A goal, which was scored by Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt), was disallowed due to offside.
Today's referee Bibiana Steinhaus rightly decides to book Lukas Muhl (Nurnberg) for his harsh tackle.
That's it for today, Bibiana Steinhaus has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) had a great opportunity from mid-range. His powerful volley was directed towards the right side of the goal, but Lukas Hradecky was alert and made an astonishing save! The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Werder Bremen will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Goal! Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) neatly controls a decent pass from Maximilian Eggestein. He looks up and smashes an unstoppable drive into the right side of the goal from the edge of the box. 0:1.
Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) anticipates the cross from Leon Bailey, but powers his header way over the bar from the edge of the six-yard box.

Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Bayer Leverkusen.
What a chance that is! Karim Bellarabi swings the ball into the box, and Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the left post.

Goal! Max Kruse displays great vision and sends a pass to Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 0:2.
Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Deniz Aytekin after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The foul by Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Deniz Aytekin.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Aranguiz comes off for Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen).
Half-time substitution. Peter Bosz decided to make a change. Karim Bellarabi is replaced by Paulinho (Bayer Leverkusen).
Goal, no wait. Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle for handball and Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) can't celebrate. Disallowed goal.
Nuri Sahin (Werder Bremen) fires the ball from the free kick and it smashes against the crossbar!
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Milot Rashica as he is replaced by Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen).
A yellow card for a tackle by Nuri Sahin (Werder Bremen). Deniz Aytekin doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) struck with a superb free kick from the edge of the box, sending the ball in off the inside of the left post. The goalkeeper didn't have a chance. Simply glorious! It's 1:2.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a change. Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) replaces Johannes Eggestein.
That's the end of the game for Lars Bender, who is replaced by Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen).
Florian Kohfeldt decides to make a substitution. Davy Klaassen will be replaced by Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen).
Good chance! Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) nicely turned his man inside the box but placed his effort just wide of the right post. He should have scored!
The referee shows the yellow card to Jiri Pavlenka (Werder Bremen).
Today's referee Deniz Aytekin rightly decides to book Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) for his harsh tackle.

Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Lukas Hradecky is just a bystander as the ball flies into the left side of the goal. The score is 1:3.
Deniz Aytekin is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) pounces on a rebound inside the box from a Maximilian Mittelstadt shot and sends the ball into the back of the net. The score is 1:0.
Goal! Thomas Delaney (Dortmund) picks up the ball inside the box, finds himself in a good position and fires in a shot which is deflected past Rune Jarstein. He makes it 1:1.
Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Welz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Julian Weigl (Dortmund) latches on to a lovely pass inside the box and fires towards the right side of the net, but the effort is smothered by the keeper.
Julian Weigl (Dortmund) touches the ball with his hand. Hertha Berlin are awarded a penalty kick!
Goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Roman Burki into left side of the goal.
Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) bursts into the box after a fine solo run. He looks up and tries to place a shot inside the right post, but Rune Jarstein makes a great save to deny him his moment of glory.
Tobias Welz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.

A perfectly taken corner kick. Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) gets on the end of it and produces a fantastic bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes inside the right post, increasing the score of today's match â€“ 2:2.
Wow, what an escape. Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) has an effort from inside the box but it's brilliantly blocked. Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick.
Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
A great pass puts Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) clear inside the box, he sidesteps the keeper but inexplicably hits his shot against the right post.
Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Lucien Favre prepares a substitution. Jacob Bruun Larsen is replaced by Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund).
Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) takes out his opponent with a nasty challenge and is relieved when the referee only gives him a booking.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) is given a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) is coming onto the pitch as Salomon Kalou cannot continue after picking up an injury.
That's the end of the game for Davie Selke, who is replaced by Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin).
The substitution is prepared. Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Marius Wolf.

Rune Jarstein pulls off a great save to deny Abdou Diallo (Dortmund) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) seems to have forgotten that he has already received a yellow card as he is surprised when the referee shows him a second one!

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Thomas Delaney (Dortmund) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) for Ondrej Duda.
Goal! Marco Reus (Dortmund) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the bottom right corner. 2:3.

It's been a while since that contentious challenge by Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), but referee Tobias Welz must have received some information as he makes the VAR signal. He's going to review and it could result in a red card!
Heâ€™s off! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) gets his marching orders from referee Tobias Welz after the VAR review.
Although Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) is just on the bench, Tobias Welz has awarded him with a yellow card. Unsporting behavior says the referee.
Jadon Sancho will be replaced by Omer Toprak (Dortmund).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
A precise first-time shot by Jonathas (Hannover) inside the box is unwittingly blocked by a defender.

What a finish by Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover)! He rises high to get to a rebound inside he box and produces a long-range header which goes into the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper was unable to keep the ball out of the net.
Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) takes a short pass in his stride and attempts to beat the keeper from mid-range, but the shot screeches just wide of the right post.
Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) attempts to score with a first-time shot from the edge of the box. His effort towards the right post is saved by Gregor Kobel.
Nicolai Muller (Hannover) wastes a big opportunity! He controls the ball after a nice low pass and shoots from a promising distance. His poor effort goes miles wide of the left post.
Michael Esser (Hannover) receives a yellow card.
Jonathas (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card.
Jonathas (Hannover) gets a precise pass from the edge of the box and swiftly strikes, but his shot misses to the left of the target.
Today's referee Manuel Grafe rightly decides to book Andre Hahn (Augsburg) for his harsh tackle.
Jonathas (Hannover) blew a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross deep inside the box, but his shot flew just over the bar.
Manuel Grafe has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) unleashes a brilliant effort from the free kick, but the ball crashes against the bar. What a chance!
Substitution. Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) in, Alfred Finnbogason out.
What an opportunity! Andre Hahn (Augsburg) smashed a first-time shot from the edge of the box, but the ball only crashed against the left post!
Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball into the bottom right corner, and thus alter the score to 1:1.
Thomas Doll has decided to substitute Nicolai Muller and he is replaced by Walace (Hannover).
Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) latches onto a nice cross into the area around the penalty spot, but plants his header just over the bar.
Substitution. Hendrik Weydandt makes his way off the pitch and Uffe Bech (Hannover) comes on as his replacement.

Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the bottom left corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 2:1.
Linton Maina (Hannover) gets a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Linton Maina trots off the pitch and is replaced by Florent Muslija (Hannover).
The referee gives a yellow card to Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover).
Goal! Kevin Danso finds Andre Hahn (Augsburg) with a clever pass. He steps inside his man on the edge of the box and whips a tremendous low shot into the middle of the goal. Fantasy football! 3:1.
That will be all from Ja-Cheol Koo who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg).
Jonathas (Hannover) latches on to a lofted pass and strikes the ball! His attempt flies narrowly over the bar. The goalkeeper was lucky!
Manuel Baum has decided to make a change. Fredrik Jensen (Augsburg) replaces Marco Richter.
Uffe Bech (Hannover) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Manuel Grafe didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Mark Uth (Schalke) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Goal! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) fires the rebound low into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity that was!

Golden opportunity! Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) lost his marker inside the box, only to shoot just wide of the left post after receiving a good pass. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.
Salif Sane (Schalke) struck the ball which rebounded to the edge of the box. His attempt went narrowly over the crossbar.
Mark Uth (Schalke) controls a reverse pass deep inside the box and smacks the ball low towards the middle of the goal, but the Peter Gulacsi anticipates well and smothers the ball.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and releases a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies painfully close to the right post.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Breel Embolo (Schalke) receives a diagonal pass, bursts into the box and shoots towards the bottom left corner. Peter Gulacsi is well positioned, though, and it's a comfortable save.
Guido Winkmann shows the yellow card to Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) for a heavy challenge.
Sebastian Rudy will be replaced by Ahmed Kutucu (Schalke).
Substitution. Emil Forsberg will be replaced by Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig).
Today's match ends for Mark Uth who will be replaced by Guido Burgstaller (Schalke).
Suat Serdar (Schalke) takes the rebound on the edge of the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and RB Leipzig will have a goal kick.
Amadou Haidara (RB Leipzig) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Kevin Kampl.

CHANCE! Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.
We are about to witness a substitution. Steven Skrzybski (Schalke) is replacing Suat Serdar.
A rebound falls to Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) in space inside the box. He looks up and fires in a powerful shot at goal that flies just over the bar.
Ralf Rangnick prepares a substitution. Timo Werner is replaced by Nordi Mukiele (RB Leipzig).
Bastian Oczipka (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Guido Winkmann had an easy-decision to make.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Alexander Esswein (VfB Stuttgart) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the bottom left corner. However, Oliver Baumann anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) gets inside the box and only has the keeper to beat, but smashes his shot just inches past the left post. He should have scored!
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) attempts to score from a mid-range free kick, but he curls his effort a few inches over the crossbar.
Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies onto the right post!
It's a goal! Ishak Belfodil plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 0:1.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart) for his blatant foul.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) sees his header crash off the left post after meeting a corner kick inside the six-yard box. The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
The substitution has been made. Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) has replaced Mario Gomez.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Joelinton (Hoffenheim) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
It's time for a substitution. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) comes on in place of Joelinton.
Steven Zuber (VfB Stuttgart) collects a delightful pass inside the box and nets with a perfect low drive into the middle of the goal. What a clinical finish!
Steven Zuber (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer had an easy-decision to make.
The referee shows a yellow card to Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart). No wonder. A clear yellow for bad language.
Ozan Kabak (VfB Stuttgart) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Substitution. Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Alexander Esswein walks off.
The game has begun to heat up. Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
Julian Nagelsmann decides to make a substitution. Kerem Demirbay will be replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Hoffenheim).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) replaces Nico Schulz.
Substitution. Steven Zuber walks off the pitch and Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Bastian Dankert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf) takes a wonderful free kick and curls the ball into the top left corner with an absolutely phenomenal strike!
What a goal that is! Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) gets to the ball inside the box and brilliantly lifts the ball over Michael Rensing and into the net. 1:1.
Referee Bastian Dankert makes the VAR signal and is going to check whether the goal can stand. Letâ€™s see what happens!
Bastian Dankert sticks with his original decision after the VAR review. No infringement and the goal stands!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Bastian Dankert has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Goal! Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 2:1.

Koen Casteels makes a brilliant save! Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes straight under the crossbar but is saved by the keeper!

A superb goal from great team play! Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the left post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Goal! Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 4:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aymen Barkok departs the field of play to be replaced by Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf).
Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect low strike, which goes inside the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Josip Brekalo leaves the pitch and Felix Klaus (Wolfsburg) comes on.
John Brooks (Wolfsburg) gets to the rebound and shoots, but the effort is blocked.

Jerome Roussillon (Wolfsburg) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Michael Rensing makes a great save to stop his effort.
Friedhelm Funkel decides to make a substitution. Adam Bodzek will be replaced by Marcel Sobottka (Dusseldorf).
A substitution has been made. Dodi Lukebakio goes off and Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf) comes on.
It will be a substitution. Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Admir Mehmedi walks off.
Felix Klaus (Wolfsburg) weaves through the defence and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score.
Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the left post.
Substitution. Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jerome Roussillon walks off.
Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
Wonder save! Kevin Stoger (Dusseldorf) picked up the ball and hit a beautiful curling shot from the edge of the box. Koen Casteels saw it late but somehow got his fingers to the ball to keep it out.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Pascal Stenzel passes the ball into the penalty area. Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) collects it and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner via the post! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:1!
Goal! Thorgan Hazard puts the ball on a plate for Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:1.
The B. Monchengladbach players celebrate the goal but the referee immediately signals a VAR review. Let's see what happens. Big moment in the game.
Referee Robert Kampka signals that the goal stands after the VAR review and the B. Monchengladbach have a reason to celebrate!

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) inside the box and he manages to steer it to the bottom left corner. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Yann Sommer makes a save in the nick of time to maintain the current score. The referee signals a corner kick to Freiburg.
Amir Abrashi (Freiburg) has tested the patience of referee Robert Kampka and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Robert Kampka blows his whistle to start the second half.
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) on for Denis Zakaria.
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) replaces Gian-Luca Waldschmidt.
Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach) for Lars Stindl.
Mike Frantz will be replaced by Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg).
Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
That's the end of the game for Jonas Hofmann, who is replaced by Raffael (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Vincenzo Grifo will be replaced by Lucas Holer (Freiburg).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Dawid Kownacki (Dusseldorf) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Friedhelm Funkel is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Dawid Kownacki suffers an injury and Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) comes on.
Matthias Zimmermann (Dusseldorf) latches onto a good pass inside the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper, but deflects off the right post to safety.
Martin Hinteregger (Eintracht Frankfurt) has tested the patience of referee Robert Hartmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.

Jonathan de Guzman sends a superb cross into the box. Goncalo Paciencia (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the roof of the net, leaving Michael Rensing beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
Martin Hinteregger (Eintracht Frankfurt) probably handled the ball inside the penalty area. Joy for one side, despair for the other as the referee gives a penalty to Dusseldorf!
Celebrations by Dusseldorf are cut short as the referee signals that the penalty decision will be checked using the VAR. Hopefully it wonâ€™t take too long.
The Dusseldorf players are stunned as referee Robert Hartmann changes his mind after a VAR review. NO PENALTY! Play to continue.
Substitution. Luka Jovic walks off the pitch and Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Robert Hartmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Here is a change. Aymen Barkok is going off and Friedhelm Funkel gives the last tactical orders to Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf).
Substitution. Alfredo Morales (Dusseldorf) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Marcel Sobottka walks off.
Adi Hutter has decided to substitute Jonathan de Guzman and he is replaced by Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) swings it in and Mijat Gacinovic gets on the end of it, but Michael Rensing shows good awareness and comes off his line to thwart the move.
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf) for his blatant foul.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) goes on mazy run which culminates with a one-on-one with the keeper. He keeps his cool and calmly dispatches the ball into the net.
It's in the back of the net! Filip Kostic is the provider as he slips the ball to Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 0:3.
The manager makes a subsitution with Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) coming on for Goncalo Paciencia.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Soren Storks ignores the protests.
What a wasted opportunity by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen)! He unleashed a powerful low shot from the centre of the box, but Michael Esser makes a decent save to thwart him.
Goal! Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 0:1.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Kevin Wimmer (Hannover) was quite harsh and Soren Storks didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
What a finish that is! Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) sees that Michael Esser is off his line and scores with a brilliant lob from the edge of the box. He makes it 0:2.
The game is interrupted.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) does well inside the box to bring down a pass from Aleksandar Dragovic. He gets away a decent shot but it creeps just past the right post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Thomas Doll probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Walace. He is replaced by Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover).
GOAL! Genki Haraguchi produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Jonathas (Hannover) rises high to head the ball into the bottom right corner and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:2.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Aranguiz walks off the pitch to be replaced by Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen).
Peter Bosz has decided to make a change. Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Leon Bailey.
The substitution is prepared. Florent Muslija (Hannover) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Linton Maina.
Bad communication between Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen) and the goalkeeper led to an own goal. Thumbs down. Well, let's see if he can correct his mistake with a strike into the opponent's goal.
Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Soren Storks had an easy-decision to make.
Julian Baumgartlinger rounds off a good move with a layoff to Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the box, he has a clear sight of goal but sends the ball just wide of the left post.
It's a goal! Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) bursts into the box to get on the end of a whipped in cross from Julian Brandt and scores magnificently from close range into the middle of the goal. 2:3.
It's time for a substitution. Martins Felipe (Hannover) comes on in place of Julian Korb.
Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) has tested the patience of referee Soren Storks and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Goal! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) managed to slot the ball past the keeper!
Amid all the celebrations by Bayer Leverkusen, the referee has gone over to the monitor to check the validity of the goal using VAR.
After what seems an eternity, referee Soren Storks decides there was an offside after using VAR to review the goal! NO GOAL for Bayer Leverkusen, play to continue.
Soren Storks is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
There's a break in play and referee Christian Dingert must have got a signal in his ear as he indicates he will check that earlier penalty claim by Hoffenheim using VAR. This could be interesting!
NO PENALTY after a VAR review! The Hoffenheim players are visibly unhappy with the call.
Stefan Posch (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.
Patrick Erras (Nurnberg) handles the ball and everyone in the stadium shouts 'handball'. Hoffenheim have been awarded a penalty kick!
This is a yellow card! Patrick Erras (Nurnberg) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Christian Mathenia into the bottom left corner.

What a sweet touch by Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) as he runs onto a pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive to the left side of the net. The keeper makes a superb save and pushes the ball against the post.
Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort came back off the right post!
Robert Bauer (Nurnberg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Sebastian Kerk.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Christian Dingert blows his whistle to start the second half.
Boris Schommers is forced to make a change. Enrico Valentini is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Timothy Tillman (Nurnberg).
It's in the back of the net! Mikael Ishak picks out Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 1:1.
Substitution. Stefan Posch is replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Leonardo Bittencourt (Hoffenheim) replacing Nadiem Amiri.
What a chance that is! Leonardo Bittencourt (Hoffenheim) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar.
Yuya Kubo comes off the pitch to be replaced by Lukas Jager (Nurnberg).
Goal - 2:1. Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) is first to the rebound and finds the back of the net with a brilliant back-heel finish.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Tim Leibold (Nurnberg) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and David Otto (Hoffenheim) will replace Ishak Belfodil.
Joelinton (Hoffenheim) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Patrick Erras (Nurnberg) blows a clear opportunity! He needed only to tap the ball in, but narrowly misses the goal.
Christian Dingert shows a yellow card to Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) for his blatant foul.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) beats a few defenders in the penalty area and drives a low shot towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper reacts superbly to make a wonderful save.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Markus Schmidt has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the bottom right corner, but he can't get the power to direct it past Yann Sommer, who gets down to save.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Anthony Ujah as he is replaced by Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz).
Goal! Tobias Strobl puts the ball on a plate for Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:1.
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Thorgan Hazard walks off.
Here is a change. Levin Oztunali is going off and Sandro Schwarz gives the last tactical orders to Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and can count himself very lucky that the referee didn't issue a red card.
That will be all from Danny Latza who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Pierre Kunde Malong (Mainz).

Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Jonas Hofmann and he is replaced by Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach).
The substitution is prepared. Michael Lang (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Alassane Plea.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Koen Casteels pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
It's in the back of the net! Thomas Muller plays it into the box, and Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 1:0.
Goal! Serge Gnabry feeds Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 2:0.
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
Goal! Thiago Alcantara slips it to James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom left corner with a great effort. The score is 3:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) will replace Javi Martinez.
Here is a change. Serge Gnabry is going off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical orders to Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Here comes a substitution. Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Admir Mehmedi.
CLOSE! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post!

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Koen Casteels guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) sends a rebound goalwards towards the top right corner, but the goalkeeper stretches to stop it. The ball is out of play. Bayern Munich win a corner kick.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Maximilian Arnold trots off the pitch and is replaced by Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg).
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) replaces James Rodriguez.
Goal! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) takes a short pass from Franck Ribery in his stride in the box, jinks inside his man and unleashes an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner. 4:0.

Goal! Franck Ribery hands Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) the simplest of tasks from close range after the cross evaded the keeper, and he makes no mistake with his header into the middle of the goal. 5:0.
Bruno Labbadia decides to make a substitution. Yannick Gerhardt will be replaced by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg).

Franck Ribery sends a superb cross into the box. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the right post, leaving Koen Casteels beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 6:0.
What was Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Close! Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Dortmund.

Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) had a good chance to change the score. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a low shot from just outside the penalty area which went towards the middle of the net, but the goalkeeper was ready and made an amazing save. Now Dortmund have a corner.
The end of the first half.
Benjamin Cortus blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Benjamin Cortus shows a yellow card to Steven Zuber (VfB Stuttgart) for his blatant foul.

It's been a while since that incident in the box, but the ref must have received some information as he makes the VAR signal. He's going to review that earlier penalty shout! What a chance for Dortmund.
Itâ€™s a PENALTY to Dortmund after the VAR review!
Goal! Marco Reus (Dortmund) puts the ball into the left side of the goal past the outstretched arm of Ron-Robert Zieler.
Yellow card. Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.

Ron-Robert Zieler was forced into action to thwart Paco Alcacer (Dortmund). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot towards the roof of the net but couldn't beat the keeper.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Marco Reus (Dortmund) was quite harsh and Benjamin Cortus didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Marius Wolf (Dortmund) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Cortus had an easy-decision to make.
Substitution. Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) in, Steven Zuber out.

Perfectly taken free kick!Gonzalo Castro sends a cross in and Marc-Oliver Kempf (VfB Stuttgart) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes low into the middle of the net and the score changes to 1:1.
Markus Weinzierl decides to make a substitution. Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez will be replaced by Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart).

Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) tries his luck from a long-range free kick and the ball is aimed to low to the middle, but Ron-Robert Zieler is alert and thwarts the effort. The ball goes out of play. Dortmund are awarded a corner kick.
The manager makes a subsitution with Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) coming on for Raphael Guerreiro.
Goal! Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the left side of the goal. It's 2:1.
Axel Witsel (Dortmund) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) replaces Marius Wolf.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a change. Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Emiliano Insua.
Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Paco Alcacer will be replaced by Thomas Delaney (Dortmund).
Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) makes good use of the scoring opportunity and slots the ball into the net!
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Good chance for Janik Haberer (Freiburg) as he latched on to a cross on the edge of the box and blasted the ball towards the net! It flew wide of the left post.
Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) picks up a yellow card for a foul.

Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up in the roof of the net, but Alexander Schwolow pulls off a decent save to thwart him. It will be a corner kick for Hertha Berlin.
It's a goal! Vincenzo Grifo sends a long raking pass onto the head of Nils Petersen (Freiburg), who makes no mistake from close in and sends the ball into the left side of the goal. 1:0.
Lukas Kubler is being substituted because of an injury. Christian Streich sends Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) on the pitch.
Robert Schroder shows a yellow card to Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.
Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) jumps highest to meet an accurate cross and heads the ball towards the net. His fine header whistles just inches wide of the right post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Schroder has ended it.
The second half has just started.
The game is over for Fabian Lustenberger. Arne Maier (Hertha Berlin) comes on for the second half.
Christian Streich makes a half-time substitution. Nico Schlotterbeck (Freiburg) comes on in place of Philipp Lienhart.
Today's referee Robert Schroder rightly decides to book Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.
Nico Schlotterbeck (Freiburg) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Substitution. Maximilian Mittelstadt did his best and is replaced by Dennis Jastrzembski (Hertha Berlin).

Mike Frantz (Freiburg) doesn't hesitate and begins a run towards the opponent's goal. Defenders try to tackle him, but he manages to keep the ball at his feet and pulls the trigger in front of the goal. The strike, though, was not as successful as the solo run and the ball is easily stopped by the keeper.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) attempts to head the ball away from inside the six-yard box, but unluckily he turns a cross from the resulting corner inside the right post of his own net.
Here is a change. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
The foul by Ibrahima Konate (RB Leipzig) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Sven Jablonski.
Sven Jablonski shows a yellow card to Kevin Danso (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.

Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the left side of the goal, but Gregor Kobel pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. Now RB Leipzig have a corner.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Sven Jablonski starts the second half.
That's the end of the game for Matheus Cunha, who is replaced by Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig).
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Sergio Cordova is replaced by Marco Richter (Augsburg).
Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) watches the ball all the way and fires a first-time shot goalwards from inside the box, but the effort flies just wide of the right post.
Here is a change. Tyler Adams is going off and Ralf Rangnick gives the last tactical orders to Bruma (RB Leipzig).
Ralf Rangnick decides to make a substitution. Konrad Laimer will be replaced by Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig).
A substitution has been made. Fredrik Jensen goes off and Christoph Janker (Augsburg) comes on.

Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. RB Leipzig win a corner.
What a save from Gregor Kobel! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
That's a clear yellow card. Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) goes into the book.
Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Breel Embolo (Schalke) collects a delightful pass inside the box and nets with a perfect low drive into the middle of the goal. What a clinical finish!
Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) converts a killer cross with a precise low shot that goes into the bottom left corner. What a brilliant finish!
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Referee Martin Petersen is happy with his original decision after the VAR review. Itâ€™s a PENALTY to Werder Bremen!
Goal! Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Alexander Nubel into the bottom left corner.
Substitution. Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Claudio Pizarro walks off.
Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.

What a beauty! Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) makes contact with a cross on the edge of the box and fires a daisy-cutter into the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper was unable to stop his rocket of a shot.
Substitution. Nabil Bentaleb makes way for Ahmed Kutucu (Schalke).

Alexander Nubel was forced into action to thwart Max Kruse (Werder Bremen). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Werder Bremen.
Rabbi Matondo (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Steven Skrzybski.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Fin Bartels (Werder Bremen) replacing Milot Rashica.
Goal! The corner is whipped in and Breel Embolo (Schalke) is in the right place at the right time, planting his header into the middle of the goal. He makes it 3:2.
Daniel Caligiuri is being substituted because of an injury. Domenico Tedesco sends Salif Sane (Schalke) on the pitch.
The manager makes a subsitution with Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) coming on for Max Kruse.
Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom left corner.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Chance! Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) was in a good position inside the box, but he couldn't connect with the pass as it was overhit.
Problems for Florian Kohfeldt as Sebastian Langkamp is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) replaces him.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Daniel Siebert starts the second half.
Bruno Labbadia makes a half-time substitution. Pavao Pervan (Wolfsburg) comes on in place of Koen Casteels.

Felix Klaus (Wolfsburg) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Jiri Pavlenka to get hold of the ball. Wolfsburg get a corner.

Superbly taken set piece! Maximilian Arnold takes the free kick and sends a cross into the six-yard box. John Brooks (Wolfsburg) flicks the ball lightly with his head towards the middle of the goal. Jiri Pavlenka can't react quickly enough and the score changes to 1:0.
Felix Klaus (Wolfsburg) latches onto a long ball into the box and unleashes a fine volley at goal, but flashes the effort just over the bar. That would have been a great goal!

Pavao Pervan receives ovations from the crowd. He manages to block a first-time effort from Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen), whose strike from the edge of the box was headed towards the right side of the goal. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Werder Bremen.

Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) reacted quickly inside the box and got on the end of the resulting corner. He smashed the ball towards the middle, but the goalkeeper pulled off a great reflex save.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) for a tough tackle.
The referee signals a substitution. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Milot Rashica.
It's in the back of the net! Maximilian Eggestein plays it into the box, and Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 1:1.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg) will replace Felix Klaus.
Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Daniel Siebert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a change. Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) replaces Philipp Bargfrede.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) times his leap well to meet the lofted pass from Max Kruse, but his close-range header slips just over the bar.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Goal! Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) is teed up on the edge of the box by Steven Zuber, and his howitzer of a shot low into the middle of the goal gives the keeper no chance. 1:0.

The ball was swung into the box by Gonzalo Castro from the corner kick. He perfectly found the head of Ozan Kabak (VfB Stuttgart), who planted a bullet header inside the left post to make the score 2:0.

What a wasted opportunity by Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the middle of the net, but Michael Esser makes a comfortable save to thwart him.

Goal! Gonzalo Castro sent in a fine cross from the corner kick. The perfect pass found Ozan Kabak (VfB Stuttgart) and his bullet header from around the penalty spot went into the middle of the goal. The score is 3:0.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Thomas Doll makes a switch. Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) is coming on in place of Martins Felipe at the start of the second period.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) comes off for Jonathas.
Genki Haraguchi (Hannover) slips past a defender on the edge of the box and hits a shot at goal that rises just over the bar.
Oliver Sorg (Hannover) has tested the patience of referee Bastian Dankert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Genki Haraguchi produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box where Jonathas (Hannover) rises high to head the ball off the woodwork into the bottom left corner. The score is now - 3:1.
Substitution. Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) has come on for Mario Gomez.
Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) gets a yellow card.
Bastian Dankert has issued a yellow card to Alexander Esswein (VfB Stuttgart).
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Steven Zuber (VfB Stuttgart) gets booked.
Thomas Doll has decided to substitute Pirmin Schwegler and he is replaced by Nicolai Muller (Hannover).
Steven Zuber (VfB Stuttgart) picks it up in space and from the edge of the box lashes in a shot that is deflected past the helpless Michael Esser. 4:1.
It's in the back of the net! Christian Gentner picks out Steven Zuber (VfB Stuttgart) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 5:1.
A substitution has been made. Steven Zuber goes off and Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Here is a change. Alexander Esswein is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart).
That's it for today, Bastian Dankert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the top right corner. The score is 0:1.
Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer had an easy-decision to make.
What a save! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) hits a powerful volley towards goal after finding some space, but the goalkeeper denies his effort with a stunning save.
Goal! A rebound wrong foots everyone except Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), and he slams the ball into the open net from close range. 0:2.
A goal, which was scored by Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach), was disallowed due to offside.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom left corner, but Yann Sommer pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.

Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) was close to scoring a goal after unleashing a first-time effort from inside the six-yard box. The ball was aimed towards the left post, but the goalkeeper read it well and pulled off a brilliant save to thwart the attempt.

Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Yann Sommer anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the right side of the target.
Thorgan Hazard feeds the ball through to Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the left side of the goal! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:2!
Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting set piece and aims a header towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes a superb save.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.

Goal! Thiago Alcantara plays in Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box he shoots into the top of the net! Great finish - 1:3.
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) picks up a yellow card.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) for his blatant foul.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Florian Neuhaus and he is replaced by Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach).
Yellow card. Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jonas Hofmann departs the field of play to be replaced by Raffael (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Michael Lang will be replaced by Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach).

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Yann Sommer, who pulls off a comfortable save!
Goal! 1:4. The ball rebounds to Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) after a melee in the box, and he easily beats the keeper from close range.
Niko Kovac prepares a substitution. James Rodriguez is replaced by Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Serge Gnabry leaves the pitch and Alphonso Davies (Bayern Munich) comes on.
The substitution is prepared. Woo-Yeong Jeong (Bayern Munich) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Thomas Muller.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) is penalised for holding. Felix Zwayer signals a set piece. It's a penalty to Bayern Munich! Let's see who's going to take it.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Yann Sommer into the bottom left corner.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
It's in the back of the net! Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) tries his luck from the edge of the box and his shot takes a deflection and goes past the stranded Alexander Schwolow. He makes it 1:0.
Peter Bosz is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Sven Bender suffers an injury and Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) gets to the ball in the penalty box and immediately fires a first-time effort. He didn't hit the ball properly and skies it high over the crossbar.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
There's some confusion. Looks like the ref is going to review the penalty decision to Bayer Leverkusen using VAR. Let's see what happens.
NO PENALTY! Referee Guido Winkmann has quickly reversed his decision to award a penalty after a VAR review. The Bayer Leverkusen players are incensed.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Alexander Schwolow stops the ball from going inside the left post.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) for Gian-Luca Waldschmidt.

Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf) leaps highest in the penalty area to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, and he produces a promising goal-bound header low towards the middle of the goal, but Christian Mathenia pulls off a comfortable save to deny him.

Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. B. Monchengladbach will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Nils Petersen (Freiburg), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 1:0.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the bottom right corner. However, Gregor Kobel anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.

The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Manuel Baum gives a chance to Kevin Danso (Augsburg) and Daniel Baier is off.
Dong-Won Ji plays a neat ball into the path of Rani Khedira (Augsburg), who makes room for a shot and sends in a low drive which bounces in off the left post! 3:1.
Hold on! Thereâ€™s a VAR review to see whether there was an offside in the build up to the goal. The referee is checking now. The Freiburg players arenâ€™t happy.
No offside! Referee Tobias Welz points to the centre spot to indicate that the goal stands after the VAR review. The Freiburg players celebrate.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Welz had an easy-decision to make.
Goal! Janik Haberer tees up Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the left side of the goal. 4:1.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) latches onto a good pass inside the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper, but deflects off the left post to safety.
It is time for a substitution. Fredrik Jensen (Augsburg) is on for Philipp Max.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) replaces Gian-Luca Waldschmidt.
Fantastic team goal! Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) was set free in the area by Janik Haberer and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the right side of the net. 5:1.
The substitution is prepared. Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Mike Frantz.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Chima Okoroji walks off the pitch to be replaced by Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg).
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) takes the chance to have an effort at goal from inside the box but misses to the left of the target.
Reece Oxford (Augsburg) makes a horrible challenge on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
The ball rebounds off the defender into the path of Stefan Bell (Mainz), who immediately strikes for goal from inside the box but sends it a whisker wide of the right post.

Danny Latza sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:0.
Anthony Ujah (Mainz) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the middle of the goal, but Alexander Nubel pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Sven Jablonski shows a yellow card to Danny Latza (Mainz) for his blatant foul.

Matija Nastasic (Schalke) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt to the right side of the goal fails to beat Florian Muller, who makes a sensational save.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Jeffrey Bruma (Schalke) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Sven Jablonski didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Alexander Nubel blocks a long-range effort from Levin Oztunali (Mainz) towards the bottom right corner.
Here is a change. Omar Mascarell is going off and Domenico Tedesco gives the last tactical orders to Amine Harit (Schalke).
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sven Jablonski had an easy-decision to make.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ahmed Kutucu (Schalke) is coming onto the pitch as Steven Skrzybski cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to make a change. Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) replaces Anthony Ujah.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Haji Wright (Schalke) replaces Jeffrey Bruma.
Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) sees a yellow card from Sven Jablonski after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Goal! Aaron Caricol plays a hopeful cross into a crowded box. Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) times his jump perfectly and sends a header into the bottom right corner from close in. 2:0.
