Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot low towards the middle of the goal was comfortably saved by Alexander Nubel.
Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Alexander Nubel with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 3:0.
Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Substitution. Jean-Paul Boetius walks off the pitch and Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to substitute Aaron Caricol and he is replaced by Niko Bungert (Mainz).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
Goal! Mario Gomez displays great vision and sends a pass to Steven Zuber (VfB Stuttgart), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 0:1.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) weaves through the defence and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) fails to turn the rebound in from a promising position. The goalkeeper pulls off a superb save and denies his effort. Corner kick. Stuttgart will have an opportunity.
Great solo effort from Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen)! He beat a couple of players and shot from the edge of the box, but the effort slips just wide of the right post.
What a sweet touch by Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Jiri Pavlenka to hold.
Nice piece of skill by Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen). He perfectly collected a pass from Max Kruse, then unleashed a fantastic long-range strike which went inside the left post. The score is 1:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
A substitution has been made. Marc-Oliver Kempf is replaced by Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart).
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Ozan Kabak (VfB Stuttgart) for a tough tackle.
Here comes a substitution. Mario Gomez is given a rest as he is replaced by Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart).
Florian Kohfeldt decides to make a substitution. Joshua Sargent will be replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).

Nuri Sahin (Werder Bremen) picks up the rebound inside the penalty area and drills a good shot to the middle of the goal. Ron-Robert Zieler shows how quick his reflexes are and dives superbly to stop the effort. What a save but what a wasted opportunity!
We are about to witness a subsitution. Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) for Nuri Sahin.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) meets a fine cross on the edge of the box from the resulting corner kick and shoots. His shot flies just wide of the left post.
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the left post is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper.
Substitution. Steven Zuber walks off the pitch and Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.
Ron-Robert Zieler (VfB Stuttgart) is punished with the yellow card.
A yellow card for a tackle by Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen). Robert Hartmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) replacing Davy Klaassen.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.

Eduard Lowen (Nurnberg) connects with a cross from the side and steers a header from around the penalty spot towards the goal. The ball goes in the right direction, but it's stopped by one of the defenders. The ball goes out for a corner. Nurnberg can continue in their attacking effort.
Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) is quickest inside the box and leaps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it floats just over the crossbar.
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and drills a shot to the middle of the goal, but is denied by a reflex save from Christian Mathenia.

Mario Gotze (Dortmund) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the left-hand post, but Christian Mathenia was alert and the score remains the same. The ball is out of play. Dortmund will have a chance to score from a corner.

A defender unwittingly blocks the ball on the line after a snap shot from Axel Witsel (Dortmund) inside the box following a slide rule pass. The ball is out of play and Dortmund manage to earn a corner.
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) latches onto the ball after a scramble in the box, but his placed effort towards the left side of the goal is far too weak and Christian Mathenia makes a simple save.

A neat pass is well received by Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the middle of the target. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.

Christian Mathenia pulls off a great save to deny Mario Gotze (Dortmund), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner. Now Dortmund have a corner.
Substitution. Maximilian Philipp will be replaced by Paco Alcacer (Dortmund).
Substitution. Adam Zrelak walks off the pitch and Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) comes on as a substitute.
The manager makes a subsitution with Robert Bauer (Nurnberg) coming on for Eduard Lowen.
Lucien Favre prepares a substitution. Thomas Delaney is replaced by Jacob Bruun Larsen (Dortmund).
Federico Palacios-Martinez (Nurnberg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Yuya Kubo.
Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) controls a cross inside the six-yard box, but sends his shot slightly wide of the left post.
Christian Mathenia (Nurnberg) picks up a caution.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Jacob Bruun Larsen (Dortmund) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Axel Witsel (Dortmund) for his blatant foul.
Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) outbattles the defender to win the ball from the corner, but he can't quite control his header and sends it just over the bar.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he arrows his header just a few inches wide of the right post.
Peter Bosz is forced to make a change. Karim Bellarabi is unable to continue due to injury, Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
It's in the back of the net! Kevin Volland plays it into the box, and Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 1:0.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Close! Markus Suttner (Dusseldorf) takes the resulting free kick from a promising positon, but his effort flies inches wide of the right post.
Problems for Friedhelm Funkel as Jean Zimmer is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Aymen Barkok (Dusseldorf) replaces him.

Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The referee blows his whistle, Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The foul by Oliver Fink (Dusseldorf) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Markus Schmidt.

Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up the rebound inside the penalty area and releases a good shot to the middle of the goal. Unfortunately for him, Jaroslav Drobny shows how quick his reflexes are and dives superbly to stop his effort. What a save but what a wasted opportunity!
Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) is booked.
Substitution. Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) in, Markus Suttner out.
Mitchell Weiser fires in a promising shot which ricochets off the goalkeeper back to Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the box and he sends the ball into the back of the net. The score is 2:0.
Substitution. Dawid Kownacki (Dusseldorf) on for Oliver Fink.
We are about to witness a substitution. Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) is replacing Julian Brandt.
Andre Hoffmann (Dusseldorf) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Markus Schmidt didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Here is a change. Kevin Volland is going off and Peter Bosz gives the last tactical orders to Paulinho (Bayer Leverkusen).
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Kevin Trapp scrambling, but it flies just wide of the left post.

Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Kevin Trapp leaps like a salmon to deny him. B. Monchengladbach have been awarded a corner kick.
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has tested the patience of referee Deniz Aytekin and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) wastes an opportunity. He finds himself in acres of space and fires in a terrific shot from long range towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one!
Goal! Danny da Costa (Eintracht Frankfurt) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the left post. He makes it 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Deniz Aytekin starts the second half.

Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for B. Monchengladbach.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Deniz Aytekin had an easy-decision to make.
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann makes way for Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach).
Here is a change. Florian Neuhaus is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Josip Drmic (B. Monchengladbach).
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) for his blatant foul.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a yellow card.
Golden chance! Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
The referee signals a substitution. Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) is brought on as a substitute for Christoph Kramer.
Gelson Fernandes is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Goal! Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot into the bottom left corner.
Adi Hutter has decided to substitute Ante Rebic and he is replaced by Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Sebastien Haller walks off the pitch and Goncalo Paciencia (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

OFF THE POST! Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the right post! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) latches on to a precise pass inside the box and drills in a superb strike that finds its way into the middle of the net.
Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Soren Storks and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) takes the set piece from outside the box. His shot heads towards the roof of the net, but Jiri Pavlenka dives and saves the effort, punching it onto the bar. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Hertha Berlin.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Soren Storks blows his whistle to start the second half.
The referee signals a substitution. Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) is brought on as a substitute for Jordan Torunarigha.
A great run by Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) gets him into the box, but his powerful shot is bravely blocked by a defender.
The foul by Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Soren Storks.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch so that Maximilian Eggestein can be given a rest.
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The substitution has been made. Joshua Sargent (Werder Bremen) has replaced Philipp Bargfrede.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) replacing Milot Rashica.
Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Soren Storks pulls out a yellow card.
Here is a change. Salomon Kalou is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Lukas Klunter (Hertha Berlin).
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender.
Ondrej Duda will be replaced by Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin).
Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen) is booked for saying more than Soren Storks was willing to tolerate.
Although Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) is just on the bench, Soren Storks has awarded him with a yellow card. Unsporting behavior says the referee.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) takes the free kick with a powerful low drive that goes inside the left-hand post and ends up behind the goalkeeper. A real jaw dropper!
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Goal! The ball breaks to Joelinton (Hoffenheim) after some poor defending, he finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and calmly puts the ball into the back of the net! He makes it 1:0.

It's in the back of the net! Kerem Demirbay floated in the free kick and the ball found the head of Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim), whose powerful header from near the penalty spot went straight into the roof of the net. The score is 2:0.
Wait! The referee has now indicated he wants to check if the goal for Hoffenheim can stand using VAR.
Referee Daniel Siebert takes one last look at the VAR monitor and decides that the goal stands! The Hoffenheim players go wild in celebration.
That was close by Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.

Kevin Wimmer (Hannover) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the right post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
It should have been a goal! Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) fires a rocket of a shot but it only hits the crossbar!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Daniel Siebert has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marvin Bakalorz trots off the pitch and is replaced by Takuma Asano (Hannover).
Joelinton (Hoffenheim) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Michael Esser pulls off a glorious save! Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) attempts to head home after a precise lofted cross. However, his effort only finds its way into the goalkeeper gloves.
A great pass puts Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) clear inside the box, he sidesteps the keeper but inexplicably hit his shot off the crossbar.
Nadiem Amiri (Hoffenheim) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked.
Wasted opportunity. Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) gets to the rebound inside the box and smashes the ball just wide of the right post.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Walace (Hannover) for his blatant foul.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) pounces on a pass inside the box but flashes his shot just over the bar. That was a great chance!
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header inches over the bar.
Substitution. Bobby Wood (Hannover) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jonathas walks off.
Thomas Doll has decided to substitute Walace and he is replaced by Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover).
Joelinton goes off the pitch and Leonardo Bittencourt (Hoffenheim) comes on.
A substitution has been made. Andrej Kramaric is replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Goal - 3:0! Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Nico Schulz provided an assist for the goal.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) is found in space by a decent pass, and he immediately hits a rocket of a shot at goal that clips the outside of the left post.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. David Otto (Hoffenheim) replaces Ishak Belfodil.
Daniel Siebert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Amir Abrashi (Freiburg) was quite harsh and Frank Willenborg didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
There's a break in play and referee Frank Willenborg must have got a signal in his ear as he indicates he will check that earlier penalty claim by Schalke using VAR. This could be interesting!
Here comes the refâ€™s decision after the VAR review. Itâ€™s not penalty to Schalke as the referee indicates there was no infringement!
Suat Serdar (Schalke) makes a horror tackle on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Christian Streich probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Lucas Holer. He is replaced by Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg).
Half-time substitution. Mike Frantz (Freiburg) is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt.

Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the bottom left corner. Ralf Fahrmann shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net. The referee blows his whistle, Freiburg are awarded a corner kick.
Close! Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.

A snap shot by Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) from the edge of the area flies towards the right side of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann produces a good save to thwart him. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Freiburg.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) replacing Amine Harit.
Philipp Lienhart (Freiburg) latched on to a precise cross, but his bullet header missed the target. He should have done much better.
Frank Willenborg shows a yellow card to Dominique Heintz (Freiburg) for his blatant foul.
There's some confusion. Looks like the ref is going to review the penalty decision to Schalke using VAR. Let's see what happens.
The Schalke playersâ€™ joy was short-lived as referee Frank Willenborg reverses his original decision after a VAR review. NO PENALTY!
Substitution. Ahmed Kutucu makes his way off the pitch and Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) comes on as his replacement.
Christian Gunter (Freiburg) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Here is a change. Janik Haberer is going off and Christian Streich gives the last tactical orders to Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg).
Substitution. Jeffrey Bruma (Schalke) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Rabbi Matondo walks off.
Frank Willenborg blows his whistle and Christian Gunter (Freiburg) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.
Play continues despite the shouts by some Stuttgart players for a penalty. Wait! Referee Felix Zwayer interrupts the game right now and he will review that decision using VAR! Let's see what happens.
The Stuttgart players are happy as the referee awards a PENALTY after the VAR review!
Goal! Steven Zuber (VfB Stuttgart) puts the ball into the bottom left corner past the outstretched arm of Peter Gulacsi.
Chance! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) took a nice pass in his stride in the box, but scuffed his shot just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stuttgart.
Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer had an easy-decision to make.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Ozan Kabak (VfB Stuttgart) meets a fine cross from the resulting set piece inside the penalty area and attempts to beat the keeper with a sweet header. That he does, but one of the defenders standing on the goal line manages to stop the effort going under the bar. Stuttgart will take a corner kick.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Emil Forsberg walks off the pitch to be replaced by Bruma (RB Leipzig).

Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the left side of the goal. However, Peter Gulacsi anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) unleashes a spectacular free kick from just outside the box, hitting the top left corner. The noise inside the stadium is tremendous at the moment.

An amazing individual effort from Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and makes it 1:3. Ron-Robert Zieler was helpless.
Here comes a substitution. Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) is brought on as a substitute for Gonzalo Castro.
Ralf Rangnick prepares a substitution. Timo Werner is replaced by Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig).
Markus Weinzierl has decided to substitute Andreas Beck and he is replaced by Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart).

That was a nice football moment. Alexander Esswein (VfB Stuttgart) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the right post. Peter Gulacsi guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! The referee points to the corner flag and Stuttgart will take a corner.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Borna Sosa (VfB Stuttgart) will replace Emiliano Insua.
Substitution. Yussuf Poulsen makes way for Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Great play by Josip Brekalo releases Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) in space on the edge of the box. He spots the keeper off his line and coolly puts the ball into bottom right corner. 1:0.
Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) tries to find Robin Quaison, but he puts too much power on the pass.
Robin Quaison will be replaced by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
William (Wolfsburg) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Florian Muller, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
Wait! The referee wants to check the penalty to Wolfsburg using VAR. He's heading over to the monitor now as the players anxiously wait.
Here comes the VAR decision: PENALTY to Wolfsburg!
Goal! Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) puts the ball into the bottom left corner past the outstretched arm of Florian Muller.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Renato Steffen trots off the pitch and is replaced by Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg).
Goal - 3:0! Yannick Gerhardt tees up Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom right corner and past Florian Muller.
It's time for a substitution. Anthony Ujah (Mainz) comes on in place of Jean-Paul Boetius.
Sandro Schwarz decides to make a substitution. Danny Latza will be replaced by Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz).
Josip Brekalo goes off the pitch and Felix Klaus (Wolfsburg) comes on.
We are about to witness a substitution. Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg) is replacing Josuha Guilavogui.
Benjamin Cortus is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
What bad luck! Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) got in the way of a pass and unintentionally sent the ball past his own goalkeeper. The score is 1:0.
Golden chance! Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
What a hit! Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot low into the middle of the net. 1:1.
Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and fires the ball into the roof of the net in trademark fashion.
Goal! Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) receives a well-taken defence-splitting pass inside the box and fires the ball past the goalkeeper.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, David Alaba (Bayern Munich) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom right corner. Good team effort!
Today's match ends for James Rodriguez who will be replaced by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich).
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Niko Kovac decides to make a substitution. Serge Gnabry will be replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Here comes a substitution. Marco Richter (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Konstantinos Stafylidis.
Bibiana Steinhaus shows a yellow card to Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Marco Richter (Augsburg) sees a yellow card from Bibiana Steinhaus after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee signals a substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Jan Moravek.
Niko Kovac has decided to substitute Thiago Alcantara and he is replaced by Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich).
Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) picks up a caution.
Bibiana Steinhaus is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Benjamin Pavard (VfB Stuttgart) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Marcin Kaminski (Dusseldorf) picks up a yellow card.
Dodi Lukebakio produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) rises high to head the ball into the left side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:0.
Alexander Esswein (VfB Stuttgart) has too much to say to the referee and is cautioned.
Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) is yellow-carded.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Christian Dingert blows his whistle to start the second half.
We are about to witness a substitution. Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) is replacing Steven Zuber.

Goal! Oliver Fink (Dusseldorf) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the top right corner. Ron-Robert Zieler had no chance of reaching it. The score is 2:0.
A substitution has been made. Christian Gentner goes off and Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Here is a change. Oliver Fink is going off and Friedhelm Funkel gives the last tactical orders to Alfredo Morales (Dusseldorf).
Ozan Kabak (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
The substitution has been made. Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) has replaced Jean Zimmer.
Substitution. Erik Thommy makes his way off the pitch and Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as his replacement.
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to make a change. Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) replaces Kenan Karaman.
GOAL! Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Ron-Robert Zieler, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 3:0.
The booking goes to Kevin Stoger (Dusseldorf).

It's been a while since that contentious challenge by Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart), but referee Christian Dingert must have received some information as he makes the VAR signal. He's going to review and it could result in a red card!
Yellow card. Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Referee Christian Dingert seems to have made up his mind after reviewing the incident using VAR, and itâ€™s RED for Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Gregor Kobel is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.

Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) leaps highest in the penalty area to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, and he produces a promising goal-bound header low towards the middle of the goal, but Gregor Kobel pulls off a comfortable save to deny him.

Reece Oxford (Augsburg) has a big opportunity to score! He climbs highest deep inside the penalty box and strikes a powerful header towards the goal. Next time he should aim better as his effort flies narrowly over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen will have a goal kick.
Goal! Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 2:0.

Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) scores with a great individual effort! He makes a good run, skips past defenders and fires the ball from the edge of the box past the diving goalkeeper. The shot went into the top right corner. Absolutely phenomenal!
Milot Rashica is substituted due to injury. Florian Kohfeldt gives a chance to Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen).
Lovely run from Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg). He finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper, lines up a shot, but the keeper boldly launches himself to intercept the ball.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) pounces on a pass inside the box but flashes his shot just over the bar. That was a great chance! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Augsburg.
It is time for a substitution. Fredrik Jensen (Augsburg) is on for Philipp Max.
A yellow card for a tackle by Daniel Baier (Augsburg). Manuel Grafe doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Alfred Finnbogason as he is replaced by Andre Hahn (Augsburg).
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to substitute Johannes Eggestein and he is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).

Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the bottom left corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 4:0.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a change. Joshua Sargent (Werder Bremen) replaces Max Kruse.
Daniel Baier is being substituted because of an injury. Manuel Baum sends Jozo Stanic (Augsburg) on the pitch.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Here is an example of luck not being on your side. Jeffrey Bruma (Schalke) puts the ball into the back of the net but, unfortunately for him, it's into his own goal!

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a brilliant save.
Goal! Weston McKennie shows great vision to find Ahmed Kutucu (Schalke) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
Goal - 2:1! James Rodriguez tees up Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) inside the box and he curls the ball into the left side of the net and past Ralf Fahrmann.
The manager makes a subsitution with Omar Mascarell (Schalke) coming on for Sebastian Rudy.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the bottom left corner, but Sven Ulreich pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Sven Ulreich makes a great save to stop his effort.
Weston McKennie (Schalke) hides his face in shame! He wastes a great chance to score from a rebound, sending his effort only onto the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Suat Serdar leaves the pitch and Amine Harit (Schalke) comes on.
A cross arrives in the goalmouth from the resulting corner kick. Jeffrey Bruma (Schalke) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the left post!
Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) finds some space inside the box and scores with a terrific header low inside the left post, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Substitution. Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) replaces Kingsley Coman.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to make a change. Mark Uth (Schalke) replaces Ahmed Kutucu.
We are about to witness a substitution. Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) is replacing James Rodriguez.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Jeffrey Bruma (Schalke) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Serge Gnabry walks off the pitch and Alphonso Davies (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

What a huge chance for Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.
Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Martin Petersen and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for B. Monchengladbach.

Rune Jarstein was forced into action to thwart Michael Lang (B. Monchengladbach). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom right corner but couldn't beat the keeper.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Yann Sommer is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:1.
Jonas Hofmann is being substituted because of an injury. Dieter Hecking sends Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) on the pitch.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Martin Petersen has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Goal! Davie Selke provides Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 0:2.
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Michael Lang.
Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) attempts to delay the restart of play. The referee doesn't like it. Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) is cautioned by the referee.
What a sweet touch by Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Yann Sommer to hold.

Goal! Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) peels away from his marker to meet the resulting free kick from Ondrej Duda, and he steers a powerful header from near the penalty spot inside the left post. What a finish that is - 0:3!
Here comes a substitution. Tobias Strobl is given a rest as he is replaced by Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach).
Ondrej Duda will be replaced by Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
The goal for Dortmund is subject to a VAR review by the referee! He's obviously unsure or he received a message.
Referee Marco Fritz takes one last look at the VAR monitor and decides there was an offside. NO GOAL, much to the annoyance of the Dortmund players!
Lukasz Piszczek has a look up and finds Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) in space. He wastes no time in trying to test the keeper from distance but the shot is just wide of the left post.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) for his blatant foul.
Goal! Lukasz Piszczek tees up Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Goal! Mario Gotze (Dortmund) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 2:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Julian Nagelsmann has made a change at the break. Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) has come on in place of Andrej Kramaric.
Half-time substitution. Kerem Demirbay will not participate anymore and Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) is coming on.
Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Dortmund.

Joelinton (Hoffenheim) accelerated away from the defence and took his shot early from the edge of the box. The ball flew towards the left side of the goal, but Roman Burki made a superb athletic save to deny him. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick.
A pass into the box finds Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the bottom left corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Roman Burki denies him.
Goal - 3:0! Mario Gotze laid the ball off to Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund), who shot from close range low into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) for Maximilian Philipp.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) replacing Leonardo Bittencourt.

What a great chance for Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header right under the bar, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save. The ball goes out of play. Hoffenheim are awarded a corner kick.

Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball hits the left post and ricochets away.

It's a goal! Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Pavel Kaderabek. The score is now 3:1.
Mario Gotze will be replaced by Omer Toprak (Dortmund).
Brilliant finish! Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) gathers a cross and steers a bullet header which bounces in off the left post.

Goal! Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) peels away from his marker to meet the resulting free kick from Dennis Geiger, and he steers a powerful header from near the penalty spot low inside the right post. What a finish that is - 3:3!
The main referee, Marco Fritz, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) is given a yellow card for dissent.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marius Wolf (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch so that Raphael Guerreiro can be given a rest.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Jerome Roussillon (Wolfsburg) takes a short pass from Josip Brekalo in his stride in the box, jinks inside his man and unleashes an unstoppable shot into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) for his blatant foul.
What a goal! Florian Niederlechner plays it to Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Koen Casteels into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.

Robin Koch (Freiburg) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Felix Brych blows his whistle for a foul. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to Wolfsburg.
Robin Koch (Freiburg) has tested the patience of referee Felix Brych and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Goal! Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Alexander Schwolow into right side of the goal.
It must be a yellow card. It is. William (Wolfsburg) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Christian Streich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) replacing Mike Frantz.

Nils Petersen (Freiburg) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the top left corner. The goalkeeper had no chance to react. The score is now 2:2.
It's 2:3! Wout Weghorst feeds Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the left side of the net.
The substitution has been made. Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg) has replaced Renato Steffen.
Substitution. Florian Niederlechner leaves the pitch and is replaced by Lucas Holer (Freiburg).
What a goal! Nils Petersen plays it to Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg), who finds himself unmarked inside the box and slots a first-time shot past Koen Casteels into the top left corner. 3:3.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Felix Klaus (Wolfsburg) replaces Wout Weghorst.
Dominique Heintz (Freiburg) heads in a well-placed corner kick. His perfect header flies inside the left post with majestic precision.
Wait a minute! The referee has decided to review the goal using the VAR system.
The goal by Freiburg won't count as it has been disallowed due to offside on the advice of the video assistant referee!
Here is a change. Josip Brekalo is going off and Bruno Labbadia gives the last tactical orders to Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Vincenzo Grifo departs the field of play to be replaced by Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg).
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Simon Rhein (Nurnberg) is shown a red card by the referee for a horror tackle that simply has no place in football!

Torless Knoll (Nurnberg) connects with a cross inside the box and shoots towards the left post, but the goalkeeper reacts superbly to keep it out. World class save! The ball goes behind for a corner. Nurnberg will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Nurnberg.
Walace (Hannover) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Welz had an easy-decision to make.

Waldemar Anton (Hannover) received a pass and didn't think long what to do with it. He fired a powerful long-range shot which went painfully close to the right post. The ball goes out of play and Nurnberg will have a goal kick.
Thomas Doll prepares a substitution. Kevin Akpoguma is replaced by Kevin Wimmer (Hannover).
GOAL! Nicolai Muller (Hannover) scores with a header from close range after Hendrik Weydandt headed a pin-point lofted cross into his path. It's 1:0.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Tobias Welz starts the second half.
Jonathas (Hannover) has a goal ruled out for offside!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alexander Fuchs (Nurnberg) comes onto the pitch for Federico Palacios-Martinez.
Thomas Doll has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Bobby Wood (Hannover) replacing Hendrik Weydandt.
Nicolai Muller (Hannover) receives a diagonal pass, bursts into the box and shoots towards the right side of the goal. Christian Mathenia is well positioned, though, and it's a comfortable save.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Adam Zrelak (Nurnberg) for his blatant foul.
Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Michael Kollner has decided to substitute Torless Knoll and he is replaced by Yuya Kubo (Nurnberg).
Goal! Nicolai Muller (Hannover) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.
That's the end of the game for Nicolai Muller, who is replaced by Iver Fossum (Hannover).
A promising move ends with a clever pass to Lukas Muhl (Nurnberg), who hits a first-time shot at goal that rises just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.
Here is a change. Enrico Valentini is going off and Michael Kollner gives the last tactical orders to Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.

Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to get on the end of the resulting corner kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly over the crossbar.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) sees a yellow card from Guido Winkmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Peter Gulacsi to dive and make a save.
Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Guido Winkmann had an easy-decision to make.
Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) leaps highest in the middle of the box to meet a lofted ball and powers a header at a goal, but unfortunately for him it flies just over the bar.
Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) picks up a yellow card.
Here comes a substitution. Sebastian Rode is given a rest as he is replaced by Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) finds some space inside the box to connect with the resulting corner kick. He wallops the ball towards the top right corner, but it's finally blocked by one of the defenders. Maybe next time.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) wasted a chance to score! He pinged a fine header from deep inside the box towards the net, but his aim was off and it flew narrowly wide of the right post.
What an opportunity! Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) smashed a first-time shot from the edge of the box, but the ball only crashed against the left post!
The manager makes a subsitution with Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) coming on for Konrad Laimer.
Here's the change. Ante Rebic leaves the pitch and Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) latches onto a long ball into the box and unleashes a fine volley at goal, but flashes the effort just over the bar. That would have been a great goal!
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
It's a yellow card for Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Timo Werner goes off the pitch and Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig) comes on.
Golden chance! Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
The substitution is prepared. Tyler Adams (RB Leipzig) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Marcel Sabitzer.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
It's in the back of the net! Karim Bellarabi sprays a pass out to Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 0:1.

A superb goal from great team play! Robin Quaison (Mainz) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the right post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.

Goal! Great link up play between Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) and Julian Brandt gives the former a clear sight of goal on the edge of the box. He doesn't disappoint and beats the keeper in the bottom left corner. 1:2.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) latches onto a good pass inside the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper, but deflects off the crossbar to safety.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen). Kevin Volland plays a fantastic through ball and finds Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the right side of the goal. It's now 1:3.
Good chance! Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) nicely turned his man inside the box but placed his effort just wide of the right post. He should have scored!
Pierre Kunde Malong (Mainz) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Schroder ignores the protests.
Robert Schroder shows a yellow card to Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Aaron Caricol (Mainz) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!
Goal! Great play by Julian Brandt releases Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) in space on the edge of the box. He spots the keeper off his line and coolly puts the ball into bottom left corner. 1:4.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) is coming onto the pitch as Pierre Kunde Malong cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Robin Quaison (Mainz) sees a yellow card from Robert Schroder after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aaron Caricol leaves the pitch and Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) comes on.
Peter Bosz prepares a substitution. Kai Havertz is replaced by Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen).
Goal! Kevin Volland provides Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom right corner. 1:5.
Substitution. Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) on for Jean-Paul Boetius.
Substitution. Wendell makes his way off the pitch and Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as his replacement.
Peter Bosz decides to make a substitution. Julian Brandt will be replaced by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).
Today's referee Robert Schroder rightly decides to book Leandro Barreiro Martins (Mainz) for his harsh tackle.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom left corner.
Lucas Holer (Freiburg) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Deniz Aytekin had an easy-decision to make.

Alexander Esswein (VfB Stuttgart) dribbles his way to the edge of the box and drills a shot towards the top right corner, but Alexander Schwolow is equal to the effort and makes a good save. Stuttgart will take a corner kick.
The ball rebounds off the defender into the path of Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart), who immediately strikes for goal from inside the box but sends it a whisker wide of the right post.
Manuel Gulde is substituted due to injury. Christian Streich gives a chance to Keven Schlotterbeck (Freiburg).
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Markus Weinzierl decides to make a substitution. Anastasios Donis will be replaced by Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart).
Lucas Holer (Freiburg) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the right post.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Vincenzo Grifo (Freiburg) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the right side of the goal, but Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a brilliant save.

Alexander Schwolow was forced into action to thwart Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot towards the roof of the net but couldn't beat the keeper. Stuttgart have been awarded a corner kick.
Benjamin Pavard (VfB Stuttgart) lunges into his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Here comes a substitution. Christian Gentner is given a rest as he is replaced by Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart).
Keven Schlotterbeck (Freiburg) rises highest from the corner and heads at goal, but his effort towards the top left corner is saved by Ron-Robert Zieler.
Ozan Kabak (VfB Stuttgart) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot inside the right post.
Substitution. Lucas Holer (Freiburg) leaves the pitch and is replaced by Jerome Gondorf.
Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes just a few inches over the bar! What a huge opportunity!
Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom left corner. Magnificent finish!
The referee signals a substitution. Florian Niederlechner is brought on as a substitute for Dominique Heintz (Freiburg).
The game is interrupted. Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Substitution. Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Alexander Esswein.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) does not realise that he has already received a yellow card and is shocked when the referee shows him a second one!
Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg) received a pass and didn't think long what to do with it. He fired a powerful long-range shot which went painfully close to the bar.
It's in the back of the net! Jerome Gondorf is the provider as he slips the ball to Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 2:2.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) handles the ball and everyone in the stadium shouts 'handball'. Augsburg are given a penalty!
Goal! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Florian Muller into right side of the goal.

Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Florian Muller. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Augsburg.
Moussa Niakhate (Mainz) changes the direction of the ball using his hand, but he is angry when the referee gives a foul against him. Augsburg are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.
Referee Soren Storks gets a signal in his ear and goes over to the VAR monitor to check whether itâ€™s a penalty!
Referee Soren Storks awards a PENALTY after the VAR review!
Goal! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Florian Muller into the bottom left corner.
Sandro Schwarz is forced to make a change. Danny Latza is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Alexandru Maxim (Mainz).

Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Florian Muller leaps like a salmon to deny him.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
Goal! Jan Moravek displays great vision and sends a pass to Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball inside the left post. The score is 3:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jean-Philippe Mateta trots off the pitch and is replaced by Anthony Ujah (Mainz).
Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) sends in a direct shot from a dangerously positioned free kick. The ball sails towards the left post, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save.
That will be all from Dong-Won Ji who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg).
Here is a change. Bote Baku is going off and Sandro Schwarz gives the last tactical orders to Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
Here's the change. Alfred Finnbogason leaves the pitch and Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) comes on as a substitute.
Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) places a shot at goal from the edge of the box that bends just wide of the right post.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) was quite harsh and Soren Storks didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Jan Moravek will be replaced by Reece Oxford (Augsburg).
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) latches onto a good pass inside the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper, but deflects off the crossbar to safety.

Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Ralf Fahrmann is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) executes a nice mid-range free kick. His effort only flies inches wide of the left post. Today is obviously not his lucky day.
Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Marco Fritz had an easy-decision to make.
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Alexander Nubel (Schalke) makes a horrible challenge on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
A substitution has been made. Evgen Konoplyanka is replaced by Ralf Fahrmann (Schalke).
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Tobias Strobl will be replaced by Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach).

Michael Lang dinks a cheeky lofted pass into Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach), but his headed effort from near the penalty spot goes narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Schalke will have a goal kick.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) for his blatant foul.

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) sends a direct shot in from the free kick that's in a promising position. The ball sails towards the underside of the crossbar, but the goalkeeper prevents a goal with a quick save.
Substitution. Sebastian Rudy makes his way off the pitch and Rabbi Matondo (Schalke) comes on as his replacement.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Denis Zakaria.
A substitution has been made. Jonas Hofmann goes off and Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
Goal! Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) is teed up on the edge of the box by Thorgan Hazard, and his howitzer of a shot inside the right post gives the keeper no chance. 0:1.
It's in the back of the net! Thorgan Hazard picks out Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 0:2.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Great solo effort by Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) as he tricks his way through the defence before firing a low drive from just outside of the box towards the middle of the goal. Lukas Hradecky is alert and denies him.
The yellow card is received by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen).
The foul by Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Stieler.
Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Thomas Muller showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 0:1.
Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) has picked up an injury and is replaced by Julian Baumgartlinger.
Goooooal for Bayern Munich! But referee Tobias Stieler straight away wants to review it with VAR, presumably for a possible offside in the build-up.
Celebrations are cut short for Bayern Munich as the referee indicates NO GOAL after the VAR review shows it was offside!
Tobias Stieler has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
The booking goes to Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich).

Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes inside the left post and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 1:1.
It's a goal! Karim Bellarabi plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 2:1.
A substitution has been made. Thomas Muller goes off and Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) comes on.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card.
Here's the change. James Rodriguez leaves the pitch and Alphonso Davies (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
It will be a substitution. Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) is ready to enter the pitch as Rafinha walks off.
Peter Bosz decides to make a substitution. Leon Bailey will be replaced by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).
It's in the back of the net! Julian Brandt sprays a pass out to Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 3:1.
The ball is in the net, but referee Tobias Stieler makes the VAR signal straight away as he clearly wants to check for an offside that may alter his decision. Letâ€™s see what happens!
Here comes the VAR verdict: Referee Tobias Stieler signals that there was no offside and the goal stands! The Bayer Leverkusen players celebrate.
Peter Bosz has decided to make a change. Paulinho (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Karim Bellarabi.

What a chance that is! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly wide of the left post.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.

Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going in the bottom left corner, but Roman Burki has other ideas and makes a brilliant save. The referee signals a corner kick to Eintracht Frankfurt.
Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Zwayer had an easy-decision to make.

Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) receives a short pass inside a congested penalty area and takes a first-time shot. The effort heads towards the middle of the goal but Kevin Trapp blocks the shot with his legs. Dortmund have a corner.
Goal! Raphael Guerreiro rounded the goalkeeper and sent a sweet pass to Marco Reus (Dortmund), who had an easy finish to put it into an empty net. 0:1.
A rebound spins to Marco Reus (Dortmund) inside the box, but his sliced shot flies just wide of the left post.
OFF THE BAR! Marco Reus (Dortmund) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and fires a bullet of a shot that crashes against the crossbar.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Sebastian Rode (Eintracht Frankfurt) for his blatant foul.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was!

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Roman Burki guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
It's in the back of the net! Danny da Costa plays it into the box, and Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 1:1.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
It is time for a substitution. Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is on for Luka Jovic.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the left post. Roman Burki has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. It's going to be a corner kick.
Felix Zwayer shows the yellow card to Thomas Delaney (Dortmund) for a heavy challenge.
Substitution. Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) on for Jadon Sancho.

Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Kevin Trapp is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Dortmund.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Julian Weigl (Dortmund) was quite harsh and Felix Zwayer didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Jacob Bruun Larsen (Dortmund) replaces Raphael Guerreiro.
Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) failed to convert a mid-range free kick and sends the ball narrowly over the bar.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mario Gotze (Dortmund) will replace Paco Alcacer.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Jerome Roussillon (Wolfsburg) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but Rune Jarstein pulls off a comfortable save.
Jerome Roussillon (Wolfsburg) pounces on the rebound inside the penalty box and tries to prod home! Unluckily for his team, the ball crashes against the crossbar!
Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) is in a good position inside the six-yard box to head a rebound home, but he is not precise enough and the ball flies away off the bar.
Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) drives into the box and hits a tremendous shot that, unluckily for him, flashes just wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.

GOAL! Superb work from Jerome Roussillon, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg), who beats Rune Jarstein with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
It will be a substitution. Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) is ready to enter the pitch as Vedad Ibisevic walks off.
Substitution. Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) has come on for Marvin Plattenhardt.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) replaces Renato Steffen.
It's time for a substitution. Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) comes on in place of Arne Maier.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) was quite harsh and Bastian Dankert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball down to the middle of the goal. Koen Casteels shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) fails to turn the rebound in from a promising position. The goalkeeper pulls off a superb save and denies his effort.
Substitution. Yunus Malli makes way for William (Wolfsburg).
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) for his blatant foul.
The game has begun to heat up. Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to substitute Elvis Rexhbecaj and he is replaced by Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.

Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) bursts into the box after a fine solo run. He looks up and tries to rifle a shot into the middle of the goal, but Oliver Baumann makes a great save to deny him his moment of glory. The linesman makes the right call and Dusseldorf will have a corner.
A brilliant cross into the box finds Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf), who directs his header towards the left post, but the goalkeeper shows all his agility and makes an astonishing save.
Adam Bodzek (Dusseldorf) is penalised for holding. Benjamin Cortus signals a set piece. Hoffenheim are about to take a penalty!
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Michael Rensing into the bottom right corner.
The referee shows the yellow card to Alfredo Morales (Dusseldorf).
This is a yellow card! Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.

Joshua Brenet (Hoffenheim) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the roof of the net. His effort, however, is blocked by Michael Rensing, who pulls off a stunning save! The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim have been awarded a corner kick.
What was Matthias Zimmermann (Dusseldorf) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Benjamin Cortus starts the second half.
It's a goal! Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) bursts into the box to get on the end of a whipped in cross from Kevin Stoger and scores magnificently from close range into the right side of the goal. 1:1.
Joelinton (Hoffenheim) is booked for saying more than Benjamin Cortus was willing to tolerate.
Stefan Posch (Hoffenheim) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf) launches himself at the ball from the free kick and produces a header which lacks accuracy, sending it just over the bar.
Substitution. Nadiem Amiri walks off the pitch and Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to make a change. Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) replaces Marvin Ducksch.
Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Michael Rensing stops the ball from going inside right post.
Substitution. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) replaces Joshua Brenet.
Niko Giesselmann (Dusseldorf) hits an explosive shot from outside the penalty area and forces the goalkeeper to make a good save.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) for Joelinton.
Oliver Fink (Dusseldorf) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) misses a chance to score! He produces a header from inside the box, but it goes narrowly over the crossbar.
The referee signals a substitution. Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) is brought on as a substitute for Rouwen Hennings.
Michael Rensing (Dusseldorf) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kevin Stoger leaves the pitch and Robin Bormuth (Dusseldorf) comes on.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Vura (Nurnberg) for his blatant foul.
Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Kampka had an easy-decision to make.

Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Corner kick. Werder Bremen will have an opportunity.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Florian Kohfeldt makes a switch. Joshua Sargent (Werder Bremen) is coming on in place of Milot Rashica at the start of the second period.
Half-time substitution. Martin Harnik will not participate anymore and Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) is coming on.
Michael Kollner makes a half-time substitution. Kevin Goden (Nurnberg) comes on in place of Tim Leibold.
Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.
Substitution. Vura is replaced by Sebastian Kerk (Nurnberg).

Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Werder Bremen.
Adam Zrelak (Nurnberg) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Ondrej Petrak (Nurnberg) was quite harsh and Robert Kampka didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card. Werder Bremen will take a free kick.
Substitution. Federico Palacios-Martinez makes his way off the pitch and Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) comes on as his replacement.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to substitute Nuri Sahin and he is replaced by Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen).
Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to release a low effort which ends up in the bottom right corner.
Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) is given a yellow card.
Robert Kampka is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
The booking goes to Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover).
You don't see this every day. Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig) takes the corner but his cross crashes against the crossbar!
Kevin Akpoguma (Hannover) brings his opponent down with a tackle and Daniel Schlager blows his whistle for a foul. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for RB Leipzig!
Goal! Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) puts the ball into the bottom right corner past the outstretched arm of Michael Esser.
Whoa! Such gestures are commonly penalised and Jonathas (Hannover) duly receives a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Daniel Schlager blows his whistle to start the second half.
Ralf Rangnick has made a change at the break. Yvon Mvogo (RB Leipzig) has come on in place of Peter Gulacsi.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Florent Muslija will be replaced by Bobby Wood (Hannover).
Ibrahima Konate (RB Leipzig) is given a fully deserved yellow card.

Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the bottom left corner. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 0:2.
That will be all from Takuma Asano who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover).
Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Schlager had an easy-decision to make.
Ralf Rangnick decides to make a substitution. Matheus Cunha will be replaced by Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig).

Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Emil Forsberg. His header bounced off the ground and went behind the goalkeeper into the middle of the net. It's 0:3.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) for Diego Demme.
