Golden opportunity! Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) lost his marker inside the box, only to shoot just wide of the left post after receiving a good pass. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Goal! Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.
GOAL! Ibrahima Konate (RB Leipzig) got to the ball in front of the goal and he couldn't miss from there. His low drive went in off the right-hand post. The score is 0:2.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a precise shot inside the left post. What a lovely finish!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Hartmann has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Friedhelm Funkel makes a switch. Marvin Ducksch (Dusseldorf) is coming on in place of Benito Raman at the start of the second period.
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to make a change. Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) replaces Oliver Fink.
Marvin Ducksch (Dusseldorf) was probably a bit loose with his words to Robert Hartmann, who decides to show him a yellow.

Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) gets into a good scoring position. He creates some space for himself and tries his luck from distance. His decent effort towards the bottom left corner is, however, superbly saved by Michael Rensing!
Goal! Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 0:4.
Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf) attempts to surprise the keeper with a nice shot, but the ball goes narrowly wide of the left post.
We are about to witness a substitution. Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) is replacing Diego Demme.
Friedhelm Funkel decides to make a substitution. Dodi Lukebakio will be replaced by Aymen Barkok (Dusseldorf).
Here comes a substitution. Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) is brought on as a substitute for Timo Werner.
Here is a change. Marcel Sabitzer is going off and Ralf Rangnick gives the last tactical orders to Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig).
Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig) tries his luck and takes a shot from inside the box. His effort on goal is blocked by a defender.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) shows perfect technique and produces a first-time effort from just outside the box that goes into the bottom left corner. It's 1:0.

What a beautiful moment! Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the top right corner. Manuel Neuer just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 1:1.
The game is interrupted. David Alaba (Bayern Munich) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Ozan Kabak (VfB Stuttgart) gets on the end of a defence splitting pass inside the box and immediately directs a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the Manuel Neuer makes a great save.
Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) has to stretch for the ball in the box and sends it just wide of the left post.
Frank Willenborg has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Niko Kovac has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) comes on the pitch for Javi Martinez.
OWN GOAL! Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 2:1.
Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) fires a shot from close range, but he is somehow only able to hit the right post!

Marc-Oliver Kempf (VfB Stuttgart) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Frank Willenborg blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. Bayern Munich have been awarded a penalty kick!
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) fails to score from the penalty as his shot only hits the right post.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) sees a yellow card from Frank Willenborg after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) connects with the ball from the corner kick and places a precise header past the stranded goalkeeper. The opposing players are staring at each other, unable to understand what happened. Who will take the blame for that one? Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) has a reason to celebrate!
Substitution. Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) on for Anastasios Donis.
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) replaces Thomas Muller.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) has a sight of goal, fires a shot in from distance towards the right post and forces a good save out of Ron-Robert Zieler.
Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) blows a clear opportunity! He needed only to tap the ball in, but narrowly misses the goal.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has a great chance inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.
Alphonso Davies (Bayern Munich) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Kingsley Coman.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Steven Zuber.
Alexander Esswein goes off the pitch and Borna Sosa (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A yellow card for a tackle by Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen). Markus Schmidt doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post.

An amazing individual effort from Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and makes it 1:0. Kevin Trapp was helpless.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and curls the ball inside the left post in trademark fashion.
Florian Kohfeldt is forced to make a change. Sebastian Langkamp is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen).
Markus Schmidt shows the yellow card to Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.

Excellent touch by Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save. The ball goes out of play. Werder Bremen are awarded a corner kick.
The end of the first half.
Markus Schmidt blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Sebastian Rode (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
What an outstanding solo effort by Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) as he weaves through the defence inside the box and rolls the ball into the back of net.

A pass into the box finds Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the roof of the net, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Kevin Trapp denies him. Werder Bremen have been awarded a corner kick.
Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Markus Schmidt after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Substitution. Jonathan de Guzman makes way for Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Adi Hutter prepares a substitution. David Abraham is replaced by Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt).

The referee blows his whistle after Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) does a good impression of a basketball player and handles the ball. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Eintracht Frankfurt.
Goal! Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) puts the ball into the bottom right corner past the outstretched arm of Jiri Pavlenka.
Joshua Sargent (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Martin Harnik.

Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the bottom right corner. Kevin Trapp shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Substitution. Johannes Eggestein leaves the pitch and is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
Here is a change. Sebastian Rode is going off and Adi Hutter gives the last tactical orders to Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Itâ€™s tense out there as the referee has decided to review the penalty decision using the VAR. He makes his way over to the monitor.
Here comes the refâ€™s decision after the VAR review. Itâ€™s not penalty as the referee indicates there was no infringement.
Today's referee Markus Schmidt rightly decides to book Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.

Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Gregor Kobel makes a great save to stop the effort going into the right side of the goal.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Rani Khedira (Augsburg) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Michael Lang (B. Monchengladbach) finds himself in a promising position to finish! He unleashes a poor shot which flies into the stands. What a poor effort that was!
Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Kevin Danso (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.

Jan Moravek (Augsburg) trips an opponent with a slide tackle. Harm Osmers stops the game and he could give him a card, but eventually decides on just a warning. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to B. Monchengladbach.

Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) fails to beat the goalkeeper from the penalty spot with a shot into the bottom left corner. Gregor Kobel anticipates his intention perfectly, though, and leaps to stop his effort.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
The whistle blows and Yann Sommer (B. Monchengladbach) is booked for an infringement.
A yellow card is awarded to Andre Hahn (Augsburg).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) is coming onto the pitch as Florian Neuhaus cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Philipp Max is replaced by Georg Teigl (Augsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Alfred Finnbogason trots off the pitch and is replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Ibrahima Traore.
Goal! Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 1:0.
Manuel Baum has decided to make a change. Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) replaces Daniel Baier.
Substitution. Alassane Plea leaves the pitch and is replaced by Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach).
Konstantinos Stafylidis (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Harm Osmers had an easy-decision to make.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) was quite harsh and Harm Osmers didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) scores an absolute screamer from outside the penalty area, with the ball flying into the top left corner!
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
That was close by Marco Reus (Dortmund)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes by a whisker over the crossbar.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) storms into the box to get on the end of a pass, but smashes his shot straight onto the right post. Unlucky!
Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box. The ball goes into the bottom right corner and past the goalkeeper.

A cross to the edge of the box finds Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) who takes a nice first touch and tries to beat the keeper with a quick shot towards the left-hand post. Michael Esser pulls off a good save and the score remains the same. The ball goes out of play and Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick.
Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee is being substituted because of an injury. Andre Breitenreiter sends Takuma Asano (Hannover) on the pitch.
Kevin Akpoguma (Hannover) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Manuel Grafe has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
It's in the back of the net! Achraf Hakimi slips the ball through to Marco Reus (Dortmund), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent low shot into the back of the net. He makes it 2:0.
Goal! Jadon Sancho tees up Mario Gotze (Dortmund) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the left side of the goal. 3:0.
Mario Gotze comes off the pitch to be replaced by Paco Alcacer (Dortmund).
Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom right corner.
We are about to witness a substitution. Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) is replacing Lukasz Piszczek.
Andre Breitenreiter decides to make a substitution. Nicolai Muller will be replaced by Tim Dierssen (Hannover).
Substitution. Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Thomas Delaney walks off.
Here is a change. Hendrik Weydandt is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Benjamin Hadzic (Hannover).
Goal! Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot into the bottom left corner.
Axel Witsel (Dortmund) receives a quality pass, makes a yard for himself and smashes a jaw-dropping long-range shot into the bottom left corner. What a remarkable goal!
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Joelinton (Hoffenheim), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 0:1.

A sweet pass finds Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the bottom right corner. Alexander Schwolow is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second.

Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) runs onto a pass and from the edge of the box tries his luck with a dipping shot. Unfortunately for him, the effort fizzes just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Freiburg will have a goal kick.
Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Bibiana Steinhaus had an easy-decision to make.
Corner kick falls to Manuel Gulde (Freiburg), who attempts to finish. Luck is not on his side today as the ball crashes against the right post.
Goal! Lucas Holer (Freiburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 1:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Bibiana Steinhaus has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Bibiana Steinhaus shows a yellow card to Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) for his blatant foul.
The referee blows his whistle as Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) was too aggressive in his challenge. It's a penalty to Hoffenheim! Let's see who's going to take it.
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Alexander Schwolow into the bottom left corner.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Adam Szalai as he is replaced by Stefan Posch (Hoffenheim).
Christian Streich has decided to substitute Lucas Holer and he is replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg).
Substitution. Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) in, Pascal Stenzel out.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home low into the middle of the net. The goalkeeper was helpless.
A substitution has been made. Jerome Gondorf is replaced by Yoric Ravet (Freiburg).
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the left side of the goal. The score is 2:3.
The substitution is prepared. Nadiem Amiri joins the action as a substitute, replacing Dennis Geiger (Hoffenheim).
Joelinton (Hoffenheim) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Freiburg will have a goal kick.

Oliver Baumann hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) shoots from the edge of the box towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. Good work from Freiburg as they win a corner.

Robin Koch (Freiburg) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Oliver Baumann stops the ball from going into the top of the net. The referee signals a corner kick to Freiburg.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and sends a shot to the left side of the goal, but is denied by a reflex save from Alexander Schwolow.

Joelinton looks around to decide who he is going to pass to. He picks out Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim), who collects the ball perfectly and unleashes a terrific shot that ricochets in off the crossbar. The score is 2:4.
Here comes a substitution. Nico Schulz is given a rest as he is replaced by Joshua Brenet (Hoffenheim).
Bibiana Steinhaus is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
A clumsy foul by Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) and Bastian Dankert blows his whistle. Mainz are awarded a penalty. What an opportunity to score!
Goal! Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty low past Christian Mathenia into the middle of the goal.
Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.

Georg Margreitter (Nurnberg) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Enrico Valentini. His header was precise and ended up inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 1:1.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
Bastian Dankert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Although Fabian Bredlow (Nurnberg) is just on the bench, Bastian Dankert has awarded him with a yellow card. Unsporting behavior says the referee.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to make a change. Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) replaces Levin Oztunali.
Goal! Tim Leibold tees up Adam Zrelak (Nurnberg) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to find the bottom right corner. 1:2.
Referee Bastian Dankert makes the VAR signal and is going to check whether the goal can stand. Letâ€™s see what happens!
Here comes the VAR decision. NO GOAL, the ref disallows it due to offside.
Substitution. Matheus Pereira makes way for Eduard Lowen (Nurnberg).
It's in the back of the net! Daniel Brosinski is the provider as he slips the ball to Robin Quaison (Mainz) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 2:1.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to substitute Robin Quaison and he is replaced by Danny Latza (Mainz).
That's the end of the game for Jean-Philippe Mateta, who is replaced by Anthony Ujah (Mainz).
Stefan Bell (Mainz) has tested the patience of referee Bastian Dankert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Michael Kollner decides to make a substitution. Ondrej Petrak will be replaced by Sebastian Kerk (Nurnberg).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
A loose pass is instantly latched onto by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen). He tries his luck from the edge of the box with a measured shot, but it hits the crossbar and is cleared to safety.
Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) gets into a great position in the box after a pass, but sends his shot just wide of the left post.

What a sensational goal that would have been! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up the ball inside the box and fires a beautiful first-time shot, but it goes just a few inches wide of the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) is coming onto the pitch as Admir Mehmedi cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Felix Zwayer after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
A rebound spins to Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) inside the box, but his sliced shot flies just wide of the left post.
Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Lukas Hradecky.
Poor challenge! William (Wolfsburg) is penalised for tripping and Felix Zwayer blows his whistle. The referee blows his whistle and awards Bayer Leverkusen a penalty after chaos inside the box.
William (Wolfsburg) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Felix Zwayer lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Goal! Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) puts the ball into the bottom right corner past the outstretched arm of Koen Casteels.
Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Zwayer didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the top left corner. Unfortunately for him, Koen Casteels makes a great save to stop his effort. The linesman points to the corner flag, Bayer Leverkusen are going to take it.
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Koen Casteels makes a great save to stop his effort. The ball goes out of play and Bayer Leverkusen have been awarded a corner kick.
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to John Brooks (Wolfsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a good pass and slams the ball from mid-range into the top right corner, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
Elvis Rexhbecaj comes off the pitch to be replaced by Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg).
It's in the back of the net! Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) finds a way to slip the ball past the goalkeeper!
Here comes the VAR decision. NO GOAL, the ref disallows it due to offside.
Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the right-hand post, but Lukas Hradecky was alert and the score remains the same.
Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming onto the pitch as Leon Bailey cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Felix Klaus (Wolfsburg) replaces William.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Wendell departs the field of play to be replaced by Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen).

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the roof of the net, but Koen Casteels is alert and denies him with a nice save. Bayer Leverkusen have a corner.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Goal! Karim Bellarabi passes the ball to the feet of Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 0:3.
Felix Zwayer shows the yellow card to Jerome Roussillon (Wolfsburg) for a heavy challenge.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Today's referee Felix Brych rightly decides to book Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) for his harsh tackle.
Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot inside the right post.
Domenico Tedesco is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Alessandro Schopf suffers an injury and Suat Serdar (Schalke) comes on.
Benjamin Stambouli is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke).

GOAL! Superb work from Ondrej Duda, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin), who beats Alexander Nubel with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card.
Sebastian Rudy (Schalke) gets a yellow card.
Mark Uth (Schalke) latches on to a precise pass inside the box and sends in a superb strike that finds its way under the crossbar and hits the net.
Goal! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) makes the score 2:2 after burying a close-range header in the bottom right corner after a good run and cross by Davie Selke.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Felix Brych blows his whistle to start the second half.

Suat Serdar (Schalke) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Suat Serdar (Schalke). This could have been a legendary goal.

Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the bottom left corner. However, Alexander Nubel anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.

Suat Serdar (Schalke) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the roof of the net. Rune Jarstein guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The ball is out of play and Schalke manage to earn a corner.
Pal Dardai has decided to substitute Vedad Ibisevic and he is replaced by Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin).
Steven Skrzybski doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Ahmed Kutucu (Schalke) comes onto the pitch to replace him.
Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Arne Maier.
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) replacing Ondrej Duda.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A header by Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) from very close range goes towards the middle of the target, but doesn't get past Alexander Nubel, who makes a nice save.
William (Wolfsburg) makes a reckless foul in order to win the ball from his opponent. Manuel Grafe has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle. PENALTY AWARDED to Schalke!
Goal! Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Koen Casteels into left side of the goal.
Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies onto the right post!
Goal! Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) weaves through the defence and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.

What a save from Koen Casteels! Mark Uth (Schalke) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out.
Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) latches on to the corner kick inside the box, but his header crashes against the crossbar! The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
The whistle blows and Weston McKennie (Schalke) is booked for an infringement.
Substitution. Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Elvis Rexhbecaj walks off.
Goal - 2:1! Weston McKennie laid the ball off to Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke), who shot from close range into the top left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Felix Klaus (Wolfsburg) will replace Renato Steffen.
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Yannick Gerhardt is replaced by Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg).
The manager makes a subsitution with Haji Wright (Schalke) coming on for Mark Uth.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Suat Serdar (Schalke) replacing Weston McKennie.
Steven Skrzybski comes off the pitch to be replaced by Ahmed Kutucu (Schalke).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom right corner.

Eduard Lowen is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot into the bottom right corner to make the score 1:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Guido Winkmann has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Vedad Ibisevic pulls the ball back for Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) on the edge of the box, and he beats the keeper with a fine strike into the bottom right corner. 1:2.
Eduard Lowen (Nurnberg) receives a yellow card.

Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) blows a huge opportunity after receiving a cross from the free kick. He shoots from just outside of the box, but the ball goes narrowly wide of the right post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Nurnberg.
That's the end of the game for Marko Grujic, who is replaced by Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin).
Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) breaks through the defence and scores a brilliant goal from outside the penalty area after firing the ball inside the right post!
Vura (Nurnberg) has tested the patience of referee Guido Winkmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) wastes a promising chance! He tries his luck with a shot from mid-range, but his effort hits the left post! A few inches to the right and it could have been a sweet goal!
Michael Kollner prepares a substitution. Eduard Lowen is replaced by Torless Knoll (Nurnberg).
Substitution. Matheus Pereira walks off the pitch and Yuya Kubo (Nurnberg) comes on as a substitute.
Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) beats the defender inside the box and lashes a shot towards the right side of the goal, but Christian Mathenia makes a brilliant reflex save to deny him. Goalkeeping at its best!
Pascal Kopke (Hertha Berlin) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Davie Selke.
That's it for today, Guido Winkmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Axel Witsel (Dortmund) finds his way to a cross from the corner kick and heads it in via a deflection off the bar. There was absolutely nothing Peter Gulacsi could do with it. The score changes to 0:1.
Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) runs onto a pass and from the edge of the box tries his luck with a dipping shot. Unfortunately for him, the effort fizzes just over the bar.
Ibrahima Konate (RB Leipzig) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Abdou Diallo (Dortmund) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes just wide of the left post.
Deniz Aytekin has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Roman Burki guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out. Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick.
Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) picked up a yellow card from referee.
A pass into the box finds Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the bottom left corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Roman Burki denies him.
Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Raphael Guerreiro.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) latches on to a lovely pass inside the box and fires towards the top right corner, but the effort is smothered by the keeper. Corner kick. RB Leipzig will have an opportunity.
Substitution. Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) in, Maximilian Philipp out.
Ralf Rangnick prepares a substitution. Diego Demme is replaced by Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig).
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) receives a yellow card!
Here's the change. Konrad Laimer leaves the pitch and Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) comes on as a substitute.
Substitution. Jadon Sancho did his best and is replaced by Marius Wolf (Dortmund).
Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) latches onto a pass and lets fly at goal from the edge of the box. The shot beats the keeper but smashes against the crossbar. Good effort!
A yellow card for bad language! Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) couldnâ€™t remain silent and the result is obvious.

Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig) in a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes with a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better. His effort ends wide of the right post.
Roman Burki (Dortmund) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) latches onto a pass and lets fly at goal from the edge of the box. The shot beats the keeper but smashes against the left post. Good effort!
This is a yellow card! Jan Moravek (Augsburg) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.

Nice move, nice attempt! Marvin Ducksch (Dusseldorf) is teed up with a simple pass after a nice flowing move. His first time shot from mid-range looks like it's going in but curls just wide of the right post.
Marvin Ducksch (Dusseldorf) heads the ball low inside the right post after a splendid cross. This timely header produces a wonderful moment.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) meets a cross on the edge of the box and produces a header towards the left side of the goal, but one of the defending players blocks the effort.
The game has come to an end for Michael Gregoritsch. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) scores a great goal from the resulting free kick from mid-range. He sends the ball directly inside the right post.
Substitution. Takashi Usami did his best and is replaced by Benito Raman (Dusseldorf).
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Jan Moravek is replaced by Marco Richter (Augsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dodi Lukebakio departs the field of play to be replaced by Aymen Barkok (Dusseldorf).
Manuel Baum has decided to substitute Philipp Max and he is replaced by Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg).
It is time for a substitution. Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) is on for Kenan Karaman.
Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) converts a killer cross with a powerful low shot that goes into the middle of the net.
Jan-Ingwer Callsen-Bracker (Augsburg) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the left post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.

Now Bayer Leverkusen have a corner. Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) meets a delivery on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards to the bottom left corner. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Yann Sommer pulls off an easy save.
Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom left corner. Magnificent finish!

Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His header would probably have ended up inside the bottom right corner, but Lukas Hradecky pulls off a decent save to thwart him. B. Monchengladbach have a corner.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach) for his blatant foul.

Yann Sommer pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the middle of the goal, but was stopped by the goalkeeper.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) controls a pass, goes past a defender and curls a shot from the edge of the box right onto the left post.

Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed under the crossbar, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Leon Bailey as he is replaced by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).
Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) has tested the patience of referee Daniel Siebert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Alassane Plea.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) latches onto a cross inside the box and aims a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but Yann Sommer reacts superbly to deny him.

Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball down to the middle of the goal. Yann Sommer shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) has a chance after receiving a pass. He measures his shot from the edge of the box but it sails just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for B. Monchengladbach.
It is time for a substitution. Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) is on for Denis Zakaria.

Good chance! Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) nicely turned his man inside the box but placed his effort just wide of the right post. He should have scored! The ball goes out of play and Bayer Leverkusen will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Jonas Hofmann leaves the pitch and is replaced by Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) has tested the patience of referee Sven Jablonski and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) leaped to meet a deep cross and nodded the ball past the helpless goalkeeper.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power inside the right post.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) bursts into the box after a great solo run and gets one-on-one with the keeper, who he neatly side steps and rolls the ball into an empty net. Wonderful effort!
Sven Jablonski has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt is replaced by Lucas Holer (Freiburg).
Half-time substitution. Florian Niederlechner will not participate anymore and Nils Petersen (Freiburg) is coming on.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a slide-rule pass inside the box and has just the keeper to beat. His shot towards the roof of the net lacks power and Alexander Schwolow easily makes the save.

Goal! Jerome Gondorf puts a cross into the box and finds Nils Petersen (Freiburg), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the middle of the net. He makes it 3:1.
Sebastian Rode (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sven Jablonski had an easy-decision to make.
Here comes a substitution. Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Sebastian Rode.
GOAL 4:1! Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) unleashes a shot from distance, which is deflected past Alexander Schwolow. He had no chance of stopping it as the ball rapidly changed its direction.
Wait a minute! The referee has decided to review the goal using the VAR system.
The goal is ruled out after the referee indicates that the VAR spotted a foul.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) replaces Lukas Kubler.

What a miss! Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is left standing right in front of goal with only the keeper to beat after a clever pass, but he somehow contrives to toe poke the ball just past the right post.
A substitution has been made. Jetro Willems goes off and Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
A defender mistimes his tackle on the edge on the box and let's in Nuri Sahin (Werder Bremen). It's a decent effort but his shot flies just wide of the right post.

Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and produces a ferocious strike towards the left post, but his shot is well held by the goalkeeper. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Werder Bremen.

Michael Esser pulls off a great save to deny Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
Goal! Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) has the simplest of tasks to roll the ball into an empty net from close range after a rebound left the keeper stranded. 0:1.

Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot low towards the middle of the goal. However, Michael Esser anticipates the shot and makes an easy save.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Oliver Sorg (Hannover) was quite harsh and Marco Fritz didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Jonathas (Hannover) in, Bobby Wood out.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a change. Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) replaces Martin Harnik.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Nicolai Muller (Hannover) for his blatant foul.
Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Marco Fritz had an easy-decision to make.
It will be a substitution. Iver Fossum (Hannover) is ready to enter the pitch as Pirmin Schwegler walks off.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Joshua Sargent (Werder Bremen) replacing Milot Rashica.
Kevin Akpoguma (Hannover) has tested the patience of referee Marco Fritz and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) scores an unlucky own goal! He deflects a shot into his own net.
Goal! Robin Quaison provides Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 0:2.

Florian Muller pulls off a great save to deny Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner. Stuttgart win a corner.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Aaron Caricol produces a cross from the resulting corner and finds Alexander Hack (Mainz) inside the box. He pulls the trigger and scores, sending the ball into the bottom right corner. What a brilliant finish. 0:3.

Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) rises highest and produces a brilliant header that sails into the roof of the net after beating the goalkeeper!
Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) receives a harsh yellow card from the referee after committing a minor foul on his opponent.

Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) is found in space by a decent pass, and he immediately hits a rocket of a shot at goal that clips the outside of the left post.

Referee Tobias Stieler makes the VAR signal and is going to check whether itâ€™s a penalty. Letâ€™s see what happens!

What was Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
That's a clear yellow card. Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) goes into the book.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.

The ball finds it way to Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) inside the box and his first-time shot flies a whisker past the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) controls a cross inside the six-yard box, but sends his shot slightly wide of the left post.
Today's referee Tobias Welz rightly decides to book Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) for his harsh tackle.
Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) wins himself enough space to meet the resulting corner and fires the ball at goal, but the keeper does well to stop his effort.

Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) has a good chance to score with a mid-range attempt after collecting a pass. He aims for the bottom left corner, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Oliver Baumann.
Goal! Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) picks up the ball inside the box, finds himself in a good position and fires in a shot which is deflected past Oliver Baumann. He makes it 0:1.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich). David Alaba plays a fantastic through ball and finds Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom left corner. 0:2.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.

Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) picks up a lucky rebound inside the box from the clearance, beats an opponent but drills his shot inches over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayern Munich.

A yellow card for a tackle by Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim). Tobias Welz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Goal! Leonardo Bittencourt finds Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) with a clever pass. He steps inside his man on the edge of the box and whips a tremendous shot into the bottom left corner. Fantasy football! 1:2.

The referee gives a yellow card to Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich).

There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! Steven Zuber shows great vision to find Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
Goal! Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) fires the rebound into the roof of the net after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
Close! Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) collects a wonderful lead pass and as he has a lot of space, smashes a terrific shot from long range. His shot goes painfully close to the crossbar!
Oliver Baumann makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the left-hand post by Robin Quaison (Mainz) after a cross from the side.

What a great touch by Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Hoffenheim will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) sees his header crash off the right post after meeting a corner kick inside the six-yard box. The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
Moussa Niakhate is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Alexander Hack (Mainz).
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Sascha Stegemann blows his whistle to start the second half.
Substitution. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) replaces Nico Schulz.

Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Robin Zentner pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes just a few inches over the bar! What a huge opportunity!
Sandro Schwarz is forced to make a change. Jean-Philippe Mateta is unable to continue due to injury, Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) comes on.
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card from Sascha Stegemann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) latches onto a pass inside the box, steps inside his marker and smacks a shot against the right post.
That's the end of the game for Joshua Brenet, who is replaced by Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim).
Sandro Schwarz has decided to make a change. Bote Baku (Mainz) replaces Danny Latza.
The substitution is prepared. Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Steven Zuber.

Yannick Gerhardt swings the cross over. Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) gets his head to it but it goes just wide of the right post.
Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) shows off his amazing technique to get to the edge of the box by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the right post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
What a miss! Rani Khedira (Augsburg) is left standing right in front of goal with only the keeper to beat after a clever pass, but he somehow contrives to toe poke the ball just past the right post.
Goal! The resulting corner is whipped into the box and Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg) buries the ball into the back of the net from a John Brooks knock down. 0:1.
Soren Storks shows the yellow card to Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.

Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) rises high to head a nice lofted cross towards the right side of the goal. Unfortunately for him, his close-range effort lacks pace and Andreas Luthe makes a comfortable save.
Goal! Admir Mehmedi passes the ball to William (Wolfsburg) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Andreas Luthe couldn't do anything about it. 0:2.
Wout Weghorst swings the cross over. Robin Knoche (Wolfsburg) gets his head to it but it goes just wide of the left post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Soren Storks has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
The game is over for Michael Gregoritsch. Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) comes on for the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Marco Richter comes off for Andre Hahn (Augsburg).
Goal! Rani Khedira (Augsburg) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:2.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Soren Storks after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Soren Storks pulls out a yellow card.
Soren Storks has issued a yellow card to Rani Khedira (Augsburg).
Rani Khedira (Augsburg) will miss the next game.
Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header inside the left post. Excellent finish.
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Maximilian Arnold is replaced by Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg).
Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) finds space inside the box to shoot after collecting a short pass, but it's a wasted effort as it flies well wide of the right post.

Manuel Baum has decided to substitute Konstantinos Stafylidis and he is replaced by Raphael Framberger (Augsburg).

It's in the back of the net! Renato Steffen plays it into the box, and Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 2:3.
Substitution. Daniel Ginczek will be replaced by Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg).

Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Danny da Costa (Eintracht Frankfurt) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the bottom right corner, but Manuel Neuer was alert and made an amazing save!

What a miss! Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is left standing right in front of goal with only the keeper to beat after a clever pass, but he somehow contrives to toe poke the ball just past the right post.

David Alaba (Bayern Munich) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top of net only for Kevin Trapp to dive and make a save. The ball goes out of play. Bayern Munich are awarded a corner kick.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) tries to head the rebound into the net from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a good save to deny him. The ball is out of play. Bayern Munich win a corner kick.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski puts the ball across the area and Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 0:1.
Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes onto the pitch because Mijat Gacinovic simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.

The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The manager makes a subsitution with Nicolai Muller (Eintracht Frankfurt) coming on for Gelson Fernandes.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.

Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) finds himself in a great position after receiving a precise pass inside the box and sends the ball beyond the goalkeeper! His effort went into the bottom left corner, off the post.
Rafinha (Bayern Munich) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the top left corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.

OFF THE POST! Good play from Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes against the crossbar!
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to release a low effort which ends up in the bottom right corner.

GOAL! A cross into the box is headed down by Fabian Lustenberger and Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) does brilliantly to get to the ball and fire home. 2:1.

That was a nice football moment. Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom right corner. Rune Jarstein guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) reacts well and displays good awareness inside the box to pounce on the rebound. His effort misses the right post by a whisker!

The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jonathan Tah departs the field of play to be replaced by Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen).
A short pass finds Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) in acres of space on the edge of the box and he decides to go for glory. His efforts looks in for all the world but just creeps past the left post.
That's it for today, Tobias Stieler has blown his whistle and the game is over.

Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) took a first-time shot from mid-range after he was put in the clear by a great pass, but the effort lacked a little accuracy and went just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.

Adam Bodzek (Dusseldorf) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Bastian Dankert had an easy-decision to make.
Bobby Wood (Hannover) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a clever chip pass, but one of the defending players comes up with a timely interception.

Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Michael Esser guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

The game restarts for the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Friedhelm Funkel gives a chance to Marcel Sobottka (Dusseldorf) and Adam Bodzek is off.
Martins Felipe (Hannover) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Michael Esser guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. Dusseldorf will have a chance to score from a corner kick.

Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) has a great chance on the edge of the six-yard box following a lofted pass, but his header lacks accuracy and flies just past the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.

Andre Breitenreiter decides to make a substitution. Florent Muslija will be replaced by Linton Maina (Hannover).
