A pass into the box finds Kevin Stoger (Dusseldorf) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the bottom right corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Michael Esser denies him.
Bastian Dankert rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf).
Kenan Karaman comes off the pitch to be replaced by Oliver Fink (Dusseldorf).
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Walace and he is replaced by Benjamin Hadzic (Hannover).
The referee Bastian Dankert awards Matthias Zimmermann (Dusseldorf) a yellow card.
Oliver Fink (Dusseldorf) latches on to a brilliant pass and hits a poor shot towards the middle of the goal, but the ball goes into the back of the net after the goalkeeper makes a howler!

Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) unleashes a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Michael Esser thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Manuel Gulde (Freiburg) determinedly makes his way to the ball from the resulting set piece, but only manages to connect with his body. It's enough to beat the goalkeeper, however, and make it 0:1.
Robin Koch (Freiburg) picks up a yellow card.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the top left corner, but Alexander Schwolow pulls off a brilliant save. The linesman makes the right call and Nurnberg will have a corner.
What was Manuel Gulde (Freiburg) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Robert Kampka blows his whistle to start the second half.
Christian Streich makes a half-time substitution. Nils Petersen (Freiburg) comes on in place of Florian Niederlechner.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Adam Zrelak (Nurnberg) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yuya Kubo (Nurnberg) replaces Sebastian Kerk.
Michael Kollner has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) replacing Vura.
Substitution. Mike Frantz leaves the pitch and is replaced by Philipp Lienhart (Freiburg).
Substitution. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) on for Lucas Holer.
Robert Bauer goes off the pitch and Almeida Ewerton (Nurnberg) comes on.
Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Kampka had an easy-decision to make.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Federico Palacios-Martinez (Nurnberg) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Lukas Kubler (Freiburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Robert Kampka is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
What a huge chance for Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked. The ball goes out of play and Werder Bremen have been awarded a corner kick.

Lukas Klostermann (RB Leipzig) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Jiri Pavlenka is just a bystander as the ball flies off the post into the top right corner. The score is 1:0.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) rises high to head a nice lofted cross towards the middle of the goal. Unfortunately for him, his close-range effort lacks pace and Peter Gulacsi makes a comfortable save.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 2:0.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Max Kruse, but he hits a shot just wide of the right post.
Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) is penalised.
Substitution. Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) in, Milot Rashica out.
Ralf Rangnick has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) replacing Kevin Kampl.
Jiri Pavlenka makes a wonderful save! Ibrahima Konate (RB Leipzig) got to the rebound and sent in a fine header towards the bottom right corner, but he couldn't beat the keeper.
It is time for a substitution. Joshua Sargent (Werder Bremen) is on for Johannes Eggestein.
Goal! Great play by Theodor Gebre Selassie releases Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) in space on the edge of the box. He spots the keeper off his line and coolly puts the ball into bottom right corner. 2:1.

Yuya Osako is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Joshua Sargent (Werder Bremen) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot which bounces in off the left post to make the score 2:2.
What a big chance! Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Here comes a substitution. Bruma (RB Leipzig) is brought on as a substitute for Willi Orban.
Substitution. Davy Klaassen did his best and is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).

Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) unleashes a promising shot towards the left side of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Jiri Pavlenka thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
Bruma (RB Leipzig) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect low shot that goes into the middle of the goal and past the goalkeeper.
Bruma (RB Leipzig) is cautioned by the referee.
Substitution. Timo Werner walks off the pitch and Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig) comes on as a substitute.
Bibiana Steinhaus is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Bastian Oczipka produces a sweet pass and picks out Steven Skrzybski (Schalke) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the middle of the net and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 0:1!

That was a nice football moment. Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the left post. Ralf Fahrmann guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
Felix Brych shows the yellow card to Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Brych has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a rebound and fires in from mid-range, but the ball crashes against the right post!
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) sees a yellow card from Felix Brych after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a yellow card.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to substitute Daniel Didavi and he is replaced by Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart).
Substitution. Weston McKennie (Schalke) on for Suat Serdar.
Weston McKennie (Schalke) picked up a yellow card from referee.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Erik Thommy walks off the pitch to be replaced by Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart).
What a brilliant finish! Salif Sane (Schalke) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and fires the ball past the helpless goalkeeper.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ahmed Kutucu (Schalke) replacing Evgen Konoplyanka.
It's a goal! Chadrac Akolo sends a long raking pass onto the head of Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart), who makes no mistake from close in and sends the ball into the top right corner. 1:2.
Goal! Steven Skrzybski slips a clever pass through to Ahmed Kutucu (Schalke), who moves inside the box and sends a measured shot beyond the keeper and low into the middle of the goal. 1:3.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a change. Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Andreas Beck.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Haji Wright (Schalke) comes onto the pitch so that Daniel Caligiuri can be given a rest.
Ron-Robert Zieler (VfB Stuttgart) earns the yellow card.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) receives a yellow card!
Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) receives a yellow card.
Bastian Oczipka (Schalke) gets a yellow card.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Yann Sommer pulls off a great save to deny Marco Reus (Dortmund), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.
Lucien Favre is forced to make a change. Paco Alcacer is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Mario Gotze (Dortmund).

Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Yann Sommer with a precise strike which bounces off the bottom of the left post and into the back of the net. He makes it 1:0.
After a goalmouth scramble the ball rebounds out to Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) who buries it from close range into the left side of the goal.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Goal! Mario Gotze passes the ball to the feet of Marco Reus (Dortmund), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 2:1.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) unleashed a brilliant free kick from the edge of the box and hits the left post of the goal.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christoph Kramer trots off the pitch and is replaced by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann makes way for Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Florian Neuhaus.
Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The game has come to an end for Jadon Sancho. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Marius Wolf (Dortmund).
Here is a change. Raphael Guerreiro is going off and Lucien Favre gives the last tactical orders to Jacob Bruun Larsen (Dortmund).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
A yellow card for a tackle by Diego Demme (RB Leipzig). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) latches onto a good pass inside the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper, but deflects off the left post to safety.
Substitution. Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Serge Gnabry walks off.
Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) sees his header crash off the crossbar after meeting a corner kick inside the six-yard box. The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
Marco Fritz has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
It is time for a substitution. Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) is on for Kingsley Coman.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
David Alaba provides the assist in the box, but Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) places his shot a fraction wide of the right post.
Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) misses a big chance! He fires the ball high over the crossbar from inside the 6-yard box after the ball rebounded to him.

Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Peter Gulacsi shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) gets booked for the first time in this match.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) is coming onto the pitch as Bruma cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Goal! Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) outbattles the defender to win the ball from the corner, but he can't quite control his header and sends it just wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig) comes onto the pitch for Konrad Laimer.
Ralf Rangnick prepares a substitution. Yussuf Poulsen is replaced by Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig).
Thomas Muller will be replaced by Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich).
Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) is sent off by the referee for a disgraceful tackle that simply has no place in football!
Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) is awarded a second yellow by Marco Fritz and subsequently dismisses him with a red one.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Waldemar Anton (Hannover) changes the direction of the ball using his hand, but he is angry when the referee gives a foul against him. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Freiburg!
Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Goal! Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Michael Esser into the bottom right corner.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) connects with the ball in the six-yard box after the resulting free kick and shoots low towards goal, but Michael Esser makes a magnificent save!

Pirmin Schwegler produces a cross from the resulting corner and finds Martins Felipe (Hannover) inside the box. He pulls the trigger and scores, sending the ball into the bottom left corner. What a brilliant finish. 1:1.
What a chance that is! Janik Haberer (Freiburg) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header just over the crossbar.
Today's referee Christian Dingert rightly decides to book Martins Felipe (Hannover) for his harsh tackle.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Robin Koch (Freiburg) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Robin Koch (Freiburg) scores a goal, but Christian Dingert makes the VAR signal and is going to check whether the goal can stand.
The goal is ruled out after the referee indicates that the VAR spotted Robin Koch (Freiburg) was offside!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Christian Streich probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Marco Terrazzino. He is replaced by Lucas Holer (Freiburg).
Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) picks out a perfect cross and shoots towards the net, but his effort only hits the crossbar.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) misses a big chance! He fires the ball high over the crossbar from inside the 6-yard box after the ball rebounded to him.

Bobby Wood (Hannover) is quickest to the rebound inside the box and produces a low drive towards the middle of the goal. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a spectacular save to keep the ball out. Great goalkeeping!
Substitution. Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) replaces Pascal Stenzel.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a change. Linton Maina (Hannover) replaces Florent Muslija.
Here comes a substitution. Hendrik Weydandt is given a rest as he is replaced by Benjamin Hadzic (Hannover).
The foul by Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Christian Dingert.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt will be replaced by Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg).
Andre Breitenreiter decides to make a substitution. Bobby Wood will be replaced by Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Robin Quaison (Mainz) has a great chance inside the box and slams the ball into the roof of the net.

Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) steadies himself on the edge of the box and releases a precise effort on goal that just narrowly sails past the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to a precise pass inside the box and drills in a superb strike that finds its way into the middle of the net.
It's a goal! Robin Quaison (Mainz) scores with a brilliant shot into the middle of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Jean-Paul Boetius. The score is now 2:1.
Gooal! Jonathan de Guzman takes over corner duties. Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the bottom left corner. 2:2.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Daniel Siebert has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Aaron Caricol (Mainz) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.
Carlos Salcedo (Eintracht Frankfurt) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
Jonathan de Guzman goes off the pitch and Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on.
Adi Hutter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Mijat Gacinovic.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Daniel Siebert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Pierre Kunde Malong leaves the pitch and is replaced by Bote Baku (Mainz).
Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Kevin Trapp.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Stefan Bell (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
Jean-Philippe Mateta comes off the pitch to be replaced by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
Obite Evan N'Dicka (Eintracht Frankfurt) has tested the patience of referee Daniel Siebert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to make a change. Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) replaces Danny Latza.

Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his shot towards the left post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

What a miss! Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) is left standing right in front of goal with only the keeper to beat after a clever pass, but he somehow contrives to toe poke the ball just past the right post.
Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) has tested the patience of referee Markus Schmidt and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Goal! Nico Schulz plays a short, square pass into the path of Leonardo Bittencourt (Hoffenheim), who bends a shot straight into the bottom right corner to make it 0:1. Fabulous goal!
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending the ball towards the bottom left corner only for Jiri Pavlenka to dive and make a save.
The end of the first half.
Markus Schmidt blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) pounces on a great cross inside the box, but lashes his powerful first-time shot a whisker past the right post.
Substitution. Benjamini Hubner (Hoffenheim) on for Ermin Bicakcic.
Julian Nagelsmann prepares a substitution. Leonardo Bittencourt is replaced by Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim).

Ludwig Augustinsson produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) rises high to head the ball into the left side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:1.
It is time for a substitution. Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) is on for Davy Klaassen.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a change. Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) replaces Adam Szalai.
Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) places a shot from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but Oliver Baumann makes a terrific save to deny him. Nice play all round!
Substitution. Maximilian Eggestein will be replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and produces a low shot that sails towards the middle of a goal. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save.
It will be a substitution. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) is ready to enter the pitch as Yuya Osako walks off.
Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
Markus Schmidt is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.
Goal! Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 0:1.
This is a yellow card! Amine Harit (Schalke) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Goal! Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:2.
Haji Wright (Schalke) rises high to head the corner in the net and beyond the goalkeeper.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Steven Skrzybski (Schalke) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Haji Wright walks off.
Domenico Tedesco decides to make a substitution. Nabil Bentaleb will be replaced by Suat Serdar (Schalke).
Suat Serdar (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Deniz Aytekin had an easy-decision to make.
Aleksandar Dragovic is being substituted because of an injury. Heiko Herrlich sends Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) on the pitch.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Close! Steven Skrzybski (Schalke) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the left post.
Lukas Hradecky (Bayer Leverkusen) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Today's match ends for Lucas Alario who will be replaced by Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen).
Domenico Tedesco prepares a substitution. Alessandro Schopf is replaced by Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).
What was Weston McKennie (Schalke) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Substitution. Karim Bellarabi makes his way off the pitch and Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as his replacement.
That's a clear yellow card. Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen) goes into the book.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf) tries a pot shot from the edge of the box, but it goes narrowly wide of the left post.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) bursts into the box after a great solo run and gets one-on-one with the keeper, who he neatly side steps and rolls the ball into an empty net. Wonderful effort!
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) picks up a pass and tries his luck from mid-range towards the bottom left corner, but Michael Rensing is equal to it and makes an easy save.
Golden opportunity! Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf) lost his marker inside the box, only to shoot just wide of the left post after receiving a good pass.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Tobias Welz blows his whistle to start the second half.
Half-time substitution. Lucien Favre decided to make a change. Manuel Akanji is replaced by Omer Toprak (Dortmund).

What a beautiful moment! Jean Zimmer (Dusseldorf) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the top left corner. Roman Burki just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 2:0.
Here is a change. Thomas Delaney is going off and Lucien Favre gives the last tactical orders to Paco Alcacer (Dortmund).
Today's match ends for Jacob Bruun Larsen who will be replaced by Jadon Sancho (Dortmund).
A yellow card for a tackle by Christian Pulisic (Dortmund). Tobias Welz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcel Sobottka departs the field of play to be replaced by Adam Bodzek (Dusseldorf).
Kevin Stoger (Dusseldorf) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Welz didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

A perfect lofted pass from Lukasz Piszczek finds Paco Alcacer (Dortmund), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom left corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Michael Rensing had no chance of stopping that. 2:1.
The substitution has been made. Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) has replaced Takashi Usami.
Friedhelm Funkel decides to make a substitution. Dodi Lukebakio will be replaced by Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf).
Today's referee Tobias Welz rightly decides to book Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) for his harsh tackle.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
A precise short pass from Mathew Leckie releases Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) in space inside the box, but he smashes a wild shot well past the left post.
Jonathan Schmid takes the corner and Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) rises highest near the penalty spot to plant a brilliant header into the roof of the net. The score is 0:1.
Goal! Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 1:1. He was ably assisted there by Davie Selke.
Goal 2:1! Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Goal! Alfred Finnbogason produces a great pass that finds Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 2:2.
Frank Willenborg has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Manuel Baum has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Jan Moravek (Augsburg) comes on the pitch for Martin Hinteregger.
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Andreas Luthe.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Alfred Finnbogason will be replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Pal Dardai prepares a substitution. Ondrej Duda is replaced by Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin).

Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) was presented with a great chance after a cross found him all alone in the box, but his effort towards the middle of the goal lacked pace and was comfortably saved by Andreas Luthe.
The referee signals a substitution. Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) is brought on as a substitute for Davie Selke.
Frank Willenborg shows a yellow card to Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Substitution. Michael Gregoritsch did his best and is replaced by Julian Schieber (Augsburg).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
The ball is whipped in from the free kick and finds the head of Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg), who rises and produces an amazing header into the bottom left corner.
Jerome Roussillon (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Robert Hartmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 2:0.
Robert Hartmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The game is over for Anastasios Donis. Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) comes on for the second half.
Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) is cautioned by the referee after being shown a yellow card for dissent.
Markus Weinzierl prepares a substitution. Chadrac Akolo is replaced by Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Jerome Roussillon walks off the pitch to be replaced by Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Maximilian Arnold did his best and is replaced by Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg).
Antonis Aidonis (VfB Stuttgart) has too much to say to the referee and receives a yellow card.
Antonis Aidonis goes off the pitch and Leon Dajaku (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) replaces Admir Mehmedi.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg) latches onto a good pass inside the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper, but deflects off the crossbar to safety.
Tim Leibold (Nurnberg) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.

Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out for a corner. B. Monchengladbach can continue in their attacking effort.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Fabian Bredlow scrambling, but it flies just wide of the right post.
Robert Schroder shows the yellow card to Kevin Goden (Nurnberg) for a heavy challenge.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) plants a goal-bound header towards the right post after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders reacts superbly and makes a timely interception.
Ondrej Petrak (Nurnberg) was too fierce in his attempt to get the ball from his opponent and Robert Schroder blows for a foul. The referee points to the penalty spot. PENALTY to B. Monchengladbach!
Referee Robert Schroder makes the VAR signal and is going to check whether itâ€™s a penalty for B. Monchengladbach. Letâ€™s see what happens!
Here comes the VAR decision: PENALTY to B. Monchengladbach!
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) can't convert the spot kick. It goes narrowly over the crossbar.
The end of the first half.
Robert Schroder blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Substitution. Almeida Ewerton (Nurnberg) in, Kevin Goden out.
It's in the back of the net! Ibrahima Traore sprays a pass out to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 1:0.
Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) sees a yellow card from Robert Schroder after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Dieter Hecking is forced to make a change. Nico Elvedi is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach).
Michael Kollner decides to make a substitution. Federico Palacios-Martinez will be replaced by Edgar Salli (Nurnberg).
Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Fabian Bredlow scrambling, but it flies just over the bar.
A substitution has been made. Fabian Johnson is replaced by Michael Lang (B. Monchengladbach).
Michael Kollner prepares a substitution. Matheus Pereira is replaced by Torless Knoll (Nurnberg).
Substitution. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Ibrahima Traore walks off.

Goal! Mickael Cuisance produces a great pass that finds Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the left side of the goal. 2:0.
Robert Schroder shows a yellow card to Georg Margreitter (Nurnberg) for a tough tackle.
A yellow card for a tackle by Oscar Wendt (B. Monchengladbach). Robert Schroder doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) is caught off guard a bit when the ball lands at his feet, causing him to rush a first-time shot that is easily blocked by an opposition player.

Some great play by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) ends with a shot on the edge of the box towards the right side of the goal, but Kevin Trapp sees it all the way and makes a comfortable save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Bayer Leverkusen.

Kevin Trapp was forced into action to thwart Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper. Bayer Leverkusen have been awarded a corner kick.
The ball hits the back of the net and Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) is the one who put it there!
Itâ€™s tense out there as referee Felix Brych has decided to review the goal using the VAR. He makes his way over to the monitor.
The VAR intervenes and the referee disallows the goal as Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) was in an offside position!

It's a goal! Filip Kostic plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Danny da Costa (Eintracht Frankfurt). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.
Obite Evan N'Dicka (Eintracht Frankfurt) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Felix Brych didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) decided to shoot after receiving a sweet pass. The ball went to the middle of the goal, but Lukas Hradecky made an easy save.

The ball falls kindly for Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) inside the box and he goes for goal. It's a decent effort but flies just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

A terrific piece of skill by Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) inside the box gives him a clear goal scoring opportunity, but his shot is blocked right on the line by a defender after the keeper was beaten. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Eintracht Frankfurt will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Goal! Sebastien Haller shows great vision to find Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails low into the middle of the goal. 2:0.

Golden opportunity! Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) lost his marker inside the box, only to shoot just wide of the left post after receiving a good pass. The ball goes out of play and Bayer Leverkusen will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Lucas Alario in, Aranguiz (Bayer Leverkusen) out.
Heiko Herrlich prepares a substitution. Mitchell Weiser is replaced by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen).
Goal! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) beautifully controls a strongly hit pass from Leon Bailey inside the box. He cuts inside his marker and rifles the ball into the bottom right corner. 2:1.
Booking. Carlos Salcedo (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a caution from the referee.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes onto the pitch so that Ante Rebic can be given a rest.
A yellow card for a tackle by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Adi Hutter has decided to make a change. Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Jetro Willems.
Substitution. Paulinho (Bayer Leverkusen) on for Julian Brandt.
The foul by Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Brych.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
The game is interrupted. Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Mijat Gacinovic walks off the pitch to be replaced by Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Kevin Trapp pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the left post, but was stopped by the goalkeeper.

Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets inside the box and only has the keeper to beat, but smashes his shot just inches past the left post. He should have scored! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bayer Leverkusen.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Danny Latza (Mainz) steadies himself and bends in a shot from the edge of the box towards the top of the net, but Peter Gulacsi has it covered and makes a comfortable save.
The corner is swung in and Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) leaps above the defence only to send his header a whisker over the bar from close in.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Peter Gulacsi dived superbly to block a header by Stefan Bell (Mainz) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the right post, but Peter Gulacsi pulled off a remarkable save!
What a magnificent finish! Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) wonderfully times his run onto a cross and thunders the ball from deep inside the box into the left side of the net!
Goal! Timo Werner puts the ball on a plate for Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 2:0.
Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Martin Petersen ignores the protests.
It's a goal! Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) gets on the end of a pass and it allows him to finish into an empty net with a close-range header. The score has changed to 2:1.
Martin Petersen shows a yellow card to Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Kevin Kampl will not participate anymore and Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) is coming on.
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) crashes a header just wide of the left post from close range after a searching cross. He should have scored!
Today's referee Martin Petersen rightly decides to book Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) for his harsh tackle.
Danny Latza (Mainz) sees a yellow card from Martin Petersen after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Moussa Niakhate (Mainz) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) collects the ball from the free kick and immediately sends his close-range effort narrowly wide of the left post!
Yellow card! It's like Robin Zentner (Mainz) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Martin Petersen agrees and books him.
The referee signals a substitution. Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Robin Quaison.
The goalkeeper pulls off a great save to deny Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), whose effort would probably have ended in the roof of the net.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) displays great tekkers inside the box leading to a fantastic goal, leaving the goalkeeper stranded.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to substitute Karim Onisiwo and he is replaced by Anthony Ujah (Mainz).
Substitution. Levin Oztunali is replaced by Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz).
It is time for a substitution. Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) is on for Lukas Klostermann.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) displayed brilliant individual skill before blasting in a shot from inside the box. His terrific effort went straight into the top right corner, via a ricochet off the post. Robin Zentner had no chance. The score sheet now reads 4:1.
Ralf Rangnick decides to make a substitution. Timo Werner will be replaced by Bruma (RB Leipzig).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Davy Klaassen is being substituted because of an injury. Florian Kohfeldt sends Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) on the pitch.

It's in the back of the net! Raphael Guerreiro flights the free kick into the box, where Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) peels off his marker and heads straight inside the upright from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 1:0.

Jadon Sancho passes to Marco Reus (Dortmund), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 2:0.

Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) picks up a pass and hits the ball towards the top left corner, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Roman Burki. The ball goes out of play. Werder Bremen are awarded a corner kick.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) collects a sweet pass and lashes the ball into the top left corner. It couldn't have gone in a better place.
Today's referee Guido Winkmann rightly decides to book Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top left corner only for Jiri Pavlenka to dive and make a save.
Thomas Delaney (Dortmund) is awarded a yellow card.
Guido Winkmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.

Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the bottom right corner, but Roman Burki was alert and made an amazing save! The referee blows his whistle, Werder Bremen are awarded a corner kick.
Close! Marco Reus (Dortmund) picks up a pass and produces a ferocious strike towards the right post, but the goalkeeper gets his fingertips to the ball to keep it out.
A yellow card for a tackle by Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen). Guido Winkmann doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) blows a huge opportunity after receiving a cross from the free kick. He shoots from just outside of the box, but the ball goes narrowly over the crossbar!
That will be all from Milot Rashica who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen).
Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card from Guido Winkmann after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Mario Gotze (Dortmund) for Paco Alcacer.
Florian Kohfeldt decides to make a substitution. Maximilian Eggestein will be replaced by Joshua Sargent (Werder Bremen).
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Joshua Sargent (Werder Bremen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) is coming onto the pitch as Raphael Guerreiro cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The substitution has been made. Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) has replaced Jadon Sancho.
It's a goal! Lovely finish directed into the back of the net by Mario Gotze (Dortmund).
Celebrations by Dortmund are cut short as the referee signals that the legality of the goal will be checked using the VAR. Hopefully this wonâ€™t take too long.
Celebrations are cut short for Dortmund as the referee indicates NO GOAL after the VAR review shows it was offside!
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Ralf Fahrmann, who pulls off a comfortable save!

Rani Khedira (Augsburg) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. Augsburg get a corner.
An unlucky rebound falls to Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) and he scores with a bullet header.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Cedric Teuchert (Schalke) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.

Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Ralf Fahrmann guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Today's referee Manuel Grafe rightly decides to book Steven Skrzybski (Schalke) for his harsh tackle.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) receives a yellow card for infringement.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Sebastian Rudy will not participate anymore and Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) is coming on.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Steven Skrzybski is replaced by Haji Wright (Schalke).
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Manuel Baum probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Daniel Baier. He is replaced by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg).

What a beautiful moment! Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way inside the left post. Andreas Luthe just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 1:1.

Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) attempts to beat the goalkeeper with an accurate shot from the free kick, which is placed dangerously close to the penalty area. However, Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a great save to stop his attempt towards the left side of the goal. The ball is out of play. Augsburg will have a chance to score from a corner.
Substitution. Cedric Teuchert walks off the pitch and Ahmed Kutucu (Schalke) comes on as a substitute.
Ralf Fahrmann makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the right-hand post by Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) after a cross from the side.
The substitution is prepared. Andre Hahn (Augsburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Marco Richter.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Rani Khedira (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Haji Wright (Schalke) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
That will be all from Alfred Finnbogason who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) fails to convert a close-range free kick as he sends the ball narrowly over the bar.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
Adam Bodzek (Dusseldorf) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Harm Osmers had an easy-decision to make.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Harm Osmers has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Takashi Usami sends in a great cross from the corner and finds Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf), who outjumps the defence to put the ball into the roof of the net with a stunning header. The score is 1:0.
Substitution. Yoric Ravet (Freiburg) on for Jerome Gondorf.
A precise short pass from Matthias Zimmermann releases Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf) in space inside the box, but he smashes a wild shot high over the bar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch for Lukas Kubler.
Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Alexander Schwolow, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Oliver Fink (Dusseldorf) replacing Kenan Karaman.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Benito Raman trots off the pitch and is replaced by Jean Zimmer (Dusseldorf).
Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf) peels away from his marker to receive a lofted pass, but sends his rocket of a shot just over the bar from inside the box.
Substitution. Lucas Holer (Freiburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Mike Frantz walks off.
Goal! Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the right post. He makes it 2:0.
Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Kevin Stoger (Dusseldorf) for his blatant foul.
Manuel Gulde (Freiburg) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Rouwen Hennings walks off the pitch to be replaced by Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Goal! Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) shows perfect technique and produces a first-time effort from just outside the box that goes inside the left post. It's 0:1.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) lets fly with a crisp shot from inside the box after picking up a lofted pass from Kingsley Coman, but the ball goes just over the bar.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Martins Felipe (Hannover) was quite harsh and Soren Storks didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
What a big chance! Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
Michael Esser makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the roof of the net by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) after a cross from the side. Bayern Munich have a corner.

David Alaba (Bayern Munich) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the top right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 0:2.
Genki Haraguchi slings in a great lofted ball towards Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover), who doesn't get the best of contacts but still sends a close-range header inches wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Andre Breitenreiter probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Martins Felipe. He is replaced by Linton Maina (Hannover).
Goal! Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) fires the rebound low into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:3.

Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting corner and steers his header into the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper pulls off an astonishing save to deny him. The ball goes out of play. Bayern Munich are awarded a corner kick.
It's a goal! Joshua Kimmich sends a long raking pass onto the head of Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who makes no mistake from close in and sends the ball low into the middle of the net. 0:4.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Florent Muslija (Hannover) comes onto the pitch for Takuma Asano.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Michael Esser. Bayern Munich have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Substitution. Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) in, Kingsley Coman out.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Niclas Fullkrug and he is replaced by Josip Elez (Hannover).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and David Alaba departs the field of play to be replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch so that Thomas Muller can be given a rest.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) is first to react to a loose pass inside the box, but slices his shot just wide of the right post.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.

Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball low towards the middle of the goal. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Yann Sommer with a fabulous save.
Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) has a sight of goal and shoots towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper makes a superb save.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) misses an absolute sitter after connecting with a cross inside the penalty box. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for B. Monchengladbach.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise cross on the edge of the box and strikes the ball goalwards. However, it goes just over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.
A goal, which was scored by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim), was disallowed due to offside.
Joelinton (Hoffenheim) has a goal ruled out for offside!
A yellow card is awarded to Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach).
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Benjamin Cortus blows his whistle to start the second half.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Substitution. Andrej Kramaric will be replaced by Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).
Dieter Hecking decides to make a substitution. Lars Stindl will be replaced by Laszlo Benes (B. Monchengladbach).
Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots towards the middle of the goal. Yann Sommer is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save.
Joelinton (Hoffenheim) latches onto a good pass inside the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper, but deflects off the left post to safety.
The referee signals a substitution. Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) is brought on as a substitute for Reiss Nelson.
Here is a change. Michael Lang is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach).
Substitution. Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) on for Alassane Plea.
Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
CHANCE! Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.

Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) finds himself some space around the penalty spot and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header low into the middle of the goal, but Yann Sommer keeps it out.
Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. Stuttgart have a free kick.
Golden chance! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post.
Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) receives a super pass into the box and shoots into the top right corner. What a nice goal!
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
What a great touch by Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin)! He picks up a precise pass and produces a long-range shot, but his fabulous effort smashes off the right post!
That's the end of the game for Gonzalo Castro, who is replaced by Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart).
Sascha Stegemann shows the yellow card to Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge.
GOAL! A cross into the box is headed down by Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez and Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) does brilliantly to get to the ball and fire home. 1:1.
Substitution. Vedad Ibisevic walks off the pitch and Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) comes on as a substitute.

Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) meets a splendid cross on the edge of the 6-yard box and sends the ball towards the left post, forcing Rune Jarstein into a superb diving save to keep it out. The ball is out of play. Stuttgart win a corner kick.
Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Sascha Stegemann ignores the protests.

Christian Gentner produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 2:1.
A substitution has been made. Vladimir Darida goes off and Pascal Kopke (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Pal Dardai has decided to substitute Mathew Leckie and he is replaced by Palko Dardai (Hertha Berlin).
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) gets a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Chadrac Akolo departs the field of play to be replaced by Borna Sosa (VfB Stuttgart).

What a save from Ron-Robert Zieler! Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out. The ball goes behind for a corner. Hertha Berlin will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
It will be a substitution. Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) is ready to enter the pitch as Mario Gomez walks off.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Fabian Bredlow makes a great save to stop his effort.
Close! Ondrej Petrak (Nurnberg) unleashes a rocket of a shot from the edge of the box and his shot flies just a few inches over the crossbar.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Adam Zrelak (Nurnberg) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
Vura (Nurnberg) easily beats an opponent inside the box and goes for goal, but his effort flies just wide of the right post.
Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) fires a shot from close range, but he is somehow only able to hit the left post!

Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Fabian Bredlow is just a bystander as the ball flies into bottom right corner. The score is 0:1.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Ondrej Petrak (Nurnberg) was quite harsh and Sven Jablonski didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Ron-Robert Zieler makes a brilliant save! Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) easily weaves through the defence and unleashes a shot from just outside of the box. His effort goes towards the left side of the goal but is saved by the keeper!

Michael Lang (B. Monchengladbach) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. B. Monchengladbach win a corner.

Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the crossbar. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Ron-Robert Zieler with a fabulous save. The ball goes behind for a corner. B. Monchengladbach will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) for a heavy challenge.

Dayot Upamecano (RB Leipzig) is booked.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Michael Lang and he is replaced by Raffael (B. Monchengladbach).
A substitution has been made. Oscar Wendt goes off and Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) comes on.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
The game has come to an end for Kevin Kampl. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig).
Ralf Rangnick has decided to make a change. Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig) replaces Timo Werner.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) gets a shot from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar!
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Kampka had an easy-decision to make.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Joelinton (Hoffenheim) collects a rebound and his promising attempt heads towards the middle of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann keeps it out with an amazing save.

Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the right post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
The Schalke players are stunned as the referee changes his mind following the VAR review. NO PENALTY.
Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) has tested the patience of referee Robert Kampka and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Kampka had an easy-decision to make.
Bastian Oczipka (Schalke) handles the ball and everyone in the stadium shouts 'handball'. The referee makes the call - penalty to Hoffenheim!
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) puts the ball into the bottom left corner past the outstretched arm of Ralf Fahrmann.
Robert Kampka shows a yellow card to Salif Sane (Schalke) for his blatant foul.
It will be a substitution. Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) is ready to enter the pitch as Andrej Kramaric walks off.
Weston McKennie (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Suat Serdar.
Here is a change. Steven Zuber is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim).
The manager makes a subsitution with Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) coming on for Haji Wright.
Robert Kampka blows his whistle and signals a foul after Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) brought his opponent down. Schalke are awarded a penalty kick!
Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) scores from the penalty spot with a shot that goes inside the right post. How easy is that!
Substitution. Ishak Belfodil walks off the pitch and Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) comes on as a substitute.
Domenico Tedesco decides to make a substitution. Nabil Bentaleb will be replaced by Hamza Mendyl (Schalke).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Nuhu Kasim (Hoffenheim) was quite harsh and Robert Kampka didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Ralf Fahrmann makes a difficult save to deny Joelinton (Hoffenheim), who attempted to score with a header from inside the box.
That's it for today, Robert Kampka has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Jadon Sancho tees up Mario Gotze (Dortmund) with a precision cross. He holds off the defender, but fires his shot just wide of the left post.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) leaves the pitch to be replaced by Omer Toprak.
Goal! Marco Reus (Dortmund) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Alexander Schwolow into right side of the goal.
Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box. His rocket of a shot crashes against the crossbar! What a shot.
Janik Haberer (Freiburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Frank Willenborg had an easy-decision to make.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.

Alexander Schwolow can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Marco Reus (Dortmund). The ball would have probably ended up in the middle of the net.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Yoric Ravet (Freiburg) will replace Mike Frantz.
Lucien Favre has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) replacing Mario Gotze.
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) replaces Jerome Gondorf.
Lucas Holer (Freiburg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Nils Petersen.
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) comes onto the pitch for Marco Reus.
Frank Willenborg shows a yellow card to Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) for his blatant foul.
Goal! Lukasz Piszczek puts the ball across the area and Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 2:0.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) spurns a great opportunity from inside the 6-yard box. The ball flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) pounces on a pass inside the box but flashes his shot just over the bar. That was a great chance!

What an opportunity! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes low towards the middle of the goal, but Michael Esser reacts superbly to keep the ball out.
Arne Maier (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Felix Brych and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) was quite harsh and Felix Brych didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) times his leap well to meet the lofted pass from Davie Selke, but his close-range header slips just over the bar.

Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the left side of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 0:1.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Marvin Bakalorz comes off the pitch to be replaced by Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover).
Felix Brych shows a yellow card to Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) for his blatant foul.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.
That will be all from Florent Muslija who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Genki Haraguchi (Hannover).
A substitution has been made. Salomon Kalou is replaced by Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin).
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) replacing Julian Korb.
Josip Elez (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Felix Brych had an easy-decision to make.

A perfect lofted pass from Jordan Torunarigha finds Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the left side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Michael Esser had no chance of stopping that. 0:2.
Vedad Ibisevic will be replaced by Pascal Kopke (Hertha Berlin).
Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Rune Jarstein, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Palko Dardai (Hertha Berlin) replaces Mathew Leckie.
Michael Esser pulls off a great save to deny Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
The match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.

Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the right-hand post. However, he couldn't beat Ron-Robert Zieler, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
Julian Schieber (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Harm Osmers had an easy-decision to make.
Yellow card! It's like Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Harm Osmers agrees and books him.

It's a goal! Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) shows off his superb ability as he volleys the ball from inside the box into the bottom left corner. The assist goes to Andreas Beck and the score changes to 1:0.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Anastasios Donis comes off for Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart).
Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His low header flies toward the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper blocks the effort.
Ja-Cheol Koo goes off the pitch and Andre Hahn (Augsburg) comes on.
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Julian Schieber is replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Ron-Robert Zieler makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the right-hand post by Andre Hahn (Augsburg) after a cross from the side.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.
Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) picked up a yellow card from referee.
That's the end of the game for Mario Gomez, who is replaced by Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart).
It's like he was asking for a caution. Raphael Framberger (Augsburg) receives a yellow card.
Manuel Baum has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marco Richter (Augsburg) replacing Rani Khedira.

Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) shakes off the attention of a defender and from mid-range lets fly towards the right side of the goal, but Andreas Luthe is well positioned to make a comfortable save. Stuttgart have been awarded a corner kick.
Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) is awarded a yellow card.
The yellow card is received by Ron-Robert Zieler (VfB Stuttgart).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) is coming onto the pitch as Erik Thommy cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but Jiri Pavlenka pulls off a comfortable save. Bayern Munich force a corner. They send men into the box.
Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the left post by a whisker.
Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) finds some space in the penalty area and gets on the end of a beautiful cross to blast the ball under the crossbar!
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) connects with a cross from the side, but produces a header which goes miles wide of the right post.

A neat pass finds Nuri Sahin (Werder Bremen) in space. He needs no second invitation to shoot and hits a piledriver from distance towards the right side of the goal, but Manuel Neuer denies him with a good save.
Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) jumps for a cross and plants a precise header low inside the left post.
Nikolas Moisander (Werder Bremen) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Niko Kovac is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Franck Ribery suffers an injury and Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) comes on.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
Goal! Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner. 1:2.

Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Jiri Pavlenka guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Florian Kohfeldt is forced to make a change. Milos Veljkovic is unable to continue due to injury, Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Johannes Eggestein goes off the pitch and Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Nuri Sahin (Werder Bremen) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Jiri Pavlenka scrambling, but it flies just wide of the right post.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) for Nuri Sahin.

Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Manuel Neuer leaps like a salmon to deny him. The ball is out of play. Werder Bremen will have a chance to score from a corner.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) receives a yellow card.
That will be all from Serge Gnabry who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
A substitution has been made. Thomas Muller is replaced by Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich).
Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) makes a bad challenge and is given a second yellow card which means he's off.
Christian Dingert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) nearly creates a chance, but his attempt to pick out a teammate with a through ball does not come off.
Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar.

Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots towards the right side of the goal. Robin Zentner is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save.
Robin Bormuth (Dusseldorf) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Manuel Grafe didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Daniel Brosinski (Mainz) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending the ball towards the bottom left corner only for Michael Rensing to dive and make a save. Mainz force a corner. They send men into the box.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
It's time for a substitution. Levin Oztunali (Mainz) comes on in place of Jean-Paul Boetius.
Problems for Sandro Schwarz as Daniel Brosinski is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Giulio Donati (Mainz) replaces him.

Superb finishing from Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz). Robin Quaison plays a fantastic through ball and finds Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a low shot from close range past the goalkeeper. It's 0:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) replaces Dodi Lukebakio.

Niko Giesselmann (Dusseldorf) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the bottom left corner is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper. Dusseldorf have been awarded a corner kick.
The substitution has been made. Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) has replaced Oliver Fink.
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf) replacing Jean Zimmer.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Robin Quaison leaves the pitch and Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) comes on.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Giulio Donati (Mainz).

Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the left side of the net, but Robin Zentner leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) times his run into the box beautifully and plants a good looking header at goal from the corner, but the ball flashes just wide of the right post.
Manuel Grafe is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Superb finishing from Bobby Wood (Hannover). Niclas Fullkrug plays a fantastic through ball and finds Bobby Wood (Hannover), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goal and fire a low shot from close range past the goalkeeper. It's 0:1.
Goal! Florian Neuhaus provides Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the top left corner. 1:1.
Problems for Dieter Hecking as Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach) is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Tony Jantschke replaces him.
Michael Lang (B. Monchengladbach) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the bottom left corner.
