Andre Breitenreiter is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee suffers an injury and Genki Haraguchi (Hannover) comes on.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Matthias Ostrzolek (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card for a sharp discussion with the referee. He should relax or he could be sent off.

What a chance that is! Michael Lang (B. Monchengladbach) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross from the free kick, but he steers his header narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.
Goal! Thorgan Hazard puts a cross into the box and finds Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the roof of the net. He makes it 3:1.
Iver Fossum goes off the pitch and Kevin Wimmer (Hannover) comes on.
Here's the change. Linton Maina leaves the pitch and Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) comes on as a substitute.

Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) produced a promising shot towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Michael Esser thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Dieter Hecking has decided to substitute Alassane Plea and he is replaced by Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach).

Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a strong shot towards the right side of the goal, but his effort is denied by the well positioned keeper with a stunning save.

Goal! Tobias Strobl displays great vision and sends a pass to Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 4:1.
The substitution has been made. Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) has replaced Lars Stindl.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) picked up a yellow card from referee.
That's it for today, Daniel Siebert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.

A big opportunity is wasted by Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg), who makes a yard for himself and produces a mid-range rocket of a shot towards the bottom left corner. Unfortunately for him, Jiri Pavlenka pulls off a fantastic save to stop the effort.
Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) latches onto a rebound in the box and fires a shot a whisker wide of the left post. That was a promising chance and maybe he should have done better!
Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen) escapes his marker to meet a cross and heads to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent reflex save to deny him.
The players claim that Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) handled the ball inside the box and it seems they are right. That's a penalty to Freiburg! They have a good chance to score now.
The penalty decision stands after the VAR review. It's a penalty!
Niklas Moisander (Werder Bremen) gets a yellow card. The referee Bastian Dankert made the right call.
Goal! Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Jiri Pavlenka into right side of the goal.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Bastian Dankert blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Booking. Nuri Sahin (Werder Bremen) receives a caution from the referee.
It will be a substitution. Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) is ready to enter the pitch as Martin Harnik walks off.
Florian Kohfeldt decides to make a substitution. Nuri Sahin will be replaced by Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Marco Terrazzino makes way for Nils Petersen (Freiburg).
Here is a change. Johannes Eggestein is going off and Florian Kohfeldt gives the last tactical orders to Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mike Frantz (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch for Jerome Gondorf.

Lucas Holer (Freiburg) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads towards the middle of the goal, but Jiri Pavlenka shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him. Freiburg win a corner.
A loose pass is instantly latched onto by Lucas Holer (Freiburg). He tries his luck from the edge of the box with a measured shot, but it hits the right post and is cleared to safety.
It is time for a substitution. Patrick Kammerbauer (Freiburg) is on for Gian-Luca Waldschmidt.
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) latches onto a cross inside the box and aims a shot towards the middle of the goal, but Alexander Schwolow reacts superbly to deny him.
Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) scores from the corner kick. The ball slipped through the box to Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) and he slotted it past the goalkeeper.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Robert Bauer (Nurnberg) is given a fully deserved yellow card.

Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) leaps highest around the penalty spot to meet a cross from the free kick and produces a promising goal-bound header towards the bottom right corner, but Christian Mathenia produces a fine save to deny him. The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.

Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) picks up a lucky rebound inside the box from the clearance, beats an opponent but drills his shot inches wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.
Goal! Christian Mathenia makes a huge mistake and Steven Skrzybski (Schalke) has an easy task to put the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.
Amine Harit (Schalke) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
Goal! Federico Palacios-Martinez (Nurnberg) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:1.
Benjamin Stambouli (Schalke) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Christian Mathenia has picked up an injury and is replaced by Fabian Bredlow (Nurnberg).
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Guido Winkmann has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Good chance! Steven Skrzybski (Schalke) nicely turned his man inside the box but placed his effort just wide of the right post. He should have scored! The ball goes out of play and Nurnberg will have a goal kick.

Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) takes a short pass in his stride and attempts to beat the keeper from mid-range, but the shot screeches just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Nurnberg.
Robert Bauer (Nurnberg) is sent off! He justly receives a yellow card and it is his second one, a red card must be given. The match ends for him.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) deflects his teammate's shot and the ball goes past the goalkeeper and into the back of the net!
We are about to witness a substitution. Adam Zrelak (Nurnberg) is replacing Mikael Ishak.
Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the left post! What an opportunity that was!
Goal! Adam Zrelak (Nurnberg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the middle of the net. It's 3:2.
Michael Kollner has decided to substitute Yuya Kubo and he is replaced by Vura (Nurnberg).
Substitution. Sebastian Rudy will be replaced by Omar Mascarell (Schalke).
Goal - 4:2! Daniel Caligiuri laid the ball off to Steven Skrzybski (Schalke), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) for Amine Harit.
Here is a change. Steven Skrzybski is going off and Domenico Tedesco gives the last tactical orders to Haji Wright (Schalke).
Bastian Oczipka (Schalke) takes the ball on a solo run and smashes it from just outside the box. The effort goes into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper beaten. Absolutely fantastic!
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets on the end of a long pass that is slotted through the defence and easily sends the ball into the bottom left corner!
The manager makes a subsitution with Marco Russ (Eintracht Frankfurt) coming on for David Abraham.

That was close! Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) makes a good run into the centre of the box and gets his head onto a lofted pass, but sends the ball a fraction over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Eintracht Frankfurt.
CHANCE! Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires just wide of the right post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Luka Jovic.
Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Julian Schieber (Augsburg) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) is first to react to a loose pass inside the box, but slices his shot just wide of the right post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Felix Zwayer has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Manuel Baum has made a change at the break. Marco Richter (Augsburg) has come on in place of Fredrik Jensen.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the middle of the goal.
Marco Richter (Augsburg) goes into the book and receives a yellow card.
It's a goal! Danny da Costa plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 0:3.
It will be a substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) is ready to enter the pitch as Julian Schieber walks off.

Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) evades challenges and shoots from the edge of the box. It's a good effort, but flies just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Eintracht Frankfurt will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has come on for Luka Jovic.

Philipp Max (Augsburg) accepted an accurate pass on the edge of the box and unleashed a decent strike towards the top right corner of the goal. The goalkeeper, however, was alert and thwarted the effort. The ball is out of play. Augsburg will have a chance to score from a corner.
Here is a change. Michael Gregoritsch is going off and Manuel Baum gives the last tactical orders to Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).

Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his daisy-cutter towards the right post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it.
A substitution has been made. Jonathan de Guzman is replaced by Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Goal! Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) fires the rebound into the roof of the net after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:3.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.

That was a nice football moment. Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom left corner. Manuel Neuer guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!

Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) was all set to celebrate a sensational goal after he collected a rebound and blasted a shot in from long range. Unfortunately for him, his effort sailed narrowly wide of the left post. What an unlucky moment for him.
Goal! Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Goal! Jerome Boateng sends a precise cross into the box, Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) latches on to it and puts the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:0.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
Goal! Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top right corner. It's 2:1.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski plays a long ball to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich), who cuts inside and unleashes a screamer into the bottom left corner. The keeper had no chance. Superb strike! 3:1.
Matthias Zimmermann picks out Oliver Fink (Dusseldorf) on the edge of the six-yard box, but the headed attempt bends just round the right post.
Oliver Fink (Dusseldorf) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Sven Jablonski didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Here comes a substitution. Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) is brought on as a substitute for Takashi Usami.
Niko Kovac has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) replacing Franck Ribery.
It is time for a substitution. Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) is on for Oliver Fink.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) scores a goal, but Sven Jablonski makes the VAR signal and is going to check whether the goal can stand.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom right corner. Good team effort!
Substitution. Renato Sanches did his best and is replaced by Rafinha (Bayern Munich).
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to substitute Adam Bodzek and he is replaced by Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf).
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) latches onto a rebound in the box and fires a shot just over the bar. That was a promising chance and maybe he should have done better!
Substitution. Thomas Muller makes his way off the pitch and Mats Hummels (Bayern Munich) comes on as his replacement.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) unleashes a quick low drive into the middle of the net and past the goalkeeper. Here is an example of luck being on your side.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim) finds himself in a very promising position after getting on the end of a brilliant pass and fires the ball inside the right post!

It's a goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) scores with a brilliant shot into the right side of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Oliver Baumann. The score is 0:2.

Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the middle of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
Goal! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:2.

Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) is quickest inside the box and leaps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it floats just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
Oliver Baumann pulls off a great save to deny Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.

Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) homes in on a magnificent reverse pass from Marko Grujic and strikes a crisp shot goalwards that just misses the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Tobias Welz starts the second half.
Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) outjumps the defence in the centre of the box and connects with the free kick from Kerem Demirbay. He sends the ball into the bottom left corner with his towering header and alters the score to 1:3.
Pal Dardai has decided to make a change. Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) replaces Ondrej Duda.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper leaps from the ground and makes a stunning save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Hertha Berlin.

What an opportunity! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) leaps high to meet a beautiful cross into the box from the free kick, and he plants a header from near the penalty spot which goes a whisker over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Hoffenheim will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Adam Szalai makes way for Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim).
It's a goal! Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) scores with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Davie Selke. The score is now 2:3.
A great run from Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) ends with a shot inside the box that flashes just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Andrej Kramaric as he is replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Hoffenheim).
Joelinton (Hoffenheim) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
It's a yellow card for Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim).

What a big chance! Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hoffenheim.

Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards the goal. To the amazement of all, it goes inside the left post. He makes it 3:3 with this magnificent strike.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) is coming onto the pitch as Havard Nordtveit cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Axel Witsel (Dortmund) had a golden opportunity. He volleyed from point blank range towards the roof of the net, but Robin Zentner was alert and made an amazing save!
Marco Reus (Dortmund) leaps like a salmon to meet a lofted ball into the box, but his header from near the penalty spot fizzes narrowly wide of the right post.

Axel Witsel (Dortmund) had a good chance to change the score. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a shot from just outside the penalty area which went straight towards the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper was ready and made an amazing save. It will be a corner kick for Dortmund.
A yellow card for a tackle by Alexander Hack (Mainz). Deniz Aytekin doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
A snap shot by Aaron Caricol (Mainz) from the edge of the area flies towards the roof of the net, but Roman Burki produces a good save to thwart him. Corner kick. Mainz will have an opportunity.
Pierre Kunde Malong (Mainz) sees a yellow card from Deniz Aytekin after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Thomas Delaney (Dortmund) for a tough tackle.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Good team movement sets up Danny Latza (Mainz) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
It's time for a substitution. Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) comes on in place of Mario Gotze.
Goal! Marco Reus tees up Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to score low into the middle of the goal. 0:1.
Robin Quaison (Mainz) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home low into the middle of the net. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) replacing Robin Quaison.
A long pass from defence releases Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) on the edge of the box, but his snap shot somehow flies just past the right post. The crowd thought it was in!
Lukasz Piszczek (Dortmund) gets to a rebound just outside the penalty area and unleashes a fabulous effort that ricochets in off the crossbar.
Today's match ends for Alexander Hack who will be replaced by Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz).
Lucien Favre has decided to substitute Jacob Bruun Larsen and he is replaced by Christian Pulisic (Dortmund).
Sandro Schwarz prepares a substitution. Danny Latza is replaced by Alexandru Maxim (Mainz).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Achraf Hakimi departs the field of play to be replaced by Abdou Diallo (Dortmund).
That's it for today, Deniz Aytekin has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Willi Orban (RB Leipzig).

Well-positioned Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Peter Gulacsi reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop!

Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) wasted a huge opportunity! He received a fine cross from the free kick and fired a decent shot in from close range. Unfortunately for him, it sailed narrowly wide of the right post!
Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) produces an effort from the edge of the box, but doesn't hit the ball properly and sends it yards wide of the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Tobias Stieler blows his whistle and the second half starts.
OFF THE POST! Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) takes a shot from outside the box and hits the right post!

OFF THE POST! Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) found himself some space to take a shot from just outside the box. His effort was headed to the bottom left corner, but Koen Casteels came up with a save and tipped the ball onto the post. RB Leipzig win a corner.
Goal! 1:0. Jerome Roussillon (Wolfsburg) taps home from almost on the goal line after a lucky rebound fell at his feet.
Ralf Rangnick has decided to make a change. Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) replaces Marcel Halstenberg.
It will be a substitution. Marcelo Saracchi (RB Leipzig) is ready to enter the pitch as Willi Orban walks off.
We are about to witness a substitution. Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) is replacing Daniel Ginczek.
Here's the change. Admir Mehmedi leaves the pitch and Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) comes on as a substitute.
Ralf Rangnick decides to make a substitution. Konrad Laimer will be replaced by Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig).
A yellow-coloured card is received by Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Elvis Rexhbecaj trots off the pitch and is replaced by Felix Uduokhai (Wolfsburg).
Ibrahima Konate (RB Leipzig) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart).
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) sends in a shot from a promising distance after a precise pass. His effort goes inches over the crossbar.
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Schroder didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. He sends the ball into orbit.
Golden opportunity! Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) lost his marker inside the box, only to shoot just wide of the left post after receiving a good pass.
Pablo Maffeo (VfB Stuttgart) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Schroder ignores the protests.
The foul by Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Schroder.
A yellow card for a tackle by Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen). Robert Schroder doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The whistle blows and Marc-Oliver Kempf (VfB Stuttgart) is booked for an infringement.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Half-time substitution. Markus Weinzierl decided to make a change. Pablo Maffeo is replaced by Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart).
A clever short pass gives Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) a clear goal scoring opportunity, but he fluffs his lines and rifles the ball high over the bar.
Today's match ends for Tin Jedvaj who will be replaced by Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen).
Heiko Herrlich decides to make a substitution. Aranguiz will be replaced by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).

A perfect lofted pass from Kai Havertz finds Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Ron-Robert Zieler had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
Heiko Herrlich prepares a substitution. Lars Bender is replaced by Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen).
The substitution is prepared. Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Christian Gentner.
It will be a substitution. Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) is ready to enter the pitch as Dennis Aogo walks off.

It's a goal! Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) scores with a brilliant shot into the roof of the net after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Lucas Alario. The score is now 2:0.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
That's it for today, Robert Schroder has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Benjamin Cortus shows a yellow card to Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) for his blatant foul.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Domenico Tedesco is forced to make a change. Mark Uth is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke).
Breel Embolo (Schalke) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Kevin Trapp pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom right corner in trademark fashion.
Here comes a substitution. Weston McKennie (Schalke) is brought on as a substitute for Suat Serdar.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) squanders a golden opportunity after striking the ball onto the post of the goal!

Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has reason to celebrate! His first-time shot from the edge of the area goes low into the middle of the net and past the goalkeeper. Some might blame the keeper for that, but it's hard to say whether he should have saved it. 2:0.
The main referee, Benjamin Cortus, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Salif Sane (Schalke) is given a yellow card for dissent.

OFF THE CROSSBAR! Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Goal! Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires the rebound into the roof of the net after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 3:0.
Substitution. Luka Jovic makes way for Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Domenico Tedesco has decided to make a change. Amine Harit (Schalke) replaces Breel Embolo.
It is time for a substitution. Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) is on for Gelson Fernandes.
Adi Hutter decides to make a substitution. Filip Kostic will be replaced by Taleb Tawatha (Eintracht Frankfurt).
That's it for today, Benjamin Cortus has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Lukas Hradecky stops the ball from going into the top of the net. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for RB Leipzig.
What a goal that is! Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) gets to the ball inside the box and brilliantly lifts the ball over Lukas Hradecky and into the net. 1:0.
Big chance! A simple pass from Timo Werner left Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) with just the keeper to beat inside the box, but his shot went agonisingly just past the left post.
Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) amazingly found his way through the defence, but lacked a precise finish as his effort from close range went slightly over the crossbar.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) sees a yellow card from Martin Petersen after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The match has reached half-time.
Martin Petersen blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Heiko Herrlich gives a chance to Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) and Tin Jedvaj is off.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Aranguiz.
Lukas Klostermann (RB Leipzig) receives a well-taken defence-splitting pass inside the box and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom left corner.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to substitute Mitchell Weiser and he is replaced by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Lukas Hradecky.

Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) unleashes a shot goalwards from a mid-range free kick. The ball heads towards the right post, but the goalkeeper makes a decent save to thwart him. Bayer Leverkusen force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Substitution. Timo Werner did his best and is replaced by Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig).
GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 3:0.
Here is a change. Marcel Sabitzer is going off and Ralf Rangnick gives the last tactical orders to Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig).
A substitution has been made. Kevin Kampl is replaced by Bruma (RB Leipzig).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a precise pass in the box and takes the shot early. The ball heads low towards the middle of the goal, but Manuel Neuer shows off his skills and makes a brilliant save to deny him.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) finds some space inside the box and latches on to a brilliant cross, but he wastes his chance as his shot goes way wide of the left post.

It's a goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) bursts into the box to get on the end of a whipped in cross from Serge Gnabry and scores magnificently from close range into the right side of the goal. 0:1.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Julian Weigl (Dortmund) for his blatant foul.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) collects a rebound and his promising attempt heads towards the middle of the goal, but Marwin Hitz keeps it out with an amazing save.
Manuel Akanji (Dortmund) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Lucien Favre probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Julian Weigl. He is replaced by Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund).
Manuel Neuer (Bayern Munich) brings his opponent down. Manuel Grafe has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle for a foul. Dortmund have been awarded a penalty kick!
Goal! Marco Reus (Dortmund) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Manuel Neuer into right side of the goal.
It's in the back of the net! Joshua Kimmich puts the ball on a plate for Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich), who has an easy finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 1:2.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Manuel Grafe had an easy-decision to make.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a neat pass inside the box and instantly thumps the ball goalward, but a defender makes a last ditch block to deny him.
Substitution. Mario Gotze leaves the pitch and is replaced by Paco Alcacer (Dortmund).
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Close! Marco Reus (Dortmund) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
Here is a change. Mats Hummels is going off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical orders to Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich).
What a hit! Marco Reus (Dortmund) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 2:2.

What a brilliant goal by Paco Alcacer (Dortmund)! He collected a well-executed pass that had put him one-on-one with the goalkeeper. He took the goal-scoring opportunity with a shot to the middle of the goal past the keeper.
Substitution. Serge Gnabry walks off the pitch and Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) comes on as a substitute.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) will replace Thomas Muller.
Lucien Favre prepares a substitution. Jacob Bruun Larsen is replaced by Thomas Delaney (Dortmund).
Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) has tested the patience of referee Manuel Grafe and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) gets a yellow card.
Caution goes to Marwin Hitz (Dortmund).
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has a goal ruled out for offside!
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
CHANCE! Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a low shot towards Michael Rensing, who produces an excellent reflex save.
Substitution. Niklas Stark makes way for Derrick Luckassen (Hertha Berlin).
Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) has tested the patience of referee Robert Hartmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Robert Hartmann blows his whistle and Maximilian Mittelstadt (Hertha Berlin) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Vedad Ibisevic comes off for Jordan Torunarigha (Hertha Berlin).
A sweet pass is collected by Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf) inside the penalty box and he unleashes a brilliant shot which goes into the roof of the net and behind the goalkeeper.
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Ondrej Duda will be replaced by Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin).
Goal! Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 2:0. He was ably assisted there by Matthias Zimmermann.
Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) comes onto the pitch so that Dodi Lukebakio can be given a rest.
Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf) makes a good run to meet a precise cross just outside the box. He latches on to it and strikes the ball, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Adam Bodzek (Dusseldorf) was quite harsh and Robert Hartmann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee shows a yellow card to Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin). No wonder. A clear yellow for bad language.
Today's match ends for Jean Zimmer who will be replaced by Benito Raman (Dusseldorf).

Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Rune Jarstein is just a bystander as the ball flies low into the middle of the goal. The score is 3:0.

Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Michael Rensing is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 3:1.
Friedhelm Funkel prepares a substitution. Rouwen Hennings is replaced by Oliver Fink (Dusseldorf).

Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads under the crossbar, but is stopped by a great save from Michael Rensing. Hertha Berlin force a corner. They send men into the box.
Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Rune Jarstein with a low strike into the middle of the goal. He makes it 4:1.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.

What a beautiful moment! Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the bottom left corner. Alexander Schwolow just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 0:1.

Pierre Kunde Malong (Mainz) finds himself in space on the edge of the box and smashes a glorious looking effort towards the right side of the goal, but Alexander Schwolow thwarts him with a great two-handed save.
Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header inside the right post. Excellent finish.
Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going inside the left post, but Alexander Schwolow has other ideas and makes a brilliant save.
What a save from Robin Zentner! Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Christian Streich has made a change at the break. Roland Sallai (Freiburg) has come on in place of Mike Frantz.

Chance! Pascal Stenzel sends a brilliant curling cross into the heart of the defence and into the path of Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg), whose header from the centre of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
Substitution. Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) in, Jean-Philippe Mateta out.
Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but Robin Zentner pulls off a comfortable save.
Goal! Roland Sallai (Freiburg) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:2.
We are about to witness a substitution. Lucas Holer (Freiburg) is replacing Pascal Stenzel.

Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Alexander Schwolow is just a bystander as the ball flies into the right side of the goal. The score is 1:3.
It should have been a goal! Robin Koch (Freiburg) fires a rocket of a shot but it only hits the crossbar!
What was Pierre Kunde Malong (Mainz) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Substitution. Philipp Mwene (Mainz) replaces Jean-Paul Boetius.
Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) has tested the patience of referee Sascha Stegemann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Philipp Lienhart (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch after Nicolas Hofler signals to the bench that he cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Sandro Schwarz prepares a substitution. Robin Quaison is replaced by Alexander Hack (Mainz).
Sascha Stegemann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Pierre Kunde Malong (Mainz) receives a yellow card.
The match has just started.
Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Andreas Luthe pulls off a fantastic save! Joelinton (Hoffenheim) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the top right corner, but the effort is kept out.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.

The opposition back off Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) and he lashes in a shot from the edge of the box that just flies a whisker wide of the left post. Unlucky! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Augsburg.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) shows off his amazing technique to get in front of goal by himself. He pulls the trigger but sends the ball onto the right post. Nice run, but unlucky finish!
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect low strike that goes inside the right post. What a clinical goal!
Substitution. Vincenzo Grifo (Hoffenheim) replaces Leonardo Bittencourt.
Goal! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) picks up a pass and gets to the edge of the box before clipping a brilliant lob over the goalkeeper and into the empty net. He makes it 1:1.

Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by Oliver Baumann, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The ball goes out of play. Augsburg are awarded a corner kick.
Francisco Caiuby is being substituted because of an injury. Manuel Baum sends Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) on the pitch.
This is a yellow card! Havard Nordtveit (Hoffenheim) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
It will be a substitution. Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) is ready to enter the pitch as Nico Schulz walks off.
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) dribbles his way to the edge of the box and drills a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Andreas Luthe is equal to the effort and makes a good save.
Goal! A rebound wrong foots everyone except Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim), and he slams the ball into the open net from close range. 2:1.
Julian Nagelsmann decides to make a substitution. Andrej Kramaric will be replaced by Joshua Brenet (Hoffenheim).
Substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo will be replaced by Julian Schieber (Augsburg).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Georg Margreitter (Nurnberg) connects well with the free kick, but heads the ball just wide of the right post from close in.

Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) bursts into the box and pulls the trigger, but he can't beat the goalkeeper. He directed his shot towards the left post, but one of the defenders reacted brilliantly to block it. The referee points to the corner flag and Stuttgart will take a corner.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) covers his face with his hands after wasting a glorious chance. The ball rebounded to him but his close-range header went a whisker wide of the left post.
Adam Zrelak (Nurnberg) connects with an accurate pass inside the box and fires the ball to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players steps in to block the effort.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.

Sebastian Kerk (Nurnberg) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he unleashed a powerful shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom right corner, but Ron-Robert Zieler made a crucial save! Nurnberg have been awarded a corner kick.
Sebastian Kerk comes off the pitch to be replaced by Federico Palacios-Martinez (Nurnberg).
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) takes the rebound on the edge of the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.

Goal! Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. Christian Mathenia is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 0:1.
Ondrej Petrak (Nurnberg) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Hanno Behrens.
Alexander Fuchs (Nurnberg) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to substitute Pablo Maffeo and he is replaced by Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart).

Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous low effort towards the middle of the goal is blocked by Christian Mathenia, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Benjamin Pavard (VfB Stuttgart) is quickest inside the box and jumps to connect with the resulting set piece. He produces a fine header, but it flies just wide of the right post.
Goal! Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) fires the rebound into the top right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:2.
Substitution. Alexander Fuchs walks off the pitch and Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg) comes on as a substitute.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to make a change. Antonis Aidonis (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Santiago Ascacibar.
Substitution. Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Mario Gomez walks off.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has just begun.
The defence just can't clear the ball and a rebound eventually falls to Tobias Strobl (B. Monchengladbach) deep inside the box, but his well-hit shot flies just wide of the left post.
Close! Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) picks up a pass and produces a ferocious strike towards the right post, but the goalkeeper gets his fingertips to the ball to keep it out.
Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) received a pass and didn't think long what to do with it. He fired a powerful long-range shot which went painfully close to the right post.
A pass into the box finds Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) unmarked. He carefully places a shot towards the bottom right corner, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Yann Sommer denies him.

Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort. The referee points to the corner flag and Werder Bremen will take a corner.

An amazing individual effort from Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom left corner and makes it 0:1. Jiri Pavlenka was helpless.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Florian Kohfeldt makes a switch. Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) is coming on in place of Philipp Bargfrede at the start of the second period.

The ball hits the back of the net! Thorgan Hazard delivers the corner, Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) finds himself some space on the edge of the box and unleashes an unstoppable low shot which goes past the helpless goalkeeper. 0:2.
Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the left side of the goal.
Goal! Ludwig Augustinsson tees up Nuri Sahin (Werder Bremen) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom right corner. 1:3.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jonas Hofmann.
Here is a change. Lars Stindl is going off and Dieter Hecking gives the last tactical orders to Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach).
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.
Here comes a substitution. Nuri Sahin is given a rest as he is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) connects with a cross from out wide in the six-yard box, but only plants his header onto the bar.

Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots towards the middle of the goal. Jiri Pavlenka is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save. The ball goes out of play and B. Monchengladbach have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Alassane Plea will be replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Florian Kohfeldt prepares a substitution. Martin Harnik is replaced by Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen).
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) finds the back of the net and gets on the scoresheet.
The Wolfsburg players celebrate the goal but the referee immediately signals a VAR review. Let's see what happens. Big moment in the game.
Goal, no wait. Marco Fritz blows his whistle for handball and Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) can't celebrate. Disallowed goal.

Ihlas Bebou sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Linton Maina (Hannover) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:0.
Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) was close to scoring after he unleashed a powerful shot which went a whisker wide of the right post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Marco Fritz starts the second half.
Bruno Labbadia makes a switch. Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) is coming on in place of Daniel Ginczek at the start of the second period.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Bruno Labbadia probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Elvis Rexhbecaj. He is replaced by John Yeboah (Wolfsburg).
Michael Esser pulls off a great save to deny Jerome Roussillon (Wolfsburg), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
William (Wolfsburg) brings his opponent down. Marco Fritz has a clear sight of it and blows his whistle for a foul. Penalty awarded! Hannover will take a penalty kick.
William (Wolfsburg) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Goal! Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Koen Casteels into left side of the goal.
Today's referee Marco Fritz rightly decides to book Matthias Ostrzolek (Hannover) for his harsh tackle.
The substitution is prepared. Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Noah-Joel Sarenren-Bazee.
Yellow card! It's like Michael Esser (Hannover) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Marco Fritz agrees and books him.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a change. Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) replaces Linton Maina.
A yellow card for a tackle by Walace (Hannover). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) commits an ugly tackle on his opponent, but there is no caution from the referee. The referee's verdict is crystal clear. A penalty is awarded to Wolfsburg!
Goal! Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) puts the ball into the roof of the net past the outstretched arm of Michael Esser.
Today's match ends for Bobby Wood who will be replaced by Genki Haraguchi (Hannover).
Waldemar Anton (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Marco Fritz ignores the protests.
John Brooks (Wolfsburg) sees a yellow card from Marco Fritz after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
A great pass puts Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) clear inside the box, he sidesteps the keeper but inexplicably hit his shot off the crossbar.
Goal! Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 1:0.
Great ball in from Stefan Bell. Danny Latza (Mainz) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the left post.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Daniel Brosinski passes to Jean-Philippe Gbamin (Mainz), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 2:0.
Substitution. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) in, Yuya Osako out.
Florian Kohfeldt prepares a substitution. Florian Kainz is replaced by Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen).
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) has tested the patience of referee Guido Winkmann and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) is coming onto the pitch as Philipp Bargfrede cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Anthony Ujah (Mainz) replacing Jean-Philippe Mateta.
A great run and pass by Johannes Eggestein gives Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) the simplest of tasks to score into an empty net. 2:1.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Nikolas Moisander (Werder Bremen) gets booked.
Substitution. Robin Quaison walks off the pitch and Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) comes on as a substitute.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to make a change. Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) replaces Danny Latza.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.

Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Michael Rensing, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) latches onto a lofted pass on the edge of the six-yard box, but powers a header just over the bar.
Raffael (B. Monchengladbach) collects a wonderful lead pass and creates some space to smash the ball goalwards from long range. His shot goes painfully wide of the left post!
The ball rebounds off the defender into the path of Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach), who immediately strikes for goal from inside the box but sends it a whisker wide of the right post.
Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) is booked for saying more than Felix Brych was willing to tolerate.
Felix Brych has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
The game has come to an end for Nico Elvedi. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach).
Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf) is cautioned and receives a yellow card.
Handball! A player from Dusseldorf handled the ball. B. Monchengladbach are awarded a penalty. What an opportunity to score!
Goal! Michael Rensing gets a hand on the penalty from Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach), but can't stop it from flying into the bottom left corner.
Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) has tested the patience of referee Felix Brych and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
A substitution has been made. Raffael is replaced by Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach).
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to make a change. Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf) replaces Marvin Ducksch.
Florian Neuhaus feeds the ball through to Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 2:0!
A pass into the box finds Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) unmarked. He carefully places a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but a brilliant last-ditch save by Yann Sommer denies him.
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to substitute Takashi Usami and he is replaced by Davor Lovren (Dusseldorf).
Goal! Alassane Plea passes the ball to Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Michael Rensing couldn't do anything about it. 3:0.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) for Jonas Hofmann.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) gets inside the box and tries to beat Rune Jarstein with a measured shot into the bottom right corner, but the keeper is equal to the effort and makes a fine save. Now RB Leipzig have a corner.
Goal 0:1! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) gets a yellow card.
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) for a heavy challenge.

Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the bottom right corner. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save! Hertha Berlin have been awarded a corner kick.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Ralf Rangnick probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Nordi Mukiele. He is replaced by Lukas Klostermann (RB Leipzig).
Goal - 0:2! Bruma tees up Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Rune Jarstein.
A substitution has been made. Vedad Ibisevic is replaced by Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin).
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Javairo Dilrosun (Hertha Berlin) replacing Marvin Plattenhardt.
Substitution. Salomon Kalou leaves the pitch and is replaced by Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin).
The ball spins out to Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) and his swerving volley from the edge of the box flashes just past the left post.

What a beautiful moment! Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the top of the net. Rune Jarstein just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 0:3.
Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Deniz Aytekin didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Ralf Rangnick has decided to substitute Timo Werner and he is replaced by Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig).
Substitution. Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) in, Kevin Kampl out.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Goal! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Jonathan Schmid. The score is 1:0.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.
Christian Mathenia makes a brilliant save! Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) met a rebound outside the box and attempted to beat the keeper into the top of the net.
Tim Leibold (Nurnberg) has tested the patience of referee Patrick Ittrich and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Manuel Baum probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Ja-Cheol Koo. He is replaced by Felix Gotze (Augsburg).
Alexander Fuchs (Nurnberg) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Vura (Nurnberg) jumps inside the box to meet the corner and aims a header towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off an astonishing save to deny him.
Goal! Alexander Fuchs (Nurnberg) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the top right corner. He makes it 1:1.
A substitution has been made. Sebastian Kerk goes off and Federico Palacios-Martinez (Nurnberg) comes on.

Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the top right corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 2:1.
Marco Richter (Augsburg) beats an opponent and drives towards the edge of the penalty area. He steadies himself and hits a tremendous shot that flashes a whisker past the left post.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Marco Richter as he is replaced by Andre Hahn (Augsburg).
Michael Kollner decides to make a substitution. Hanno Behrens will be replaced by Simon Rhein (Nurnberg).
Georg Margreitter (Nurnberg) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) receives the ball inside the box from the resulting free kick, but fails to score as his shot is blocked by one of the defenders.
Patrick Ittrich shows the yellow card to Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) for a heavy challenge.
Alexander Fuchs rounds off a good move with a layoff to Adam Zrelak (Nurnberg) inside the box, he has a clear sight of goal but sends the ball just wide of the left post.
A substitution has been made. Alexander Fuchs is replaced by Torless Knoll (Nurnberg).
Lukas Muhl (Nurnberg) leaps highest to meet a perfectly taken free kick and steers his header past the helpless goalkeeper.
The yellow card is received by Andre Hahn (Augsburg).
Wasted opportunity. Rani Khedira (Augsburg) gets to the rebound inside the box and smashes the ball just wide of the right post.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes just a few inches over the bar! What a huge opportunity!
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim) for a tough tackle.
Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) collects a sweet pass and fires a shot inside the right post. What a brilliant shot!
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the right side of the goal.
It's a goal! Joelinton (Hoffenheim) bursts into the box to get on the end of a whipped in cross from Pavel Kaderabek and scores magnificently from close range into the left side of the goal. 1:2.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Oliver Baumann stops the ball from going inside the left post.
Problems for Heiko Herrlich as Karim Bellarabi is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces him.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Julian Baumgartlinger (Bayer Leverkusen) is coming onto the pitch as Sven Bender cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee blows his whistle as Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) was too aggressive in his challenge. The referee points to the penalty spot. Hoffenheim are awarded a penalty kick!
Goal! Vincenzo Grifo (Hoffenheim) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Lukas Hradecky into the bottom right corner.

Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box and plants a towering header towards the top of the net, but Oliver Baumann is alert and thwarts the effort by deflecting it onto the bar. Bayer Leverkusen will take a corner kick.
Julian Nagelsmann is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Kevin Vogt suffers an injury and Ermin Bicakcic (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Oliver Baumann to dive and make a save.
Substitution. Reiss Nelson makes his way off the pitch and Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) comes on as his replacement.
Substitution. Paulinho (Bayer Leverkusen) replaces Julian Brandt.
Joelinton (Hoffenheim) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Lukas Hradecky with a strike into the right side of the goal. He makes it 1:4.
Tobias Stieler shows the yellow card to Nuhu Kasim (Hoffenheim) for a heavy challenge.
Vincenzo Grifo comes off the pitch to be replaced by Leonardo Bittencourt (Hoffenheim).
Tobias Stieler is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) bursts into the box after a fine solo run. He looks up and tries to place a shot into the bottom left corner, but Alexander Schwolow makes a great save to deny him his moment of glory.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the bottom left corner, but he can't get the power to direct it past Alexander Schwolow, who gets down to save.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
A goal, which was scored by Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg), was disallowed due to offside.
There's a break in play and referee Felix Zwayer must have got a signal in his ear as he indicates he will check that earlier penalty claim by Bayern Munich using VAR. This could be interesting!
Here comes the refâ€™s decision after the VAR review. Itâ€™s not penalty as the referee indicates there was no infringement.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Arjen Robben.
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Mike Frantz is replaced by Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg).
The referee allows time for a substitution. James Rodriguez will be replaced by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich).
Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) receives the ball from the resulting free kick and unleashes a strike from the edge of the box, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the right post!
Alexander Schwolow (Freiburg) earns the yellow card.
Yellow card. Rafinha (Bayern Munich) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

An amazing individual effort from Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and makes it 1:0. Alexander Schwolow was helpless.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) replaces Serge Gnabry.
Christian Streich has decided to make a change. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) replaces Tim Kleindienst.
Lucas Holer (Freiburg) meets a perfect cross from Christian Gunter deep inside the box, and he produces an accurate strike which goes into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:1.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Lucas Holer walks off the pitch to be replaced by Philipp Lienhart (Freiburg).
Felix Zwayer is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

The corner is swung in and Martins Felipe (Hannover) leaps above the defence only to send his header a whisker wide of the left post from close in. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Schalke.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Mark Uth (Schalke) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Referee Markus Schmidt sees the trip by Josip Elez (Hannover) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. Schalke have been awarded a penalty kick!
Wait a minute! The referee has decided to review the penalty decision using the VAR system.
The Schalke players are stunned as the referee changes his mind following the VAR review. NO PENALTY.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) has tested the patience of referee Markus Schmidt and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kevin Wimmer (Hannover) is coming onto the pitch as Martins Felipe cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) latches onto a cross inside the box but fires a poor effort well wide of the left post.
Kevin Wimmer (Hannover) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Philipp Tschauner makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the bottom left corner by Mark Uth (Schalke).
The referee blows his whistle as Philipp Tschauner (Hannover) was too aggressive in his challenge. Penalty awarded! Schalke will take a penalty kick.
Goal! Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Philipp Tschauner into the bottom right corner.
Substitution. Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Suat Serdar walks off.

Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) receives a good pass and from just outside the box he unleashes a promising strike, but the shot is blocked by the defender. The ball goes out of play. Schalke are awarded a corner kick.
Here is a change. Kevin Wimmer is going off and Andre Breitenreiter gives the last tactical orders to Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover).
Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Ihlas Bebou displays his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross deep into the box. Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) gets onto the scoresheet by superbly heading it into the roof of the net â€“ 1:1.
Breel Embolo (Schalke) latches on to an inch-perfect pass and produces a low drive from the edge of the box which goes into the middle of the goal and past the helpless goalkeeper.
That's the end of the game for Nabil Bentaleb, who is replaced by Sebastian Rudy (Schalke).
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Florent Muslija (Hannover) replacing Iver Fossum.
Waldemar Anton (Hannover) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Sebastian Rudy (Schalke) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Goal! Mark Uth (Schalke) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 3:1.
Weston McKennie (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Amine Harit.

A sweet pass finds Bobby Wood (Hannover) on the edge of the box, and he drills the ball towards the left side of the goal. Alexander Nubel is almost caught out but pulls off a brilliant save at the last second.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
GOAL! Thomas Delaney connects with a delightful cross and heads it towards Marco Reus (Dortmund), whose header goes past Koen Casteels. 0:1.
Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
Thomas Delaney (Dortmund) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.
The end of the first half.
Referee Daniel Siebert blows his whistle to start the second half.

Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) knew what to do with the ball, but was just a bit unlucky. After receiving a pass, he sent the ball goalwards from some 25 metres out, but it missed the left post by a whisker.
Elvis Rexhbecaj will be replaced by Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg).

A big opportunity is wasted by Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg), who makes a yard for himself and produces a mid-range rocket of a shot towards the middle of the goal. Unfortunately for him, Roman Burki pulls off a fantastic save to stop the effort. Wolfsburg earn a corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Paco Alcacer departs the field of play to be replaced by Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund).
Lucien Favre has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) replacing Jadon Sancho.
It is time for a substitution. Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) is on for Yannick Gerhardt.
Josip Brekalo goes off the pitch and John Yeboah (Wolfsburg) comes on.
Substitution. Jacob Bruun Larsen makes way for Omer Toprak (Dortmund).
Daniel Siebert is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Goal!!! Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) strikes the ball inside the net.
Referee Sven Jablonski gets a signal in his ear and goes over to the VAR monitor to check whether the goal can stand.
Here comes the VAR decision. NO GOAL, the ref disallows it due to offside.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) was quite harsh and Sven Jablonski didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) blows a huge opportunity! He latches on to a perfect cross from the wing into the penalty area, but sends his bullet header just wide of the right post.

Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) shakes off the attention of a defender and from mid-range lets fly towards the bottom right corner, but Ron-Robert Zieler is well positioned to make a comfortable save.
Goal! The rebound fell to Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) and he fired home from close range. The score is 0:1.
Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) gets on the end of a cross from Dennis Aogo, but his shot goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the middle of the net, but Ron-Robert Zieler is alert and denies him.
It's a goal! Luka Jovic sends a long raking pass onto the head of Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who makes no mistake from close in and sends the ball into the left side of the goal. 0:2.

Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) tries his luck from a long-range free kick and fires the ball to the right side of the goal, but Kevin Trapp is alert and thwarts the effort. Stuttgart have been awarded a corner kick.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Sven Jablonski had an easy-decision to make.
A precise short pass from Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez releases Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) in space inside the box, but he smashes a wild shot high over the bar.
Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) has tested the patience of referee Sven Jablonski and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Sven Jablonski has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Half-time substitution. Markus Weinzierl decided to make a change. Erik Thommy is replaced by Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart).
The game is over for Gelson Fernandes. Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on for the second half.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) does well to meet a cross from Danny da Costa, but he directs his shot just wide of the right post.

Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Ron-Robert Zieler to get hold of the ball.
Stuttgart have a goal ruled out for offside!
The substitution has been made. Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) has replaced Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez.
Good team movement sets up Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
Nicolai Muller (Eintracht Frankfurt) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ante Rebic.
Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart) has picked up an injury and is replaced by Gonzalo Castro.
Filip Kostic comes off the pitch to be replaced by Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Goal! Jetro Willems picks out Nicolai Muller (Eintracht Frankfurt) with a perfect cross, and he has no problem to nod the ball into an empty net. It's 0:3.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Marco Fritz shows a yellow card to Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen). This could have been a legendary goal.

Jiri Pavlenka makes a brilliant save! Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) easily weaves through the defence and fires the ball from mid-range. His effort goes towards the bottom left corner but is saved by the keeper! Bayer Leverkusen will take a corner kick.
Goal! Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 0:2.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen).
It's in the back of the net! Kevin Volland is the provider as he slips the ball to Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) who simply steers it home from close range. It's 0:3.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Florian Kohfeldt probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Marco Friedl. He is replaced by Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
A yellow card for a tackle by Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Karim Bellarabi goes off the pitch and Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on.
