An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the right post.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to substitute Lars Bender and he is replaced by Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen).
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. What a clinical finish!
Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.
Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) scores from the corner kick. The ball slipped through the box to Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) and he slotted it past the goalkeeper.
What an outstanding solo effort by Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) as he weaves through the defence inside the box and rolls the ball into the back of net.
The substitution is prepared. Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Nuri Sahin.
Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) collects the ball deep inside the box from a rebound after the corner kick. He beats the keeper with a sharp shot! It's a goal!
Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yuya Osako departs the field of play to be replaced by Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen).
Heiko Herrlich prepares a substitution. Kai Havertz is replaced by Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.

Nabil Bentaleb whips in the corner and finds Breel Embolo (Schalke) in space with just the keeper to beat, but somehow he plants his header just past the right post from close in. He should have scored!
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Weston McKennie (Schalke) gets booked.
The whistle blows and Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) is booked for an infringement.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
Hamza Mendyl (Schalke) is cautioned by the referee.
The corner is sent into the box by Nabil Bentaleb, but Weston McKennie (Schalke) flashes the ball just over the bar.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Substitution. Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) on for Hamza Mendyl.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) comes onto the pitch for Stefan Ilsanker.
Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Brych ignores the protests.
Ralf Rangnick prepares a substitution. Konrad Laimer is replaced by Bruma (RB Leipzig).
Here comes a substitution. Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) is brought on as a substitute for Timo Werner.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to substitute Mark Uth and he is replaced by Steven Skrzybski (Schalke).
Domenico Tedesco has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) replacing Breel Embolo.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.

Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) receives a quality pass and releases a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just wide of the right post. The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one.
Robert Schroder shows the yellow card to Obite Evan N'Dicka (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a heavy challenge.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads it low towards the left side of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him.
Torless Knoll (Nurnberg) gathers a cross inside the box and strikes the ball. He wastes a great scoring opportunity as his shot only hits the right-hand post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Schroder has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Sebastian Kerk (Nurnberg) takes the free kick from long range and unleashes a strong shot. Unfortunately for him the ball curls inches over the crossbar. What a squandered chance!
A yellow card for a tackle by Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt). Robert Schroder doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Adi Hutter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with  Allan (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Mijat Gacinovic.
Substitution. Ante Rebic makes way for Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Federico Palacios-Martinez (Nurnberg) replaces Sebastian Kerk.
Substitution. Torless Knoll will be replaced by Adam Zrelak (Nurnberg).

Yuya Kubo (Nurnberg) meets a pass on the edge of the penalty area and shoots towards the bottom right corner. He didn't put enough power into the effort, though, and Kevin Trapp pulls off an easy save. Nurnberg have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Adam Zrelak (Nurnberg) finds some space inside the box and powers his header past the goalkeeper, giving him no chance.
Substitution. Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Jonathan de Guzman.
Simon Rhein (Nurnberg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Schroder didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Patrick Erras (Nurnberg) will replace Yuya Kubo.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Kevin Trapp (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Adam Zrelak (Nurnberg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Schroder ignores the protests.

Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a perfect cross from Danny da Costa deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:1.
That's it for today, Robert Schroder has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

There's a break in play and the referee must have got a signal in his ear as he indicates he will check that earlier infringement by Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) using VAR. This could result in a red card!
Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and is sent off by the referee!
Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box, but the ball crashes against the crossbar! It would have been a superb goal.
Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) sees his header crash off the right post after meeting a corner kick inside the six-yard box. The goalkeeper would have been helpless.
Frank Willenborg shows a yellow card to Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Julian Nagelsmann is forced to make a change. Florian Grillitsch is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim).
Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked.
A yellow card for a tackle by Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim). Frank Willenborg doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) produced a promising shot towards the bottom left corner after his wonderful solo run, but Ron-Robert Zieler thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
Goal! Joshua Brenet (Hoffenheim) fires the rebound into the roof of the net after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Goal! Joshua Brenet puts the ball on a plate for Joelinton (Hoffenheim), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 2:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Mario Gomez leaves the pitch and Hans Nunoo Sarpei (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.
Goal - 3:0! Joelinton laid the ball off to Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim), who shot from close range into the bottom right corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
GOAL! Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 4:0.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Vincenzo Grifo (Hoffenheim) replacing Andrej Kramaric.
Substitution. Havard Nordtveit (Hoffenheim) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Pavel Kaderabek walks off.
Markus Weinzierl has decided to substitute Pablo Maffeo and he is replaced by Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart).
What a long-range shot by Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim). Unfortunately for him, his shot goes just a few inches over the bar.
That's the end of the game for Erik Thommy, who is replaced by Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart).
POST! Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) unleashes a thunderous effort from the edge of the box and the ball crashes against the right post. What a strike that was!
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

What a chance! Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players makes a crucial goal-line clearance. The ball goes out of play and Dortmund have been awarded a corner kick.
Today's referee Sascha Stegemann rightly decides to book Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund) for his harsh tackle.
Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting set piece and aims a header towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes a superb save.
Good team movement sets up Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
The foul by Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Sascha Stegemann.

Mario Gotze produces a sweet pass and picks out Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:0!

It's a goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) scores with a brilliant low shot into the middle of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Maximilian Mittelstadt. The score is now 1:1.
Sascha Stegemann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Per Skjelbred is replaced by Vladimir Darida (Hertha Berlin).
Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Sascha Stegemann ignores the protests.
Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Substitution. Vedad Ibisevic makes way for Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin).
Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
Goal! A rebound wrong foots everyone except Jadon Sancho (Dortmund), and he slams the ball into the open net from close range. 2:1.
Pal Dardai has decided to substitute Ondrej Duda and he is replaced by Javairo Dilrosun (Hertha Berlin).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Jadon Sancho will be replaced by Christian Pulisic (Dortmund).
Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Raphael Guerreiro walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jacob Bruun Larsen (Dortmund).
What a huge chance for Jacob Bruun Larsen (Dortmund). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the middle of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) commits an ugly challenge. The referee sees it and immediately blows his whistle. Hertha Berlin are given a penalty!
Booking. Dan-Axel Zagadou (Dortmund) receives a caution from the referee.
Goal! Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Roman Burki to commit before slotting the penalty into the right of the goal.
Substitution. Lukasz Piszczek leaves the pitch and is replaced by Omer Toprak (Dortmund).
Sascha Stegemann is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
The game has begun to heat up. William (Wolfsburg) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
The game is interrupted. Alfredo Morales (Dusseldorf) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Schlager had an easy-decision to make.

Good touch by Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) as he latched on to an accurate pass before attempting to threaten the goalkeeper with his long-range shot. Unluckily for him, his attempt only rattles the left post. The ball goes out of play and Dusseldorf will have a goal kick.
Handball! A player from Dusseldorf handled the ball. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to Wolfsburg.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) receives a yellow card!
Goal! Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Michael Rensing to commit before slotting the penalty into the bottom right corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Daniel Schlager starts the second half.
Niko Giesselmann (Dusseldorf) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Yellow card. Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
John Brooks (Wolfsburg) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Daniel Schlager shows a yellow card to Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. Marvin Ducksch (Dusseldorf) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Adam Bodzek walks off.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) was quite harsh and Daniel Schlager didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball low inside the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Aymen Barkok (Dusseldorf) comes onto the pitch for Alfredo Morales.
Friedhelm Funkel decides to make a substitution. Dodi Lukebakio will be replaced by Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf).
Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg) replaces Maximilian Arnold.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) replacing Renato Steffen.

Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) has a great chance on the edge of the six-yard box following a lofted pass, but his header lacks accuracy and flies just past the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Dusseldorf.
Substitution. Jerome Roussillon did his best and is replaced by Gian-Luca Itter (Wolfsburg).
Daniel Schlager is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.

Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) latches onto a rebound in the box and fires a shot a whisker wide of the left post. That was a promising chance and maybe he should have done better! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.
Goal! Rani Khedira (Augsburg) fires the rebound into the top right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.

Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) is strong enough to get to the ball and produces a header from close range. Even though it was aimed precisely towards the bottom right corner, Andreas Luthe didn't have a hard time stopping the attempt as it wasn't powerful enough. Hannover have been awarded a corner kick.
Marco Richter (Augsburg) is punished with a yellow card for violating the rules.

Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) launches himself at the ball from the free kick and produces a header which lacks accuracy, sending it just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hannover.

Genki Haraguchi (Hannover) took a first-time shot from mid-range after he was put in the clear by a great pass, but the effort lacked a little accuracy and went just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Augsburg will have a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Andre Breitenreiter gives a chance to Florent Muslija (Hannover) and Pirmin Schwegler is off.
Manuel Baum makes a switch. Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) is coming on in place of Marco Richter at the start of the second period.

Andre Hahn (Augsburg) times his run into the box beautifully and plants a good looking header at goal from the corner, but the ball flashes just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Hannover will have a goal kick.

Genki Haraguchi (Hannover) handles the ball and everyone in the stadium shouts 'handball'. Augsburg are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
The expression of the referee Robert Kampka is crystal clear. This behaviour won't be tolerated. Genki Haraguchi (Hannover) is shown a yellow card.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) fires the penalty into the right side of the net!
Here comes a substitution. Josip Elez is given a rest as he is replaced by Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover).
Manuel Baum decides to make a substitution. Ja-Cheol Koo will be replaced by Fredrik Jensen (Augsburg).

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the right side of the net.
Florent Muslija (Hannover) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Robert Kampka pulls out a yellow card.
That's the end of the game for Alfred Finnbogason, who is replaced by Kevin Danso (Augsburg).
The yellow card is received by Daniel Baier (Augsburg).
Booking. Kevin Danso (Augsburg) receives a caution from the referee.
That's it for today, Robert Kampka has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich) picks up a pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that crashes against the bar. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Goal! Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) beats the goalkeeper.
Celebrations by Bayern Munich are cut short as the referee signals that the legality of the goal will be checked using the VAR. Hopefully this wonâ€™t take too long.
It seems that the video assistant referee has spotted an infringement in the build-up play and the goal from Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) is subsequently disallowed by the referee!
Goal! Joshua Kimmich provides Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Aaron Caricol (Mainz) for a tough tackle.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
It's in the back of the net! Daniel Brosinski plays it into the box, and Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the bottom right corner. 1:1.
Niko Kovac is forced to make a change. Leon Goretzka is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch so that Serge Gnabry can be given a rest.
Levin Oztunali (Mainz) gets a yellow card.
It's 1:2! Robert Lewandowski feeds Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom left corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Robin Quaison (Mainz) is coming onto the pitch as Pierre Kunde Malong cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to make a change. Anthony Ujah (Mainz) replaces Jean-Philippe Mateta.

Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) received a fine pass and tried his luck from long range. His attempt went towards the bottom right corner, but Florian Muller pulled off a great save to push the ball onto the post.

He should have scored! Niklas Sule (Bayern Munich) latches onto a pull back in the box right in front of goal, but his shot towards the middle of the goal is pretty weak and Florian Muller makes an easy save.
Sandro Schwarz prepares a substitution. Danny Latza is replaced by Alexandru Maxim (Mainz).
A substitution has been made. Thomas Muller goes off and Rafinha (Bayern Munich) comes on.
Yellow card! It's like Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Harm Osmers agrees and books him.
The foul by Anthony Ujah (Mainz) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Harm Osmers.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
The referee blows his whistle as Yann Sommer (B. Monchengladbach) was too aggressive in his challenge. PENALTY to Freiburg! Let's see who will take responsibility.
Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Yann Sommer into left side of the goal.
The resulting corner falls to Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach), who smashes the ball against the right post.

What a great effort! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) decides to unleash a long-range shot. Despite hitting it very well, it scorches inches wide of the left post. We could have witnessed a magnificent goal.

Dominique Heintz (Freiburg) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Robert Hartmann no option but to blow his whistle. It's a penalty! B. Monchengladbach have an opportunity to score from the penalty spot.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Alexander Schwolow to move before rolling the ball into the middle of the goal!
Robert Hartmann shows a yellow card to Mike Frantz (Freiburg) for a tough tackle.
Some great play by Lukas Kubler (Freiburg) ends with a shot on the edge of the box towards the right side of the goal, but Yann Sommer sees it all the way and makes a comfortable save.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
A substitution has been made. Alassane Plea is replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).

Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) receives a quality pass and releases a rocket of a shot from distance, but his amazing effort goes just wide of the left post! The goalkeeper probably wouldn't have saved this one.

Goal! Janik Haberer finds Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) with a clever pass. He steps inside his man on the edge of the box and whips a tremendous shot into the left side of the goal. Fantasy football! 2:1.
That will be all from Tobias Strobl who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach).
Christian Streich decides to make a substitution. Mike Frantz will be replaced by Roland Sallai (Freiburg).
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Hartmann ignores the protests.
It will be a substitution. Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) is ready to enter the pitch as Michael Lang walks off.
Christian Streich has decided to substitute Janik Haberer and he is replaced by Lucas Holer (Freiburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Philipp Lienhart (Freiburg) replaces Gian-Luca Waldschmidt.
Lucas Holer (Freiburg) scores a cracking goal from long range. The goalkeeper was helpless and could do nothing with that shot.
That's it for today, Robert Hartmann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.

Thorgan Hazard is in a good shooting position, but he sees his teammate and passes the ball to him. Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) takes it nicely and beats the goalkeeper with a precise shot which bounces in off the bottom of the left post to make the score 1:0.
Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Goal! Thorgan Hazard passes the ball to the feet of Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 2:0.

It's a goal! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) scores with a brilliant shot into the roof of the net after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from Alassane Plea. The score is now 3:0.
Pierre Kunde Malong will be replaced by Danny Latza (Mainz).
Sandro Schwarz has decided to substitute Jonathan Burkardt and he is replaced by Levin Oztunali (Mainz).
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom right corner. Good team effort!
Aaron Caricol (Mainz) is penalised.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) is coming onto the pitch as Lars Stindl cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Florian Neuhaus.
Sandro Schwarz is forced to make a change. Bote Baku is unable to continue due to injury, Philipp Mwene (Mainz) comes on.
Substitution. Michael Lang leaves the pitch and is replaced by Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach).

What a wonderful moment! Philipp Mwene (Mainz) receives a perfect pass in the middle of the pitch, lines up the ball and unloads a powerful strike towards the right post. His effort fails to surprise Yann Sommer, who makes a nice save. Mainz have a corner.

Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) accelerated away from the defence and took his shot early from the edge of the box. The ball flew towards the top of the net, but Florian Muller made a superb athletic save to deny him. It will be a corner kick for B. Monchengladbach.

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Danny Latza (Mainz) inside the box and he manages to steer it to the left side of the target. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Yann Sommer makes a save in the nick of time and maintains the current score. Mainz have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Goal! Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) latches on to an accurate pass and quickly strikes a low effort inside the right post.

Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes narrowly over the bar. Terrific solo effort, though. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Freiburg.
GOAL 1:1! Robin Koch (Freiburg) unleashes a shot from distance, which is deflected past Rune Jarstein. He had no chance of stopping it as the ball rapidly changed its direction.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Benjamin Cortus blows his whistle to start the second half.
Christian Streich has made a change at the break. Nils Petersen (Freiburg) has come on in place of Marco Terrazzino.
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) latched on to a lofted pass inside the box, but his header misses to the right of the target. The ball goes out of play and Freiburg will have a goal kick.
We are about to witness a substitution. Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) is replacing Javairo Dilrosun.

A neat pass is well received by Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin), who is lurking on the edge of the box and produces a low drive directed towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
Pal Dardai has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) replacing Vedad Ibisevic.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Roland Sallai walks off the pitch to be replaced by Chima Okoroji (Freiburg).
Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the right post. Rune Jarstein is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Salomon Kalou will be replaced by Palko Dardai (Hertha Berlin).
Palko Dardai (Hertha Berlin) breaks into the box and goes over after a challenge from an opposition player, but the ref signals NO penalty!
Referee Benjamin Cortus gets a signal in his ear and goes over to the VAR monitor to check whether itâ€™s a penalty!
After the VAR review the referee signals NO PENALTY, play can continue.
Substitution. Philipp Lienhart (Freiburg) has come on for Gian-Luca Waldschmidt.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Yellow card. Hamza Mendyl (Schalke) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the bottom left corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Christian Dingert has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Domenico Tedesco makes a half-time substitution. Mark Uth (Schalke) comes on in place of Hamza Mendyl.
Amine Harit (Schalke) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Jiri Pavlenka scrambling, but it flies just over the bar.
It's time for a substitution. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) comes on in place of Florian Kainz.
Here is a change. Yuya Osako is going off and Florian Kohfeldt gives the last tactical orders to Sebastian Langkamp (Werder Bremen).

Schalke earn a corner. Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his strike towards the bottom left corner as Jiri Pavlenka produces a good save.
Nuri Sahin (Werder Bremen) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Omar Mascarell will be replaced by Franco Di Santo (Schalke).

A wonderful pass found its target. Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) received it well and shot from about 13 metres out. He did really well to send the ball past the goalkeeper and into the bottom left corner.
Domenico Tedesco decides to make a substitution. Amine Harit will be replaced by Suat Serdar (Schalke).
Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Naldo (Schalke) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the left post is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper.
Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) has a chance after receiving a pass. He measures his shot from the edge of the box but it sails just wide of the left post.
Here comes a substitution. Nuri Sahin is given a rest as he is replaced by Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen).

Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen) blew a promising chance when he got to a rebound just outside the penalty area. He struck it towards the left side of the target, but Alexander Nubel pulled off a nice save to stop the attempt. Werder Bremen win a corner.
It's a yellow card for Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.

Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) pulls the jersey of one of the opposition players and Tobias Welz blows his whistle for a foul. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for RB Leipzig.
Wait a minute! The referee has decided to review the penalty decision using the VAR system.
The penalty decision is reversed after referee Tobias Welz changes his mind following the VAR review into the infringement.
The game is interrupted. Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Tobias Welz has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Ibrahima Konate (RB Leipzig) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Substitution. Alfred Finnbogason makes way for Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg).
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
We are about to witness a substitution. Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig) is replacing Timo Werner.
Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) for his blatant foul.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Nordi Mukiele walks off the pitch to be replaced by Lukas Klostermann (RB Leipzig).
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Here is a change. Kevin Kampl is going off and Ralf Rangnick gives the last tactical orders to Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig).

Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) collects the ball from the free kick and immediately sends his close-range effort narrowly wide of the right post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Augsburg.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Michael Gregoritsch trots off the pitch and is replaced by Kevin Danso (Augsburg).
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) picks up a yellow card.
That's it for today, Tobias Welz has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Referee Patrick Ittrich makes the VAR signal and is going to check whether itâ€™s a penalty for Bayer Leverkusen. Letâ€™s see what happens!
Itâ€™s a PENALTY to Bayer Leverkusen after the VAR review!
Martins Felipe (Hannover) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) sends the penalty to the bottom right corner, but Michael Esser pulls off a wonderful save to deny him.
Florent Muslija (Hannover) fires the free kick home. He curls the ball over the wall and it bounces in off the inside of the right post. A technically stunning goal.

Florent Muslija (Hannover) picks up the rebound inside the penalty area and releases a good shot to the right side of the goal. Unfortunately for him, Lukas Hradecky shows how quick his reflexes are and dives superbly to stop his effort. What a save but what a wasted opportunity!
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Bobby Wood (Hannover) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Goal! Julian Brandt plays a simple square pass into the feet of Lars Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) in the box, who composes himself and lashes the ball into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
The end of the first half.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen) has tested the patience of referee Patrick Ittrich and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Goal! Martins Felipe (Hannover) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the middle of the net. It's 1:2.
It's the second caution for Martins Felipe (Hannover) and that's the last we'll see of him in this game. There was no other option for Patrick Ittrich.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
It is time for a substitution. Kevin Wimmer (Hannover) is on for Bobby Wood.
Here is a change. Dominik Kohr is going off and Heiko Herrlich gives the last tactical orders to Isaac Kiese Thelin (Bayer Leverkusen).
The game has come to an end for Florent Muslija. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Matthias Ostrzolek (Hannover).
Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) is awarded a yellow card for a sharp discussion with the referee. He should relax or he could be sent off.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Kevin Volland.
The manager makes a subsitution with Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) coming on for Mitchell Weiser.
Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) has a great chance inside the box following a rebound off a defender, but somehow he gets too much on the ball and it goes well wide of the left post.
Michael Esser (Hannover) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) comes onto the pitch so that Pirmin Schwegler can be given a rest.
Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Patrick Ittrich had an easy-decision to make.
Fantastic team goal! Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) was set free in the area by Lars Bender and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the left side of the net. 2:2.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.

Nuhu Kasim (Hoffenheim) was too forceful with his tackle and Felix Zwayer interrupted the game to signal a free kick. PENALTY to Nurnberg! Almost the entire opposition team is gathered around the referee and complaining. However, the decision has been made and it's final.
Referee Felix Zwayer is happy with his original decision after the VAR review. Itâ€™s a PENALTY to Nurnberg!
Goal! Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Oliver Baumann into the bottom right corner.

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Christian Mathenia makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the roof of the net. The ball goes out for a corner. Hoffenheim can continue in their attacking effort.

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom left corner is blocked by Christian Mathenia, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
The booking goes to Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim).
Enrico Valentini (Nurnberg) gets a yellow card.
Vura (Nurnberg) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
That will be all from Mikael Ishak who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Torless Knoll (Nurnberg).
Eduard Lowen (Nurnberg) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Julian Nagelsmann has made a change at the break. Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) has come on in place of Florian Grillitsch.
Goal - 1:1! Pavel Kaderabek laid the ball off to Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim), who unleashed a strong shot from close range into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Goal Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim)! Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) was put through by Kerem Demirbay and he showed brilliant composure inside the box to fire into the top of the net. 1:2.

Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Christian Mathenia. Corner kick. Hoffenheim will have an opportunity.
Booking. Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) receives a caution from the referee.
Substitution. Sebastian Kerk (Nurnberg) on for Federico Palacios-Martinez.
Goal! Pavel Kaderabek swings the ball deep into the box and finds Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) unmarked, and his close-range header flies past the keeper into the bottom right corner. 1:3.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Nuhu Kasim and he is replaced by Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim).

Lukas Muhl (Nurnberg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Felix Zwayer ignores the protests. Hoffenheim earn a free kick which could lead to a goal-scoring opportunity.
A substitution has been made. Reiss Nelson goes off and Justin Hoogma (Hoffenheim) comes on.
Substitution. Yuya Kubo (Nurnberg) in, Vura out.

Torless Knoll (Nurnberg) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Oliver Baumann anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the middle of the target. Nurnberg will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) gets a shot away from inside the box and the effort is deflected past the goalkeeper. 0:1.

Lukasz Piszczek passes to Marco Reus (Dortmund), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 0:2.
GOAL! Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Ron-Robert Zieler, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 0:3.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Markus Weinzierl makes a switch. Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart) is coming on in place of Gonzalo Castro at the start of the second period.
Half-time substitution. Alcacer Paco (Dortmund) is replaced by Maximilian Philipp.
Christian Gentner (VfB Stuttgart) strikes the rebound, but it goes well over the bar.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the bottom left corner. However, Roman Burki anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.
A substitution has been made. Jacob Bruun Larsen is replaced by Christian Pulisic (Dortmund).
Here is a change. Erik Thommy is going off and Markus Weinzierl gives the last tactical orders to Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart).
Markus Weinzierl decides to make a substitution. Pablo Maffeo will be replaced by Andreas Beck (VfB Stuttgart).
Today's match ends for Marco Reus who will be replaced by Mario Gotze (Dortmund).

Brilliant finish! Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Christian Pulisic, then produced a nice strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:4.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the top left corner. However, he couldn't beat Koen Casteels, who shows his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom left corner. Magnificent finish!

James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Koen Casteels is alert and denies him with a nice save. Now Bayern Munich have a corner.
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Guido Winkmann ignores the protests.
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Maximilian Arnold (Wolfsburg) for a tough tackle.
Yellow card! It's like Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Guido Winkmann agrees and books him.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Guido Winkmann has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Niko Kovac has made a change at the break. Rafinha (Bayern Munich) has come on in place of David Alaba.

GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 0:2.
RED CARD! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Guido Winkmann. He can have an early bath.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) comes onto the pitch for Renato Steffen.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) replaces Josip Brekalo.
Goal! Admir Mehmedi produces a great pass that finds Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot high into the net. 1:2.
Substitution. Serge Gnabry makes his way off the pitch and Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich) comes on as his replacement.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) is coming onto the pitch as Elvis Rexhbecaj cannot continue after picking up an injury.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich). Robert Lewandowski plays a fantastic through ball and finds James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom right corner. 1:3.

Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going inside the left post, but Koen Casteels has other ideas and makes a brilliant save. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Bayern Munich will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The foul by Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Guido Winkmann.
The referee signals a substitution. Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) is brought on as a substitute for James Rodriguez.
The referee shows the yellow card to Manuel Neuer (Bayern Munich).
The match has just finished.
The first half has started.
Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) fires a shot well wide of the right post from inside the box after latching onto a short pass.
That was close by Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle, a clear handball by Adam Bodzek (Dusseldorf). Eintracht Frankfurt are awarded a penalty!
Goal! Michael Rensing gets a hand on the penalty from Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt), but can't stop it from flying inside the right post.

Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) brilliantly evades multiple challenges and bends in a shot from the edge of the box towards the middle of the goal. It's a weak effort, however, and is easily saved by Michael Rensing.

Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) meets a perfect cross from Filip Kostic deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike into the roof of the net. It's 2:0.

It's in! Sebastien Haller spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) doesn't think twice and rifles a low first-time shot past Michael Rensing. The score is now 3:0.
A rebound lands at the feet of Lucas Torro (Eintracht Frankfurt), whose promising strike from long range crashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity that was!

Marvin Ducksch (Dusseldorf) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot low towards the middle of the goal was comfortably saved by Frederik Ronnow. Dusseldorf earn a corner.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets to a rebound inside the goalmouth, but his header hits the bar and spins away!
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Deniz Aytekin starts the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Friedhelm Funkel probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Marcel Sobottka. He is replaced by Aymen Barkok (Dusseldorf).
Half-time substitution. Adam Bodzek (Dusseldorf) is replaced by Dodi Lukebakio.
Adi Hutter makes a half-time substitution. Marc Stendera (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on in place of Lucas Torro.
Goal! Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) gets to the ball inside the box, sees the goalkeeper off his line and lifts the ball over him and into the back of the net. 4:0.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his low drive to the middle of the goal is smartly dealt with by Michael Rensing.

Goal! Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom left corner. Frederik Ronnow had no chance of reaching it. The score is 4:1.
Goal! Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes a short pass from Filip Kostic in his stride in the box, jinks inside his man and unleashes an unstoppable shot inside the right post. 5:1.
A substitution has been made. Kevin Trapp is replaced by Frederik Ronnow (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Jonathan de Guzman produces a killer pass to release Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who then unleashes a low drive from the edge of the box and scores! The ball goes in off the left post, leaving the goalkeeper stranded. 6:1!

Goal! Sebastien Haller clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who jumps highest and steers a bullet header from the centre of the box into the bottom right corner. Michael Rensing had no chance of stopping that. 7:1.
We are about to witness a substitution. Branimir Hrgota (Eintracht Frankfurt) is replacing Luka Jovic.
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf) for a heavy challenge.
Deniz Aytekin shows a yellow card to Kevin Stoger (Dusseldorf), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Goal! Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the right post. It's 1:0.
Goal! Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 2:0.
Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) collects a killer pass inside the box that puts him one-on-one against the goalkeeper. He scores, drilling a low drive deep inside the left post!
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Tobias Stieler blows his whistle to start the second half.
The game is over for Kevin Kampl. Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) comes on for the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Michael Kollner gives a chance to Federico Palacios-Martinez (Nurnberg) and Vura is off.
Enrico Valentini (Nurnberg) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) gets free in the box and latches onto a good cross, but somehow he sends the ball narrowly wide of the right post from the penalty spot with just the keeper to beat.

Marcel Halstenberg slides a pass towards Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) who unleashes a fabulous shot from long range. The ball goes behind the surprised goalkeeper and into the bottom right corner. The score is now 5:0.
Goal! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 6:0.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Yuya Kubo will be replaced by Torless Knoll (Nurnberg).
Tobias Stieler blows his whistle after Tim Leibold (Nurnberg) brings one of his opponents down with a strong tackle. The referee's verdict is crystal clear. A penalty is awarded to RB Leipzig!
Tim Leibold (Nurnberg) is red-carded. He has to leave the pitch.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot low into the middle of the target, but Fabian Bredlow pulls off a save.
Ralf Rangnick has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) replacing Yussuf Poulsen.
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) rises high to connect with a cross from the corner kick, but his powerful header from center of the box hits the left post!
Ralf Rangnick has decided to substitute Emil Forsberg and he is replaced by Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig).
A substitution has been made. Enrico Valentini is replaced by Robert Bauer (Nurnberg).
Tobias Stieler is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
What a chance that is! Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header crashes off the crossbar!
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Allan (Eintracht Frankfurt) earns the yellow card.

What a beautiful moment! Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way inside the right post. Oliver Baumann just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 0:1.
Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim) is yellow-carded.
Daniel Siebert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Adi Hutter has made a change at the break. Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has come on in place of Allan Allan.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is in the right place at the right time and hammers a rebound into the middle of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper beaten.
Substitution. Vincenzo Grifo (Hoffenheim) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Leonardo Bittencourt walks off.
Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) picks up a yellow card.
It is time for a substitution. Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) is on for Florian Grillitsch.
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) violates the laws of the game and is shown a second yellow card by the referee!
It's time for a substitution. Joelinton (Hoffenheim) comes on in place of Kevin Akpoguma.
Adi Hutter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Luka Jovic.
Makoto Hasebe (Eintracht Frankfurt) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Here's the change. Filip Kostic leaves the pitch and Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.

Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick low shot towards the middle of the goal. His effort lacks pace and that allows Kevin Trapp to make a comfortable save.
Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) converts a killer cross before stroking a beautiful finish into the top right corner.

Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) leaps highest in the penalty area to get on the end of a cross from the set piece, and he produces a promising goal-bound header towards the roof of the net, but Kevin Trapp pulls off a decent save to deny him. Hoffenheim force a corner. They send men into the box.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Florian Niederlechner is substituted due to injury. Christian Streich gives a chance to Janik Haberer (Freiburg).
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Bastian Dankert has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
Christian Streich has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) comes on the pitch for Manuel Gulde.
Lukas Kubler (Freiburg) has tested the patience of referee Bastian Dankert and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) for his blatant foul.
Julian Brandt will be replaced by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen).
Christian Gunter (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for a sharp discussion with the referee. He should relax or he could be sent off.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Dominik Kohr walks off the pitch to be replaced by Isaac Kiese Thelin (Bayer Leverkusen).
Heiko Herrlich decides to make a substitution. Kevin Volland will be replaced by Paulinho (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Lucas Holer (Freiburg) comes onto the pitch so that Mike Frantz can be given a rest.
POST! Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) unleashes a thunderous effort from the edge of the box and the ball crashes against the right post. What a strike that was!
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Goal! Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) is teed up on the edge of the box by Jonas Hofmann, and his howitzer of a shot into the bottom right corner gives the keeper no chance. 0:1.
Goal! Some very poor defending from the opponent allows Lars Stindl (B. Monchengladbach) the chance to get to the edge of the box and he makes no mistake with a lovely finish. It's 0:2.

Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of a cross inside the box and sweeps the ball goalwards towards the bottom right corner, but Yann Sommer is well positioned and easily deals with the effort. Bayern Munich will take a corner kick.
A fine pass finds Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) in space inside the box, he looks up and drills a low shot towards the middle of the goal, but the Yann Sommer reacts superbly to deny him.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Half-time substitution. Arjen Robben is replaced by Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Niko Kovac probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Thomas Muller. He is replaced by Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) is coming onto the pitch as David Alaba cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) picks up a yellow card.
We are about to witness a substitution. Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) is replacing Lars Stindl.
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has a goal ruled out for offside!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) comes onto the pitch so that Florian Neuhaus can be given a rest.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Thorgan Hazard departs the field of play to be replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).

Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) meets a perfect cross from Christoph Kramer deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike inside the right post. The score is 0:3.
Amid all the celebrations by B. Monchengladbach, the referee has gone over to the monitor to check the validity of the goal using VAR.
Referee Frank Willenborg signals that the goal stands after the VAR review and the B. Monchengladbach have a reason to celebrate!
The referee gives a yellow card to Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach).
James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) is given a yellow card.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
What a big chance! Marco Reus (Dortmund) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Goal! The rebound fell to Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) and he fired home from close range. The score is 0:1.

Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Andreas Luthe makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the left side of the goal. Good work from Dortmund as they win a corner.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Markus Schmidt had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) collects a rebound and his promising attempt heads towards the left side of the goal, but Roman Burki keeps it out with an amazing save.
The referee shows a yellow card to Marco Reus (Dortmund). No wonder. A clear yellow for bad language.
Rani Khedira (Augsburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Markus Schmidt didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Maximilian Philipp did his best and is replaced by Paco Alcacer (Dortmund).
It's 1:1! Jadon Sancho feeds Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the left side of the net.
Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) controls a cross deep inside the box and hits the crossbar!
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) has tested the patience of referee Markus Schmidt and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Felix Gotze (Augsburg) will replace Daniel Baier.
Manuel Akanji (Dortmund) meets a cross and produces a header towards the right side of the goal, but one of the defending players blocks the effort.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Jacob Bruun Larsen will be replaced by Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund).

Goal! Andre Hahn plays in Philipp Max (Augsburg), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box he shoots into the top of the net! Great finish - 1:2.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Jan Moravek (Augsburg) for Andre Hahn.
Lucien Favre has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mario Gotze (Dortmund) replacing Julian Weigl.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) for his blatant foul.

Raphael Guerreiro sends over a nice cross from the set piece on the edge of the box. Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) latches on to it and pulls the trigger. His powerful effort glances of the right post and goes behind the goalkeeper.
Alfred Finnbogason comes off the pitch to be replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Mario Gotze (Dortmund) is released by Achraf Hakimi, he surges into the box and smashes a great shot into the top corner after a one-on-one with the goalkeeper.
Philipp Max takes the corner and Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) rises highest near the penalty spot to plant a brilliant header into the middle of the net. The score is 3:3.

Raphael Guerreiro (Dortmund) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the right post. Andreas Luthe has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) was quite harsh and Markus Schmidt didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) scores a great goal from the resulting free kick from mid-range. He sends the ball directly inside the right post.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.

Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Benito Raman (Dusseldorf). This could have been a legendary goal.
Sven Jablonski shows the yellow card to Hamza Mendyl (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
Jean Zimmer (Dusseldorf) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Good chance for Franco Di Santo (Schalke) as he latched on to a cross on the edge of the box and blasted the ball towards the net! It flew wide of the left post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Sven Jablonski blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Fantastic team goal! Weston McKennie (Schalke) was set free in the area by Suat Serdar and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the left side of the net. 0:1.
Marcel Sobottka (Dusseldorf) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) is the first to get to a rebound inside the penalty area and his weak, but precise effort finds its way into the back of the net, bouncing in off the crossbar.
Today's referee Sven Jablonski rightly decides to book Adam Bodzek (Dusseldorf) for his harsh tackle.
Here comes a substitution. Mark Uth (Schalke) is brought on as a substitute for Suat Serdar.
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marvin Ducksch (Dusseldorf) replacing Adam Bodzek.
Substitution. Niko Giesselmann makes way for Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf).

Alfredo Morales (Dusseldorf) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the roof of the net. Ralf Fahrmann has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. Dusseldorf have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Domenico Tedesco is forced to make a change. Weston McKennie is unable to continue due to injury, Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) comes on.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Marcin Kaminski (Dusseldorf) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The ball is crossed into the box and Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) reacts quickest to send a shot flying towards the right side of the goal, but Michael Rensing gets a glove on it to thwart him.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to make a change. Breel Embolo (Schalke) replaces Franco Di Santo.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Genki Haraguchi (Hannover) is coming onto the pitch as Takuma Asano cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The foul by Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Sascha Stegemann.
That was close by Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
It's a goal! Bobby Wood (Hannover) bravely launches himself at a cross from Miiko Albornoz and gives Ron-Robert Zieler no chance with a close-range bullet header into the right of the goal. 1:0.
Goal! Miiko Albornoz hands Bobby Wood (Hannover) the simplest of tasks from close range after the cross evaded the keeper, and he makes no mistake with his header into the left side of the goal. 2:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Sascha Stegemann has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Tayfun Korkut has made a change at the break. Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) has come on in place of Holger Badstuber.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to make a change. Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Gonzalo Castro.

A superb goal from great team play! Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the right post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.

Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart) receives a clever pass and shoots from mid-range. His shot looks like it's going in the bottom right corner, but Michael Esser has other ideas and makes a brilliant save. The ball is out of play. Stuttgart win a corner kick.
What a big chance! Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball well wide of the left post.

Bobby Wood (Hannover) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the right side of the goal. Ron-Robert Zieler shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net. The referee points to the corner flag and Hannover will take a corner.
The substitution has been made. Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) has replaced Bobby Wood.
Sascha Stegemann shows the yellow card to Borna Sosa (VfB Stuttgart) for a heavy challenge.
It's time for a substitution. Hans Nunoo Sarpei (VfB Stuttgart) comes on in place of Christian Gentner.
Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Sascha Stegemann didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to substitute Pirmin Schwegler and he is replaced by Iver Fossum (Hannover).
Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the bottom right corner of the net.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) shakes off the attention of a defender and from mid-range lets fly towards the left side of the goal, but Rune Jarstein is well positioned to make a comfortable save.
Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) latches on to a superb cross into the box and hits the right post with his header. A stroke of luck for the goalkeeper!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
That's the end of the game for Niklas Stark, who is replaced by Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin).
A substitution has been made. Vedad Ibisevic goes off and Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
The corner is flicked onto Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin), but his close-range header flies a whisker wide of the right post.
Anthony Ujah (Mainz) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jonathan Burkardt.
Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) crashes a header just wide of the left post from close range after a searching cross. He should have scored!
It will be a substitution. Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) is ready to enter the pitch as Javairo Dilrosun walks off.
The manager makes a subsitution with Issah Abass (Mainz) coming on for Jean-Philippe Mateta.
Sandro Schwarz has decided to make a change. Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) replaces Jean-Philippe Gbamin.
Daniel Schlager shows a yellow card to Arne Maier (Hertha Berlin), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes narrowly wide of the right post! What a huge opportunity!
That's it for today, Daniel Schlager has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) latches onto a good pass inside the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper, but deflects off the left post to safety.
Goal! Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:0.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) is given a yellow card.
William (Wolfsburg) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Martin Petersen ignores the protests.
Martin Petersen has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
What a big chance! John Brooks (Wolfsburg) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Yunus Malli leaves the pitch and Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) comes on.
A yellow card for a tackle by Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg). Martin Petersen doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The ball is laid off to Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) on the edge of the box. He shoots through a crowd of players towards the bottom right corner and forces Jiri Pavlenka to make a decent save.
Here is a change. Florian Kainz is going off and Florian Kohfeldt gives the last tactical orders to Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen).
A pass lands at the feet of Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) in the middle of the box, he looks up and shoots but the effort is superbly blocked by a defender.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Jakub Blaszczykowski (Wolfsburg) is coming onto the pitch as Renato Steffen cannot continue after picking up an injury.

Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. Werder Bremen earn a corner.
Florian Kohfeldt decides to make a substitution. Yuya Osako will be replaced by Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marcel Tisserand departs the field of play to be replaced by Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg).

Goal! Claudio Pizarro displays great vision and sends a pass to Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 2:0.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Davy Klaassen as he is replaced by Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen).
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

That was a nice football moment. Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the roof of the net. Alexander Schwolow guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! Good work from Augsburg as they win a corner.

Marco Richter (Augsburg) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out. The ball is out of play. Augsburg win a corner kick.
Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) scores from quite a difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header inside the left post. Excellent finish.
Goal! Jeffrey Gouweleeuw shows great vision to find Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) receives a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Christian Streich makes a switch. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) is coming on in place of Marco Terrazzino at the start of the second period.
Christian Streich has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Jerome Gondorf comes on the pitch for Philipp Lienhart (Freiburg).

Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Alexander Schwolow makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the top right corner. The ball goes out of play. Augsburg are awarded a corner kick.
Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) scores an unfortunate own goal after deflecting the ball into his own net!
Fine attempt! Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) collects a pass and manages to hold off the defender, then rifles in a shot from mid-range which unluckily swerves inches past the left post.
Dominique Heintz (Freiburg) brings an opponent down and Robert Kampka interrupts the game. Augsburg are awarded a penalty. What an opportunity to score!
Goal! Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg) puts the ball into the bottom left corner past the outstretched arm of Alexander Schwolow.
That's the end of the game for Michael Gregoritsch, who is replaced by Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg).
Jonathan Schmid (Augsburg) strikes a shot towards goal from the edge of the penalty box, but it flies just wide of the left post.
Here is a change. Marco Richter is going off and Manuel Baum gives the last tactical orders to Andre Hahn (Augsburg).
Substitution. Florian Niederlechner is replaced by Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg).

Tim Kleindienst (Freiburg) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball low towards the middle of the goal. However, he couldn't beat Andreas Luthe, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
Manuel Gulde (Freiburg) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. Freiburg get a corner.
It's a goal! Andre Hahn plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Alfred Finnbogason (Augsburg). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 4:1.
Substitution. Felix Gotze (Augsburg) on for Daniel Baier.
Robert Kampka is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Amazing piece of skill! Obite Evan N'Dicka (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up a cross on the edge of the 18-yard box and hammers the ball into the bottom right corner. What a finish that is!
Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom right corner in trademark fashion.
Robert Hartmann has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Andre Breitenreiter makes a switch. Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) is coming on in place of Niclas Fullkrug at the start of the second period.
Half-time substitution. Walace will not participate anymore and Bobby Wood (Hannover) is coming on.
Goal! Ante Rebic puts the ball across the area and Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) has the easiest task in the world to tuck the ball into an empty net. 3:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sebastien Haller trots off the pitch and is replaced by Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Oliver Sorg (Hannover) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Lucas Torro (Eintracht Frankfurt) is given a yellow card.
It is time for a substitution. Florent Muslija (Hannover) is on for Julian Korb.
