Adi Hutter decides to make a substitution. Filip Kostic will be replaced by Jetro Willems (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Substitution. Ante Rebic leaves the pitch and is replaced by Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt).

Danny da Costa (Eintracht Frankfurt) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Michael Esser, who pulls off a comfortable save!
Danny da Costa (Eintracht Frankfurt) blows a huge opportunity from inside the 6-yard box. He pounced on a rebound but headed it just over the crossbar.
Amazing piece of skill! Florent Muslija (Hannover) picks up a cross on the edge of the 18-yard box and slams the ball into the middle of the net.
Waldemar Anton (Hannover) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and drills the ball into the bottom right corner. Magnificent finish!
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.
Thomas Delaney (Dortmund) is shown a yellow card for a late challenge.
Goal! Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen) shows perfect technique and produces a first-time effort from just outside the box that goes into the bottom left corner. It's 1:0.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending the ball towards the bottom right corner only for Lukas Hradecky to dive and make a save.
Goal! Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) pounced on a loose ball inside the penalty area and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:0.
Felix Brych has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Lucien Favre has made a change at the break. Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) has come on in place of Thomas Delaney.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) is afforded space inside the box after collecting a pass, but the chance is wasted as his shot goes harmlessly over the crossbar.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) is unlucky with a goal-bound effort from the edge of the box. A brilliant save by Roman Burki stops the ball from going inside the top right corner. Bayer Leverkusen have been awarded a corner kick.
Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a precise pass and goes for goal, but his effort crashes against the left post!
Here is a change. Maximilian Philipp is going off and Lucien Favre gives the last tactical orders to Paco Alcacer (Dortmund).
Marco Reus (Dortmund) receives a quality pass inside the box and fires a first-time shot. His effort towards the middle of the goal is saved by the goalkeeper.
Goal 2:1! Jacob Bruun Larsen (Dortmund) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
Here's the change. Christian Pulisic leaves the pitch and Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) comes on as a substitute.
Marco Reus (Dortmund) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect strike that goes into the top right corner.
Heiko Herrlich prepares a substitution. Mitchell Weiser is replaced by Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Lucas Alario will be replaced by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen).
Here comes a substitution. Julian Brandt is given a rest as he is replaced by Paulinho (Bayer Leverkusen).
What a wonderful finish! Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and smashes the ball inside the left post. There are not enough superlatives to describe that goal.
Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
A long cross into the middle of the area is pounced on by Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen), but his header curls narrowly wide of the right post.
Paco Alcacer (Dortmund) scores as he latches on to a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a perfect strike that goes behind the goalkeeper.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
The referee shows the yellow card to Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim).

Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) beats the defender inside the box and lashes a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Peter Gulacsi makes a brilliant reflex save to deny him. Goalkeeping at its best!
Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) leaps high to meet a lofted pass around the penalty spot, but his header crashes against the crossbar!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) was quite harsh and Deniz Aytekin didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Booking. Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) receives a caution from the referee.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) misses a great chance to score after his effort hits the left post!
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Goal! Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) gets a shot away from inside the box and the effort is deflected past the goalkeeper. 0:1.
Here is a change. Leonardo Bittencourt is going off and Julian Nagelsmann gives the last tactical orders to Kerem Demirbay (Hoffenheim).
A yellow card is awarded to Ibrahima Konate (RB Leipzig).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Florian Grillitsch will be replaced by Vincenzo Grifo (Hoffenheim).
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) fails to score from inside the box as his rebound smashes against the right post!
Ralf Rangnick has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) replacing Timo Werner.
Nordi Mukiele (RB Leipzig) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Konrad Laimer.
Substitution. Adam Szalai leaves the pitch and is replaced by Joelinton (Hoffenheim).
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) was in the right place to put the ball into the back of the net with his body. It's 0:2.
That's the end of the game for Yussuf Poulsen, who is replaced by Matheus Cunha (RB Leipzig).
Poor challenge! Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) is penalised for tripping and Deniz Aytekin blows his whistle. No point in arguing there. Hoffenheim will take a penalty kick.
Goal! Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Peter Gulacsi to commit before slotting the penalty into the bottom left corner.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Hanno Behrens (Nurnberg) sends Michael Rensing the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
Alfredo Morales (Dusseldorf) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his low drive to the right post is smartly dealt with by Fabian Bredlow.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Harm Osmers blows his whistle to start the second half.
Michael Kollner makes a switch. Federico Palacios-Martinez (Nurnberg) is coming on in place of Matheus Pereira at the start of the second period.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Marvin Ducksch (Dusseldorf) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Here is a change. Takashi Usami is going off and Friedhelm Funkel gives the last tactical orders to Davor Lovren (Dusseldorf).
Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Michael Rensing with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 2:0.
Jean Zimmer (Dusseldorf) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Dodi Lukebakio goes off the pitch and Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) comes on.
Goal! Eduard Lowen gets to the ball, slips Federico Palacios-Martinez (Nurnberg) into the area and he scores with a delightful chipped finish to make it 3:0.
Vura (Nurnberg) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his strike towards the bottom right corner as Michael Rensing produces a good save.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Mikael Ishak will be replaced by Torless Knoll (Nurnberg).
Michael Kollner has decided to make a change. Patrick Erras (Nurnberg) replaces Ondrej Petrak.
That's it for today, Harm Osmers has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Evgen Konoplyanka sends a superb cross into the box. Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Florian Muller beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.

Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) produced a promising shot low towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Florian Muller thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Benjamin Cortus starts the second half.
Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) has tested the patience of referee Benjamin Cortus and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box. His rocket of a shot crashes against the crossbar! What a shot. The ball goes out of play and Mainz will have a goal kick.
It is time for a substitution. Anthony Ujah (Mainz) is on for Levin Oztunali.
Domenico Tedesco has decided to substitute Alessandro Schopf and he is replaced by Weston McKennie (Schalke).

Amine Harit (Schalke) races through the centre to the edge of the box then lets fly with a rocket of a shot that flies a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Mainz.
Substitution. Mark Uth (Schalke) on for Amine Harit.
Crossbar! Evgen Konoplyanka (Schalke) throws the chance away as he attempts to produce a shot from inside the box, but his attempt only rattles the crossbar! The goalkeeper can remain calm.
The game has come to an end for Pierre Kunde Malong. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Alexandru Maxim (Mainz).
Substitution. Bote Baku leaves the pitch and is replaced by Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz).
Here is a change. Suat Serdar is going off and Domenico Tedesco gives the last tactical orders to Omar Mascarell (Schalke).
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Benjamin Cortus had an easy-decision to make.
Benjamin Cortus shows a yellow card to Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz) for his blatant foul.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) looks up on the edge of the box and rifles in a screamer of a shot that flies just over the bar.
Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the top of the net. Ron-Robert Zieler is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save.
Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom left corner. Ron-Robert Zieler has a clear sight of it makes a comfortable save.
Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) is released by Daniel Didavi, he surges into the box and smashes a great shot into the top corner after a one-on-one with the goalkeeper.
Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) argues strongly with the referee and is awarded a yellow card. A needless yellow card!
The game has begun to heat up. Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
RED CARD! Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Tobias Welz. He can have an early bath.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Tobias Welz shows a yellow card to Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) for his blatant foul.
Dennis Aogo is being substituted because of an injury. Tayfun Korkut sends Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart) on the pitch.
Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) received a precise low pass and attempted to surprise the keeper with a snap shot, but his beautiful shot smashed against the right post!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) is coming onto the pitch as Anastasios Donis cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
The substitution is prepared. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Philipp Bargfrede.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a change. Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) replaces Ludwig Augustinsson.
Ron-Robert Zieler (VfB Stuttgart) scores an own goal! No one would like to be in his position right now.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) fires a brilliant shot from the edge of the box, but the effort rattles the right post! It could have been a superb goal.
Here comes a substitution. Christian Gentner is given a rest as he is replaced by Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart).
Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart) receives a delightful pass inside the box and smashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. What a clinical finish!
What was Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to substitute Yuya Osako and he is replaced by Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen).
Great touch by Gonzalo Castro (VfB Stuttgart) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
Tobias Welz is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
A yellow card for a tackle by Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach). Felix Zwayer doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) scores as he latches on to a pass and unleashes a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes into the top right corner of the goal and past the goalkeeper.

Goal! Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Yann Sommer is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 1:1.
Today's referee Felix Zwayer rightly decides to book Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) for his harsh tackle.
The foul by John Brooks (Wolfsburg) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Felix Zwayer.
Felix Zwayer has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) receives a precise pass inside the box from Patrick Herrmann and he beats the goalkeeper with a brilliant shot into the top right corner. 1:2.
Felix Zwayer shows the yellow card to Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) for a heavy challenge.
Goal! Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:2.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Maximilian Arnold departs the field of play to be replaced by Elvis Rexhbecaj (Wolfsburg).
Substitution. Florian Neuhaus did his best and is replaced by Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach).
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Tony Jantschke (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Michael Lang.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) for Wout Weghorst.
Dieter Hecking prepares a substitution. Alassane Plea is replaced by Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach).
Bruno Labbadia is forced to make a change. Renato Steffen is unable to continue due to injury, Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) comes on.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) rises high to meet a cross from the corner kick and plants a header from inside the penalty area. His effort went just narrowly wide of the left post.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the right post. His effort, however, is blocked by Manuel Neuer, who pulls off a stunning save!

Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Marco Fritz blows his whistle for an infringement. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Hertha Berlin!
Goal! Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) puts the ball into the left side of the goal past the outstretched arm of Manuel Neuer.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) makes some space to meet a perfect cross inside the box, but he blazes his shot over the bar. High, wide and not at all pretty.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin).
Goal! A great through ball by Valentino Lazaro sets up Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) inside the box, and he makes no mistake and bangs the ball into the top right corner. 2:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half has just started.
A yellow card for a tackle by Joshua Kimmich (Bayern Munich). Marco Fritz doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) leaps to meet an excellent cross on the edge of the penalty box and sends in a fantastic header towards the bottom left corner of the goal. The opponentâ€™s defence, however, masters the situation well and keeps the ball out.
Here is a change. Arjen Robben is going off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical orders to Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Vedad Ibisevic is replaced by Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin).
Renato Sanches goes off the pitch and Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) comes on.
Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) wins himself enough space to meet the resulting corner and fires the ball at goal, but the keeper does well to stop his effort. Bayern Munich get a corner.
Substitution. Mathew Leckie (Hertha Berlin) on for Salomon Kalou.
Niko Kovac has decided to make a change. Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) replaces James Rodriguez.
Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the bottom left corner is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper.
The booking goes to Javairo Dilrosun (Hertha Berlin).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Dennis Jastrzembski (Hertha Berlin) replaces Javairo Dilrosun.
Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) lunges into his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) inside the box and he manages to steer it to the middle of the target. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Kevin Trapp makes a save in the nick of time and maintains the current score.
Eintracht Frankfurt have a goal ruled out for offside!

What a great chance for Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header towards the foot of the left post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Goal! Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the top right corner. He makes it 1:0.
David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt) spurned a good chance! He gets a shot away from inside the penalty box, but it goes just over the bar.
Substitution. Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) in, Nicolai Muller out.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect low strike that goes inside the right post. What a clinical goal!
Adi Hutter has decided to make a change. Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt) replaces Gelson Fernandes.
Substitution. Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) has come on for Mijat Gacinovic.
Here comes a substitution. Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) is brought on as a substitute for Alassane Plea.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 2:1.
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Patrick Herrmann.
Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt) misses a sitter as his shot goes over the bar.

Nico Elvedi (B. Monchengladbach) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the right side of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 3:1.
Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt) hammers the ball from far out, but it goes narrowly over the bar.
Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and immediately unleashes a shot towards goal, but it goes high over the crossbar.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Substitution. Ibrahima Traore (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Thorgan Hazard.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Yuya Kubo (Nurnberg) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
GOAL - 1:0! Christian Pulisic found Jacob-Bruun Larsen (Dortmund) inside the box, he spotted goalkeeper Fabian Bredlow off his line and chipped the ball into the net. What a cheeky lob!
Jacob Bruun Larsen (Dortmund) receives a diagonal pass, bursts into the box and shoots towards the bottom left corner. Fabian Bredlow is well positioned, though, and it's a comfortable save.
Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) gets into a great position in the box after a pass, but sends his shot just wide of the left post.
Goal! Maximilian Philipp passes the ball to Marco Reus (Dortmund) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Fabian Bredlow couldn't do anything about it. 2:0.
Lukas Muhl (Nurnberg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Patrick Ittrich had an easy-decision to make.
Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) picks up the rebound and shoots. The goalkeeper was ready and denies his effort with a fine save. It will be a corner kick for Dortmund.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Patrick Ittrich has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Goal! Marco Reus plays a short, square pass into the path of Achraf Hakimi (Dortmund), who bends a shot straight into the bottom left corner to make it 3:0. Fabulous goal!
Goal! Jacob Bruun Larsen shows great vision to find Marco Reus (Dortmund) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the bottom right corner. 4:0.
That's the end of the game for Robert Bauer, who is replaced by Eduard Lowen (Nurnberg).
Lucien Favre has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Shinji Kagawa (Dortmund) replacing Marco Reus.
Substitution. Axel Witsel makes way for Julian Weigl (Dortmund).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) comes onto the pitch so that Alexander Fuchs can be given a rest.
Here comes a substitution. Jacob Bruun Larsen is given a rest as he is replaced by Jadon Sancho (Dortmund).
Fabian Bredlow makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the left-hand post by Marcel Schmelzer (Dortmund) after a cross from the side.
Goal! Manuel Akanji (Dortmund) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 5:0.
Goal! Thomas Delaney displays great vision and sends a pass to Jadon Sancho (Dortmund), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 6:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Matheus Pereira (Nurnberg) comes onto the pitch for Yuya Kubo.
It's in the back of the net! Julian Weigl (Dortmund) tries his luck from the edge of the box and his shot takes a deflection and goes past the stranded Fabian Bredlow. He makes it 7:0.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the right side of the target, but Florian Muller easily deals with the threat.

OFF THE POST! Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
A substitution has been made. Daniel Brosinski goes off and Philipp Mwene (Mainz) comes on.

Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) blows a clear opportunity to score a goal. He was one-on-one with Florian Muller inside the six-yard box and attempted to put the ball into the bottom left corner, but was denied by a great save. Wolfsburg force their opponents to concede a corner.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Stefan Bell (Mainz) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Tobias Stieler blows his whistle to start the second half.
Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Tobias Stieler didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Karim Onisiwo trots off the pitch and is replaced by Jean-Paul Boetius (Mainz).
The referee signals a substitution. Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) is brought on as a substitute for Admir Mehmedi.
Tobias Stieler shows a yellow card to Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) for a tough tackle.
Today's referee Tobias Stieler rightly decides to book Ignacio Camacho (Wolfsburg) for his harsh tackle.
Here is a change. Alexandru Maxim is going off and Sandro Schwarz gives the last tactical orders to Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz).
OFF THE POST! Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) takes a shot from outside the box and hits the right post!
The substitution has been made. Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) has replaced Daniel Ginczek.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) replacing Elvis Rexhbecaj.
Bote Baku (Mainz) tries his luck with a long-range shot, but the ball crashes against the bar. Great effort!
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Golden chance! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his low drive to the left post is smartly dealt with by Ron-Robert Zieler.
Robert Schroder shows a yellow card to Timo Baumgartl (VfB Stuttgart) for his blatant foul.
Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) earns the yellow card.

Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom right corner. Ron-Robert Zieler has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Goal! Willi Orban (RB Leipzig) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 1:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) has come on for Chadrac Akolo.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart) replacing Pablo Maffeo.
Ron-Robert Zieler makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the bottom left corner by Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig).
Celebrations are cut short for RB Leipzig as the referee indicates NO GOAL after the VAR review shows it was offside!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Nordi Mukiele (RB Leipzig) was quite harsh and Robert Schroder didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Timo Werner.

OFF THE POST! Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Ralf Rangnick prepares a substitution. Nordi Mukiele is replaced by Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig).
A substitution has been made. Erik Thommy goes off and Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) comes on.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a brilliant save.
Jean-Kevin Augustin (RB Leipzig) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to release a low effort which ends up in the bottom right corner.
Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Ralf Rangnick has decided to substitute Emil Forsberg and he is replaced by Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig).
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Schroder had an easy-decision to make.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.

Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) receives a diagonal pass, bursts into the box and shoots low towards the middle of the goal. Lukas Hradecky is well positioned, though, and it's a comfortable save. Dusseldorf get a corner.

Chance! Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) gets to the rebound on the edge of the box and smashes the ball towards the left side of the goal, but Lukas Hradecky is alert and makes a save to deny him. The referee blows his whistle, Dusseldorf are awarded a corner kick.
Tin Jedvaj (Bayer Leverkusen) wastes a good opportunity as his pass into the box is blocked by the defence.
Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
A yellow card is awarded to Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen).
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf) receives a yellow card!
Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Heiko Herrlich decides to make a substitution. Tin Jedvaj will be replaced by Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen).

Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike to the bottom left corner. Michael Rensing pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill. Bayer Leverkusen win a corner.
Goal! The resulting corner is whipped into the box and Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) buries the ball into the back of the net from a Dominik Kohr knock down. 0:1.
Benito Raman is being substituted because of an injury. Friedhelm Funkel sends Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) on the pitch.

Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) scores a goal! A perfectly produced cross puts him one-on-one with the goalkeeper and he plants a brilliant header down in the middle of the net, leaving the goalkeeper beaten!
Substitution. Kai Havertz leaves the pitch and is replaced by Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen).
Here is a change. Kevin Stoger is going off and Friedhelm Funkel gives the last tactical orders to Marvin Ducksch (Dusseldorf).
Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) has a chance after receiving a pass. He measures his shot from the edge of the box but it sails just wide of the left post.
Substitution. Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) in, Lars Bender out.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Alfredo Morales (Dusseldorf).
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to substitute Jean Zimmer and he is replaced by Takashi Usami (Dusseldorf).

Jonathan Tah (Bayer Leverkusen) jumps into a tackle and Manuel Grafe blows his whistle for a foul. PENALTY! One of the players from Dusseldorf is about to take a penalty kick. Let's see how this ends.
Goal! Lukas Hradecky gets a hand on the penalty from Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf), but can't stop it from flying into the top right corner.
Manuel Grafe is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
What an excellent shot, but not the luckiest one. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) fires the ball from inside the penalty box but it only hits the left post!
Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the left post!
A yellow card for a tackle by Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich). Soren Storks doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Soren Storks shows a yellow card to Rani Khedira (Augsburg) for a tough tackle.
Today's referee Soren Storks rightly decides to book Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) for his harsh tackle.
Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) receives a neat pass inside the box with his back to goal, swivels and hits a powerful shot that goes narrowly over the crossbar.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Andreas Luthe pulls off a brilliant save. Bayern Munich force their opponents to concede a corner.

Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the bottom right corner, but Andreas Luthe was alert and the score remained the same.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Leon Goretzka comes off the pitch to be replaced by David Alaba (Bayern Munich).
Goal! Serge Gnabry tees up Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) inside the box, and he keeps his cool to find the top right corner. 1:0.

Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich) finds himself in space on the edge of the box and smashes a glorious looking effort towards the left side of the goal, but Andreas Luthe thwarts him with a great two-handed save.
That will be all from Serge Gnabry who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich).
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Jan Moravek is replaced by Felix Gotze (Augsburg).
Raphael Framberger (Augsburg) gets a yellow card.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Sandro Wagner as he is replaced by Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich).
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Soren Storks ignores the protests.
Manuel Baum has decided to make a change. Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) replaces Michael Gregoritsch.
Franck Ribery (Bayern Munich) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Felix Gotze (Augsburg) displays good awareness in the six-yard box and finds an unusual way to score by using his body to knock the ball behind the keeper. He makes it 1:1.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Cedric Teuchert (Schalke) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Christian Streich is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Lukas Kubler suffers an injury and Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) comes on.
Robin Koch (Freiburg) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
Hamza Mendyl (Schalke) latches onto a good pass inside the box and shoots. The effort beats the keeper, but deflects off the right post to safety.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) takes a mid-range free kick and his beautiful strike only rattles the right post.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Goal 1:0! Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Cedric Teuchert walks off the pitch to be replaced by Mark Uth (Schalke).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Matija Nastasic (Schalke) was quite harsh and Frank Willenborg didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Hamza Mendyl (Schalke).
The manager makes a subsitution with Philipp Lienhart (Freiburg) coming on for Florian Niederlechner.
Domenico Tedesco prepares a substitution. Evgen Konoplyanka is replaced by Alessandro Schopf (Schalke).
Substitution. Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg) replaces Marco Terrazzino.
Mark Uth (Schalke) gets a yellow card.
Roland Sallai (Freiburg) gets a yellow card.

Dominique Heintz (Freiburg) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the top of the net, but Ralf Fahrmann keeps the ball out.
Guido Burgstaller (Schalke) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Breel Embolo.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
What a great touch by Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the right side of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.

What a great touch by Ihlas Bebou (Hannover) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the right side of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. The ball goes behind for a corner. Hannover will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Goal! Joelinton slips it to Joshua Brenet (Hoffenheim) on the edge of the box and he finds the left side of the net with a great effort. The score is 0:1.
That was close by Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the right post.
Oliver Sorg (Hannover) picks up a yellow card.

Joshua Brenet (Hoffenheim) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots towards the left post, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Michael Esser. What a save! The linesman points to the corner flag, Hoffenheim are going to take it.
Christian Dingert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The game restarts for the second half.
Julian Nagelsmann makes a half-time substitution. Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) comes on in place of Reiss Nelson.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hoffenheim) took a first-time shot from mid-range after he was put in the clear by a great pass, but the effort lacked a little accuracy and went just wide of the left post.

Goal! Leonardo Bittencourt finds Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) with a clever pass. He steps inside his man on the edge of the box and whips a tremendous shot into the left side of the goal. Fantasy football! 0:2.
Yellow card. Walace (Hannover) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Christian Dingert blows the whistle, Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) is penalised for a foul. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to Hannover.
Kevin Vogt (Hoffenheim) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) scores from the spot-kick, but there is a sigh of relief as his shot was headed to the middle, but the goalkeeper somehow couldn't keep it out.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a change. Takuma Asano (Hannover) replaces Marvin Bakalorz.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Leonardo Bittencourt leaves the pitch and Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim) comes on.
The substitution is prepared. Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Pirmin Schwegler.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to substitute Joelinton and he is replaced by Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim).
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) connects with a cross from out wide in the six-yard box, but only plants his header onto the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Linton Maina departs the field of play to be replaced by Iver Fossum (Hannover).
A goal, which was scored by Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover), was disallowed due to offside.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Goal! Andrej Kramaric plays a long ball to Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim), who cuts inside and unleashes a screamer into the bottom left corner. The keeper had no chance. Superb strike! 1:3.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 1:0.
The foul by Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Guido Winkmann.
Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Guido Winkmann shows a yellow card to Javairo Dilrosun (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.
Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen) finds space inside the box but rifles his effort just over the bar.

Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) jumps highest to meet the ball from the corner kick and finishes behind the helpless keeper with a powerful header into the middle of the net. The defence stare motionlessly at each other. What a peach of a goal that is. Milos Veljkovic (Werder Bremen) has every right to celebrate!
The match has reached half-time.
Guido Winkmann blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Half-time substitution. Pal Dardai decided to make a change. Rune Jarstein is replaced by Thomas Kraft (Hertha Berlin).
Javairo Dilrosun (Hertha Berlin) collects a killer pass inside the box that puts him one-on-one against the goalkeeper. He scores, drilling a low drive deep inside the left post!
Today's referee Guido Winkmann rightly decides to book Nuri Sahin (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
The manager makes a subsitution with Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) coming on for Nuri Sahin.
Here is a change. Palko Dardai is going off and Pal Dardai gives the last tactical orders to Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin).
Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) makes an overly-aggressive challenge and Guido Winkmann blows his whistle for a foul. Werder Bremen are awarded a penalty. What an opportunity to score!
The main referee, Guido Winkmann, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Karim Rekik (Hertha Berlin) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Goal! Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Rune Jarstein into the bottom left corner.
Here comes a substitution. Florian Kainz (Werder Bremen) is brought on as a substitute for Martin Harnik.
Pal Dardai decides to make a substitution. Ondrej Duda will be replaced by Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin).
Substitution. Max Kruse walks off the pitch and Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) comes on as a substitute.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Goal! 1:0. Gelson Fernandes (Eintracht Frankfurt) taps home from almost on the goal line after a lucky rebound fell at his feet.

Luka Jovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot low towards the middle of the goal was comfortably saved by Peter Gulacsi. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Eintracht Frankfurt.

Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) has a big opportunity to score! He climbs highest deep inside the penalty box and strikes a powerful header towards the goal. Next time he should aim better as his effort flies narrowly over the bar.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Felix Brych blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! Emil Forsberg (RB Leipzig) puts the penalty low into the middle of the goal and past Kevin Trapp.
Here comes a substitution. Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) is brought on as a substitute for Luka Jovic.
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) misses the left post by a whisker with a close-range rebound. What a chance that was!
Adi Hutter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with  Allan (Eintracht Frankfurt) replacing Jonathan de Guzman.
A substitution has been made. Emil Forsberg goes off and Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) comes on.
Ralf Rangnick has decided to make a change. Marcel Halstenberg (RB Leipzig) replaces Marcelo Saracchi.

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Ante Rebic (Eintracht Frankfurt) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but Peter Gulacsi pulls off a comfortable save.
Stefan Ilsanker (RB Leipzig) has tested the patience of referee Felix Brych and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Konrad Laimer goes off the pitch and Ibrahima Konate (RB Leipzig) comes on.
A yellow card for a tackle by David Abraham (Eintracht Frankfurt). Felix Brych doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.

Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) connects with a cross from the side and steers a header from around the penalty spot towards the goal. The ball goes in the right direction, but it's stopped by one of the defenders.
Sven Bender (Bayer Leverkusen) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
What an opportunity that was! The ball rebounded out to Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen), whose shot from the edge of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.

What an opportunity! Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) squanders a huge opportunity as he latches on to a perfect cross from the wing. He produces a bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes just wide of the left post!
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Sandro Schwarz has made a change at the break. Robin Quaison (Mainz) has come on in place of Jonathan Burkardt.
Goal, no wait. Marco Fritz blows his whistle for handball and Robin Quaison (Mainz) can't celebrate. Disallowed goal.

It's a goal! Kai Havertz (Bayer Leverkusen) makes it 1:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Julian Brandt and planted his close-range header into the bottom left corner. Florian Muller was helpless.
The foul by Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Marco Fritz.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Levin Oztunali (Mainz) was quite harsh and Marco Fritz didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Today's match ends for Lars Bender who will be replaced by Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen).
Heiko Herrlich prepares a substitution. Julian Brandt is replaced by Paulinho (Bayer Leverkusen).
The referee signals a substitution. Anthony Ujah (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Pierre Kunde Malong.
Stefan Bell (Mainz) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) is coming onto the pitch as Levin Oztunali cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Heiko Herrlich has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Isaac Kiese Thelin (Bayer Leverkusen) replacing Leon Bailey.
Bote Baku (Mainz) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and has an effort on goal. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies inches high over the bar.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.

James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Joshua Kimmich. His header bounced off the ground and went inside the right post behind the goalkeeper. It's 0:1.

Good work from Bayern Munich as they win a corner. David Alaba (Bayern Munich) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the left-hand post, but Ralf Fahrmann was alert and the score remains the same.
James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the middle of the goal was easily saved by Ralf Fahrmann.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) shows his willingness to get forward and blasts a shot towards goal. Unfortunately for him, the shot isn't precise enough and hits the crossbar!
Naldo (Schalke) is very lucky to stay on the pitch after using excessive force to bring down his opponent with a two-footed challenge.
Daniel Caligiuri (Schalke) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Daniel Siebert had an easy-decision to make.
Daniel Siebert has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.

James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Schalke will have a goal kick.
Here comes a substitution. Weston McKennie is given a rest as he is replaced by Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke).
One of the Schalke players unfairly tackled his opponent and conceded a foul. PENALTY AWARDED to Bayern Munich!
Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) steps up and confidently powers his spot-kick into the bottom right corner.
We are about to witness a substitution. Amine Harit (Schalke) is replacing Franco Di Santo.
Domenico Tedesco decides to make a substitution. Mark Uth will be replaced by Guido Burgstaller (Schalke).

A truly beautiful footballing moment. David Alaba (Bayern Munich) takes the free kick from a very promising position, but the goalkeeper thwarts the effort with an amazing save. Bayern Munich will take a corner kick.
Niko Kovac has decided to substitute Robert Lewandowski and he is replaced by Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich).
Substitution. Serge Gnabry (Bayern Munich) on for Franck Ribery.
Substitution. James Rodriguez did his best and is replaced by Renato Sanches (Bayern Munich).
Sandro Wagner (Bayern Munich) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Daniel Baier (Augsburg) is awarded a yellow card for a sharp discussion with the referee. He should relax or he could be sent off.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) fires the resulting free kick to the right side of the goal from the edge of the box, but Jiri Pavlenka pulls off a superb save to deny him.

A perfect lofted pass from Florian Kainz finds Max Kruse (Werder Bremen), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header to the middle in the countermovement of the keeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Fabian Giefer had no chance of stopping that. 0:1.
Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) receives a brilliant pass and hammers the ball inside the right post. It couldn't have gone in a better place. What a beautiful long-range goal.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) has tested the patience of referee Felix Zwayer and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. A free kick to Werder Bremen.
Substitution. Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Marco Richter walks off.
Andre Hahn (Augsburg) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. The ball goes out of play. Augsburg are awarded a corner kick.
Goal - 1:2! Francisco Caiuby tees up Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg) inside the box and he curls the ball into the top right corner and past Jiri Pavlenka.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Goal! Andre Hahn puts a cross into the box and finds Philipp Max (Augsburg), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the left post. He makes it 2:2.

Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) in a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes with a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better. His effort ends wide of the right post.
Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) gets on the end of a cross and unleashes an explosive shot at goal from close range, but Jiri Pavlenka makes a fine one-handed save to deny him.

Ambitious effort from Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well over the bar.
Manuel Baum is forced to make a change. Ja-Cheol Koo is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Jan Moravek (Augsburg).
Substitution. Claudio Pizarro makes way for Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen).
Goal! Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen) seizes on the loose ball after a huge error from Fabian Giefer and finds the back of the net from inside the box. 2:3.
Substitution. Rani Khedira did his best and is replaced by Sergio Cordova (Augsburg).
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to substitute Florian Kainz and he is replaced by Kevin Mohwald (Werder Bremen).
Substitution. Max Kruse will be replaced by Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen).
A cross arrives in the goalmouth from the resulting corner kick. Michael Gregoritsch (Augsburg) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the left post!
Felix Zwayer shows a yellow card to Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) for his blatant foul.
It's a yellow card for Jiri Pavlenka (Werder Bremen).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) decides to keep the ball to himself and weaves through the defence into the box. From there he takes a shot which goes narrowly wide of the target.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin), whose header goes wide of the goal.
Markus Schmidt shows a yellow card to Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin) for a tough tackle.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) receives a yellow card!

Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) trips an opponent with a slide tackle. Markus Schmidt stops the game and he could give him a card, but eventually decides on just a warning. PENALTY to B. Monchengladbach! Great chance to score.
Goal! Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Rune Jarstein into the roof of the net.

Marvin Plattenhardt showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 1:1.

A perfect lofted pass from Javairo Dilrosun finds Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Yann Sommer had no chance of stopping that. 2:1.
Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) takes a great touch after receiving a pass inside the box. He immediately unleashes a low shot to the middle of the goal, but the keeper pulls off a decent save!
Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) climbs high to connect with a perfect cross and produces a header that goes not far wide of the right post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Markus Schmidt blows his whistle to start the second half.
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) comes on the pitch for Tony Jantschke.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) comes off for Florian Neuhaus.
Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) latches onto a decent pass, but flashes his shot just wide of the right post.
Today's referee Markus Schmidt rightly decides to book Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) for his harsh tackle.
Goal! Salomon Kalou passes the ball to the feet of Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who has an empty net in front of him and has no problems in tapping the ball in. 3:1.

It's in the back of the net! Patrick Herrmann sends a superb cross into the box. Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header into the roof of the net, leaving Rune Jarstein beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 3:2.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Markus Schmidt ignores the protests.
Pal Dardai is forced to make a change. Marko Grujic is unable to continue due to injury, Per Skjelbred (Hertha Berlin) comes on.

Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the left post!

Javairo Dilrosun passes to Ondrej Duda (Hertha Berlin), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 4:2.
A substitution has been made. Vedad Ibisevic is replaced by Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin).
Dieter Hecking has decided to make a change. Mickael Cuisance (B. Monchengladbach) replaces Nico Elvedi.
Substitution. Derrick Luckassen (Hertha Berlin) replaces Ondrej Duda.

Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot towards the bottom right corner that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to pull off a marvellous diving save to keep his effort out.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.

Leonardo Bittencourt (Hoffenheim) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Roman Burki to get hold of the ball.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Mahmoud Dahoud (Dortmund) was quite harsh and Harm Osmers didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Goal! Joelinton (Hoffenheim) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Harm Osmers blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Celebrations by Hoffenheim are cut short as the referee signals that the legality of the goal will be checked using the VAR. Hopefully this wonâ€™t take too long.
The Hoffenheim players can't believe it after the referee disallows the goal after the intervention of the VAR!
A goal, which was scored by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim), was disallowed due to offside.
Stefan Posch (Hoffenheim) has tested the patience of referee Harm Osmers and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Lucien Favre decides to make a substitution. Mahmoud Dahoud will be replaced by Thomas Delaney (Dortmund).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marius Wolf leaves the pitch and Jadon Sancho (Dortmund) comes on.
Shinji Kagawa goes off the pitch and Maximilian Philipp (Dortmund) comes on.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Havard Nordtveit (Hoffenheim) replacing Steven Zuber.
Abdou Diallo (Dortmund) makes a horror tackle on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim) is coming onto the pitch as Andrej Kramaric cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Goal! Christian Pulisic (Dortmund) unleashes a first-time shot from inside the box and beats the goalkeeper low inside the middle of the net. 1:1.
Substitution. Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) has come on for Joelinton.
Harm Osmers shows a yellow card to Havard Nordtveit (Hoffenheim) for his blatant foul.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

Georg Margreitter (Nurnberg) wastes a great chance from the resulting corner. He times his header superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross, but can't aim better than low towards the middle of the goal, straight into the arms of the goalkeeper.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) is first to the cross from Pirmin Schwegler, but fires his header just past the left post from close range.
Bastian Dankert shows a yellow card to Vura (Nurnberg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The foul by Pirmin Schwegler (Hannover) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Bastian Dankert.
Wait! The referee has now indicated he wants to check if the goal for Nurnberg can stand using VAR.
The Nurnberg players can't believe it after the referee disallows the goal after the intervention of the VAR!
Red card! Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) is sent off by the referee.
Tim Leibold (Nurnberg) fires in the free kick from a promising position just outside the box. It's a fantastic strike and looks set for glory, but it only rattles the right post!
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to make a change due to the red card. Julian Korb (Hannover) is brought on as a substitute for Bobby Wood.
Vura (Nurnberg) takes the ball, nicely zig-zags through the defence, but his shot to the middle of the goal is smartly dealt with by Michael Esser.

Lukas Muhl (Nurnberg) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom right corner. Michael Esser has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Bastian Dankert has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) replaces Genki Haraguchi.
Lukas Muhl (Nurnberg) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post.

Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the middle of the goal. Fabian Bredlow pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Hannover.
Today's referee Bastian Dankert rightly decides to book Ondrej Petrak (Nurnberg) for his harsh tackle.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Eduard Lowen (Nurnberg) comes onto the pitch for Alexander Fuchs.
Eduard Lowen (Nurnberg) is shown a yellow card by the referee.

Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) went on a solo run, tricking his way past defenders, then produced an explosive blast from close range towards the roof of the net. However, Fabian Bredlow showed all his agility, deflecting the ball onto the crossbar! What a save! The linesman points to the corner flag, Hannover are going to take it.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Vura walks off the pitch to be replaced by Torless Knoll (Nurnberg).
Bad communication between Waldemar Anton (Hannover) and the goalkeeper led to an own goal. Thumbs down. Well, let's see if he can correct his mistake with a strike into the opponent's goal.

A superb goal from great team play! Torless Knoll (Nurnberg) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the right post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Substitution. Pirmin Schwegler did his best and is replaced by Josip Elez (Hannover).
Michael Kollner has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Patrick Erras (Nurnberg) replacing Mikael Ishak.
That's it for today, Bastian Dankert has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Roland Sallai (Freiburg) reacts well to a deflected cross from Lukas Kubler and places a close-range header beyond the keeper into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
John Brooks (Wolfsburg) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Freiburg.
Renato Steffen (Wolfsburg) robs an opponent of the ball and explodes in anger when Sascha Stegemann blows for a foul. The referee makes the call - penalty to Freiburg!
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) fails to score from the penalty spot. His effort towards the bottom left corner lacks any pace and that allows the goalkeeper to make a stunning save.
Goal! Nils Petersen (Freiburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 0:2.
Roland Sallai (Freiburg) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Roland Sallai will be replaced by Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg).
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) comes on the pitch for Renato Steffen.
Mike Frantz (Freiburg) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the bottom right corner.
Goal! Wout Weghorst plays it to Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Alexander Schwolow. 1:3.
Substitution. Mike Frantz is replaced by Philipp Lienhart (Freiburg).
Bruno Labbadia has decided to make a change. Josip Brekalo (Wolfsburg) replaces Yannick Gerhardt.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) will replace Marco Terrazzino.
Sascha Stegemann shows a yellow card to Nicolas Hofler (Freiburg) for his blatant foul.

The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Freiburg. Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Koen Casteels makes a great save to stop his effort.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) for Maximilian Arnold.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) was quite harsh and Sascha Stegemann didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That's it for today, Sascha Stegemann has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Alfredo Morales (Dusseldorf), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches over the top.
Close! Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) picks up a pass and produces a ferocious strike towards the right post, but the goalkeeper gets his fingertips to the ball to keep it out.
Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) fails to turn the rebound in from a promising position. The goalkeeper pulls off a superb save and denies his effort.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) is desperate to score a goal, but he misses the target after striking the ball well wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Robert Hartmann blows his whistle and the second half starts.

What a great touch by Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the right side of the goal, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending. The ball goes out of play and Stuttgart have been awarded a corner kick.

Marvin Ducksch (Dusseldorf) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the right side of the goal. Ron-Robert Zieler is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save. Good work from Dusseldorf as they win a corner.

What a great chance for Marcel Sobottka (Dusseldorf). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header towards the foot of the left post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Chadrac Akolo walks off the pitch to be replaced by Erik Thommy (VfB Stuttgart).
Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header wasn't accurate at all and the ball went well wide of the right post.

Marvin Ducksch (Dusseldorf) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.

Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez (VfB Stuttgart) in a great chance! He climbs highest deep in the penalty box and strikes with a powerful header towards the net. Next time he should aim better. His effort ends wide of the right post.
It's time for a substitution. Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) comes on in place of Marvin Ducksch.
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to substitute Benito Raman and he is replaced by Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf).
Substitution. Christian Gentner walks off the pitch and Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart) comes on as a substitute.

Great save! Alfredo Morales (Dusseldorf) had time and space inside the box after picking up a neat pass, but his shot towards the bottom right corner was brilliantly saved by Ron-Robert Zieler. Dusseldorf get a corner.
Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Substitution. Berkay Ozcan (VfB Stuttgart) replaces Gonzalo Castro.
The foul by Adam Bodzek (Dusseldorf) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Hartmann.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
It's a goal! Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg) bursts into the box to get on the end of a whipped in cross from Mike Frantz and scores magnificently from close range into the bottom left corner. 1:0.
Today's referee Deniz Aytekin rightly decides to book Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) for his harsh tackle.

Nils Petersen (Freiburg) runs onto a loose pass inside the box and releases a tremendous shot towards the left side of the goal. However, Ron-Robert Zieler anticipates the shot and makes a brilliant save.

The ball hits the back of the net! Gonzalo Castro delivers the corner, Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart) finds himself some space on the edge of the box and unleashes an unstoppable shot which goes into the top right corner and past the helpless goalkeeper. 1:1.
Deniz Aytekin has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Tayfun Korkut has made a change at the break. Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart) has come on in place of Gonzalo Castro.
The ball is crossed into the box and Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) reacts quickest to send a shot flying towards the bottom left corner, but Alexander Schwolow gets a glove on it to thwart him.
Goal! Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:2.
Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg) fires a daisy-cutter inside the right post from the free kick just outside the box. Football supporters are always happy to see such a fabulous goal.
It's a goal! Emiliano Insua sends a long raking pass onto the head of Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart), who makes no mistake from close in and sends the ball into the bottom right corner. 2:3.

What an opportunity! Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) wastes a huge chance as he latches on to a perfect pass and produces a first-time blast from point blank range. It goes towards the left side of the goal, but Alexander Schwolow reacts superbly to keep the ball out. Stuttgart force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Florian Niederlechner leaves the pitch and Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) comes on.
A great pass puts Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) clear inside the box, he sidesteps the keeper but inexplicably hit his shot off the crossbar.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) receives a yellow card.
Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Tayfun Korkut has decided to substitute Christian Gentner and he is replaced by Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart).
A yellow card for a tackle by Emiliano Insua (VfB Stuttgart). Deniz Aytekin doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
It's in the back of the net! Gian-Luca Waldschmidt (Freiburg) tries his luck from the edge of the box and his shot takes a deflection and goes past the stranded Ron-Robert Zieler. He makes it 3:3.
Pascal Stenzel (Freiburg) is told to leave the pitch by the referee after receiving a yellow card for misconduct!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Andreas Beck trots off the pitch and is replaced by Anastasios Donis (VfB Stuttgart).
Christian Streich prepares a substitution. Mike Frantz is replaced by Lukas Kubler (Freiburg).
Holger Badstuber (VfB Stuttgart) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Deniz Aytekin didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Deniz Aytekin shows the yellow card to Christian Gunter (Freiburg) for a heavy challenge.
Substitution. Jerome Gondorf leaves the pitch and is replaced by Robin Koch (Freiburg).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Max Kruse (Werder Bremen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Werder Bremen win a corner.

Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Martin Harnik (Werder Bremen) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out of play. Werder Bremen are awarded a corner kick.
Daniel Schlager shows a yellow card to Davy Klaassen (Werder Bremen), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Goal! Davy Klaassen finds Maximilian Eggestein (Werder Bremen) with a clever pass. He steps inside his man on the edge of the box and whips a tremendous shot into the top right corner. Fantasy football! 1:0.
Daniel Schlager has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The goal is ruled out after the referee indicates that the VAR spotted Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) was offside!
Substitution. Alexander Fuchs is replaced by Eduard Lowen (Nurnberg).
Michael Kollner decides to make a substitution. Matheus Pereira will be replaced by Vura (Nurnberg).
Today's referee Daniel Schlager rightly decides to book Philipp Bargfrede (Werder Bremen) for his harsh tackle.
The game has come to an end for Martin Harnik. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen).
Florian Kohfeldt has decided to make a change. Nuri Sahin (Werder Bremen) replaces Philipp Bargfrede.
Eduard Lowen (Nurnberg) took a first-time shot from mid-range after he was put in the clear by a great pass, but the effort lacked a little accuracy and went just wide of the left post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Torless Knoll (Nurnberg) will replace Ondrej Petrak.
Yuya Osako goes off the pitch and Marco Friedl (Werder Bremen) comes on.
Vura (Nurnberg) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the left side of the goal.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach) jumped highest inside the box to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Jonas Hofmann. His header bounced off the ground and went inside the right post behind the goalkeeper. It's 1:0.
The foul by Hamza Mendyl (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Manuel Grafe.
Substitution. Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) on for Hamza Mendyl.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) does well to control a poor pass on the edge of the box then shoots towards the left side of the goal. Ralf Fahrmann is out of position but leaps to make a brilliant save. B. Monchengladbach will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Schalke.

Salif Sane (Schalke) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting corner and steers his header into the roof of the net, but the goalkeeper pulls off an astonishing save to deny him. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Schalke.
Manuel Grafe shows the yellow card to Alessandro Schopf (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.

Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) creates himself some space inside the goalmouth and connects with the resulting free kick. His header would have probably ended up in the middle of the goal, but Ralf Fahrmann pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
Mark Uth (Schalke) blows an opportunity as he sends a rebound from just outside of the box narrowly wide of the left post.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Mark Uth (Schalke) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Naldo (Schalke) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the right post by a whisker.
Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes narrowly wide of the right post! What a huge opportunity!
That will be all from Guido Burgstaller who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Cedric Teuchert (Schalke).
Domenico Tedesco has decided to make a change. Breel Embolo (Schalke) replaces Franco Di Santo.
Substitution. Fabian Johnson leaves the pitch and is replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).
Dieter Hecking has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Christoph Kramer (B. Monchengladbach) replacing Denis Zakaria.
Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) picks up an accurate pass inside the box and unleashes a shot goalwards that smashes against the left post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Matija Nastasic (Schalke) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Manuel Grafe ignores the protests.
Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.

Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads under the crossbar, but is stopped by a great save from Yann Sommer. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Schalke.
