Alassane Plea will be replaced by Florian Neuhaus (B. Monchengladbach).

Mark Uth (Schalke) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and releases a quick shot to the bottom left corner. His promising effort is kept out by Yann Sommer, who pulls off a stunning save! Schalke win a corner.
Breel Embolo (Schalke) scores as he latches on to a pass and unleashes a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes into the top right corner of the goal and past the goalkeeper.
Breel Embolo (Schalke) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Thiago Alcantara (Bayern Munich) appears to handle the ball in the box, but the referee wasn't in the best position. Let's see what he decides.
Referee Tobias Welz awards a PENALTY after the VAR review!
Goal! Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) runs up to the ball, stops and waits for Manuel Neuer to commit before slotting the penalty into the top right corner.
Corentin Tolisso (Bayern Munich) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the right side of the goal.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a magnificent shot into the top left corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Lukas Hradecky, so the score changes to 2:1.
Here's the change. Lars Bender leaves the pitch and Julian Brandt (Bayer Leverkusen) comes on as a substitute.

What a chance that is! Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
Corentin Tolisso is substituted due to injury. Niko Kovac gives a chance to James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich).
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
The foul by Wendell (Bayer Leverkusen) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Tobias Welz.
Here is a change. Serge Gnabry is going off and Niko Kovac gives the last tactical orders to Javi Martinez (Bayern Munich).
It is time for a substitution. Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) is on for Kevin Volland.
Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen) makes a horror tackle on his opponent and receives a red card from the referee!
Rafinha is being substituted because of an injury. Niko Kovac sends David Alaba (Bayern Munich) on the pitch.
We are about to witness a substitution. Paulinho (Bayer Leverkusen) is replacing Leon Bailey.
It's a goal! James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) gets on the end of a pass and it allows him to finish into an empty net with a close-range header. The score has changed to 3:1.
A goal, which was scored by James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich), was disallowed due to offside.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Joelinton (Hoffenheim) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but luckily for the goalkeeper he steers his header just over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Dusseldorf.
Rouwen Hennings (Dusseldorf) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Stieler had an easy-decision to make.

Kaan Ayhan (Dusseldorf) latches onto a precise cross from the free kick and produces a header at goal from the penalty spot, but his attempt towards the bottom left corner fails to beat Oliver Baumann, who makes a sensational save.

A pass into space is latched onto by Andrej Kramaric (Hoffenheim), and he bends a shot just wide of the left post that had the keeper worried. The ball goes out of play and Dusseldorf will have a goal kick.
Alfredo Morales (Dusseldorf) scores from a quite difficult position as he leaps high to connect with a cross and powers his header low inside the left post. Excellent finish.
The ball is out of play. Hoffenheim win a corner kick. The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) has tested the patience of referee Tobias Stieler and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Substitution. Joelinton makes way for Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim).
Friedhelm Funkel has decided to substitute Kaan Ayhan and he is replaced by Robin Bormuth (Dusseldorf).
Ishak Belfodil (Hoffenheim) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) replacing Leonardo Bittencourt.
A substitution has been made. Rouwen Hennings is replaced by Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf).
Substitution. Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) replaces Stefan Posch.
Friedhelm Funkel prepares a substitution. Marvin Ducksch is replaced by Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf).
Florian Grillitsch (Hoffenheim) blows a great chance as he gathers a rebound but only hits the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Dusseldorf will have a goal kick.
Goal! Reiss Nelson (Hoffenheim) fires the rebound into the bottom right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
A player from Hoffenheim pulled an opponent down, forcing the referee to blow his whistle. The referee points to the penalty spot. Dusseldorf are awarded a penalty kick!
Goal! Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Oliver Baumann into the bottom left corner.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Amid all the celebrations by Augsburg, the referee has gone over to the monitor to check the validity of the goal using VAR.
The referee looks satisfied after his VAR review and duly disallows the goal for offside. The Augsburg players look gutted.
What a wasted chance that is! A precise cross into the box found Robin Quaison (Mainz), whose header floated just over the bar.
Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) plants his close-range header just wide of the left post after a cross into the box.
Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) comes close to scoring with a glancing header towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper denies him by making a save.
Goal, no wait. Martin Petersen blows his whistle for handball and Jean-Philippe Mateta (Mainz) can't celebrate. Disallowed goal.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Martin Petersen has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Robin Quaison (Mainz) gets on the end of a pass from Jonathan Burkardt inside the box and quickly shoots, but the effort goes inches over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Augsburg.
Martin Petersen shows a yellow card to Bote Baku (Mainz) for a tough tackle.
Substitution. Marco Richter leaves the pitch and is replaced by Francisco Caiuby (Augsburg).
Pierre Kunde Malong (Mainz) has a first-time shot at goal. It's a good effort from the edge of the box, but flies just a whisker past the right post.
Rani Khedira (Augsburg) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Substitution. Anthony Ujah (Mainz) has come on for Jean-Philippe Mateta.
Manuel Baum prepares a substitution. Michael Gregoritsch is replaced by Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg).
Substitution. Ahmet Gurleyen (Mainz) in, Niko Bungert out.
Goal! Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot inside the left post.
Manuel Baum has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sergio Cordova (Augsburg) replacing Dong-Won Ji.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Bote Baku as he is replaced by Alexandru Maxim (Mainz).
Anthony Ujah (Mainz) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball inside the left post, and thus alter the score to 1:1.
Jeffrey Gouweleeuw (Augsburg) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Goal! Alexandru Maxim (Mainz) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:1.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the left post!
Yussuf Poulsen (RB Leipzig) gets to the rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball inside the right post and makes it 1:1.
Goal! Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) fires the rebound into the top right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
Niclas Fullkrug (Hannover) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.

Stunning strike! Timo Werner (RB Leipzig) latches on to a precise through ball from Emil Forsberg before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 2:1.
Diego Demme (RB Leipzig) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Robert Kampka pulls out a yellow card.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Nordi Mukiele (RB Leipzig) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Substitution. Konrad Laimer (RB Leipzig) in, Diego Demme out.
Goal! Emil Forsberg slips a clever pass through to Timo Werner (RB Leipzig), who moves inside the box and sends a measured shot beyond the keeper and into the bottom left corner. 3:1.
Goal! Walace slips it to Miiko Albornoz (Hannover) on the edge of the box and he finds the top right corner with a great effort. The score is 3:2.
Andre Breitenreiter prepares a substitution. Takuma Asano is replaced by Bobby Wood (Hannover).
Substitution. Linton Maina leaves the pitch and is replaced by Genki Haraguchi (Hannover).
Bobby Wood (Hannover) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Kevin Kampl (RB Leipzig) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Oliver Sorg (Hannover) gets booked for the first time in this match.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig) will replace Emil Forsberg.
The game has come to an end for Oliver Sorg. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover).
Here is a change. Timo Werner is going off and Ralf Rangnick gives the last tactical orders to Lukas Klostermann (RB Leipzig).
Waldemar Anton (Hannover) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Marcel Sabitzer (RB Leipzig).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Jerome Roussillon (Wolfsburg) attempts to score with a first-time shot from the edge of the box. His effort towards the roof of the net is saved by Rune Jarstein. Now Wolfsburg have a corner.

A big opportunity is wasted by William (Wolfsburg), who makes a yard for himself and produces a mid-range rocket of a shot towards the top right corner. Unfortunately for him, Rune Jarstein pulls off a fantastic save to stop the effort. The referee points to the corner flag and Wolfsburg will take a corner.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin) was quite harsh and Christian Dingert didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Salomon Kalou (Hertha Berlin) meets the lofted pass inside the box with a well placed shot towards the bottom right corner, but Koen Casteels pulls off a fantastic save to deny him.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Javairo Dilrosun (Hertha Berlin) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Koen Casteels is just a bystander as the ball flies into bottom right corner. The score is 0:1.
Substitution. Josip Brekalo walks off the pitch and Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) comes on as a substitute.

Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and produces a promising first-time shot towards the bottom right corner. His effort is blocked by Rune Jarstein with a brilliant diving save!
Bruno Labbadia prepares a substitution. Renato Steffen is replaced by Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg).

That was a nice football moment. Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the top right corner. Koen Casteels guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!
It's time for a substitution. Davie Selke (Hertha Berlin) comes on in place of Vedad Ibisevic.
Pal Dardai is forced to make a change. Jordan Torunarigha is unable to continue due to injury, Fabian Lustenberger (Hertha Berlin) comes on.
Here is a change. Yannick Gerhardt is going off and Bruno Labbadia gives the last tactical orders to Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg).

Jerome Roussillon (Wolfsburg) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the top left corner is blocked by Rune Jarstein, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Goal! Yunus Malli (Wolfsburg) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Rune Jarstein into right side of the goal.
Substitution. Salomon Kalou will be replaced by Lukas Klunter (Hertha Berlin).
Ignacio Camacho (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Christian Dingert had an easy-decision to make.

The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Mario Gomez (VfB Stuttgart) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The referee blows his whistle, Stuttgart are awarded a corner kick.
Today's match ends for Nicolas Ivan Gonzalez who will be replaced by Daniel Didavi (VfB Stuttgart).
After the VAR review the referee signals NO PENALTY, play can continue.
Gerrit Holtmann (Mainz) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Here comes a substitution. Anthony Ujah (Mainz) is brought on as a substitute for Jean-Philippe Mateta.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Robin Quaison (Mainz) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
It's a goal! Robin Quaison plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Anthony Ujah (Mainz). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.
Santiago Ascacibar (VfB Stuttgart) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Daniel Siebert didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Tayfun Korkut prepares a substitution. Erik Thommy is replaced by Chadrac Akolo (VfB Stuttgart).
A substitution has been made. Emiliano Insua is replaced by Borna Sosa (VfB Stuttgart).
Sandro Schwarz decides to make a substitution. Gerrit Holtmann will be replaced by Karim Onisiwo (Mainz).
Karim Onisiwo (Mainz) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Daniel Siebert shows a yellow card to Borna Sosa (VfB Stuttgart) for a tough tackle.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a superb cross inside the box but only hits the crossbar with a fine header. What a chance!

Kevin Volland (Bayer Leverkusen) latches on to a pass inside the box and strikes the ball to the middle of the goal, but one of the defending players makes a goal-line clearance. The referee blows his whistle, Bayer Leverkusen are awarded a corner kick.
The referee blows his whistle, a clear handball by Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen). PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for B. Monchengladbach.

Thorgan Hazard (B. Monchengladbach) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the left post, but Ramazan Ozcan leaps out to thwart his attempt. B. Monchengladbach force their opponents to concede a corner.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Dominik Kohr (Bayer Leverkusen) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Christian Dingert ignores the protests.
Benjamin Henrichs (Bayer Leverkusen) picks up a yellow card.
Poor challenge! Aleksandar Dragovic (Bayer Leverkusen) is penalised for tripping and Christian Dingert blows his whistle. It's a penalty to B. Monchengladbach! Let's see who's going to take it.
Goal! Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) wins the battle of wills and sends an unstoppable penalty past Ramazan Ozcan into the bottom right corner.
Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball low in the middle of the goal.
Heiko Herrlich decides to make a substitution. Benjamin Henrichs will be replaced by Isaac Kiese Thelin (Bayer Leverkusen).

Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) was close to scoring a goal after unleashing a first-time effort from inside the six-yard box. The ball was aimed low towards the middle of the net, but the goalkeeper read it well and pulled off a brilliant save to thwart the attempt.

What a sweet touch by Fabian Johnson (B. Monchengladbach) as he runs onto a pass deep into the box and fires a fine shot to the left side of the net. The keeper makes a superb save and pushes the ball against the post. B. Monchengladbach earn a corner.
Matthias Ginter (B. Monchengladbach) sees a yellow card from Christian Dingert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
That was close by Leon Bailey (Bayer Leverkusen)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
Heiko Herrlich prepares a substitution. Kevin Volland is replaced by Karim Bellarabi (Bayer Leverkusen).
Here comes a substitution. Mitchell Weiser (Bayer Leverkusen) is brought on as a substitute for Leon Bailey.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Alassane Plea (B. Monchengladbach) will replace Raffael.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Fabian Johnson trots off the pitch and is replaced by Patrick Herrmann (B. Monchengladbach).

A defence-splitting pass is taken in his stride by Jonas Hofmann (B. Monchengladbach) in the box. Without even looking up he drills a shot towards the left side of the goal, but Ramazan Ozcan pulls off a brilliant save. The ball goes behind for a corner. B. Monchengladbach will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Lucas Alario (Bayer Leverkusen) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads it low towards the left side of the goal, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him.
Substitution. Florian Neuhaus walks off the pitch and Denis Zakaria (B. Monchengladbach) comes on as a substitute.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Marco Richter (Augsburg), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.

Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) wastes an opportunity. He finds himself in acres of space and fires in a terrific shot from long range straight towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one! The ball goes out for a corner. Augsburg can continue in their attacking effort.
Kevin Stoger (Dusseldorf) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.
Fabian Giefer was forced into action to thwart Benito Raman (Dusseldorf). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper.
Goal! Benito Raman (Dusseldorf) ran onto a clever lofted pass from Matthias Zimmermann and easily beat the keeper with a header into the bottom left corner from close range. 1:0.
The end of the first half.
Referee Markus Schmidt blows his whistle to start the second half.

It's a goal! Martin Hinteregger (Augsburg) alters the score to 1:1. He latched on to a good cross into the box from Jonathan Schmid, steering his header from close range off the crossbar into the roof of the net. Michael Rensing was helpless.
Itâ€™s tense out there as referee Markus Schmidt has decided to review the goal using the VAR. He makes his way over to the monitor.
Here comes the VAR decision from the ref - no infringement, the goal is given!
Kevin Stoger comes off the pitch to be replaced by Kenan Karaman (Dusseldorf).
Manuel Baum decides to make a substitution. Francisco Caiuby will be replaced by Ja-Cheol Koo (Augsburg).
That's the end of the game for Rouwen Hennings, who is replaced by Marvin Ducksch (Dusseldorf).

Marco Richter sends a precise lofted pass into the box, Andre Hahn (Augsburg) rises above the defenders to meet the ball and heads it straight into the right side of the goal. The score sheet now reads 1:2.
Manuel Baum has decided to make a change. Dong-Won Ji (Augsburg) replaces Marco Richter.
Here's the change. Benito Raman leaves the pitch and Dodi Lukebakio (Dusseldorf) comes on as a substitute.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Matthias Zimmermann (Dusseldorf) receives a yellow card!

Matthias Zimmermann (Dusseldorf) finds himself some space just outside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Fabian Giefer pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going low into the middle of the target.
Manuel Baum has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Kevin Danso (Augsburg) replacing Daniel Baier.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Good chance! Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) nicely turned his man inside the box but placed his effort just wide of the right post. He should have scored!

Well-positioned Nils Petersen (Freiburg) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot low towards the middle of the goal, but Frederik Ronnow reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop!

Goal! Sebastien Haller shows great vision to find Nicolai Muller (Eintracht Frankfurt) with a cheeky pass inside the box, and his first-time shot is precise and sails into the bottom left corner. 0:1.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) connects well with the free kick, but heads the ball just wide of the right post from close in.
What a big chance! Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
The end of the first half.
Referee Manuel Grafe blows his whistle to start the second half.
Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) receives a well-played pass inside the penalty area and shoots. He sends the ball into orbit.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Florian Niederlechner (Freiburg) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Manuel Grafe shows a yellow card to Nicolai Muller (Eintracht Frankfurt) for a tough tackle.
Carlos Salcedo (Eintracht Frankfurt) kept talking out of turn to the referee until Manuel Grafe lost patience and pulled out a yellow card.
Jerome Gondorf (Freiburg) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Nils Petersen (Freiburg) blows a golden chance from inside the box, volleying the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a miss!
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Taleb Tawatha as he is replaced by Filip Kostic (Eintracht Frankfurt).
Lars Vossler decides to make a substitution. Gian-Luca Waldschmidt will be replaced by Marco Terrazzino (Freiburg).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nicolai Muller departs the field of play to be replaced by Jonathan de Guzman (Eintracht Frankfurt).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Lucas Holer (Freiburg) for Florian Niederlechner.
Mijat Gacinovic (Eintracht Frankfurt) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post.

Goal! Jonathan de Guzman slips a clever pass through to Sebastien Haller (Eintracht Frankfurt), who moves inside the box and sends a measured shot beyond the keeper and into the right side of the goal. 0:2.
Substitution. Mijat Gacinovic walks off the pitch and Danny Blum (Eintracht Frankfurt) comes on as a substitute.
Mike Frantz (Freiburg) fires the ball towards the left side of the goal from close-range, but his shot is blocked by one of the defenders. Freiburg will take a corner kick.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.

Valentino Lazaro (Hertha Berlin) receives a neat pass inside the box with his back to goal, swivels and hits a powerful shot that goes narrowly over the crossbar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Nurnberg.
Valentino Lazaro does all the hard work to set it up on a plate for Vedad Ibisevic (Hertha Berlin), who needs no second invitation to bury the ball into the empty net. 1:0.
Wait! The referee has now indicated he wants to check if the goal for Hertha Berlin can stand using VAR.
Referee Tobias Welz signals that the goal stands after the VAR review and the Hertha Berlin have a reason to celebrate!
This is a yellow card! Alexander Fuchs (Nurnberg) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
The end of the first half.
The whistle blows and Tobias Welz starts the second half.

Niklas Stark (Hertha Berlin) latches onto a precise cross from the free kick and produces a header at goal from the penalty spot, but his attempt towards the left side of the target fails to beat Fabian Bredlow, who makes a sensational save. The ball is out of play. Hertha Berlin will have a chance to score from a corner.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Marvin Plattenhardt (Hertha Berlin) receives the caution after an awful tackle.

A pass travels right across the box to Yuya Kubo (Nurnberg) and gives him a sight of goal. He tries to beat the keeper in the bottom left corner, but Rune Jarstein denies him with a decent save. Nurnberg win a corner.
That will be all from Edgar Salli who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Federico Palacios-Martinez (Nurnberg).

Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) volleys the ball on the edge of the box after a rebound. It's a great effort and has Rune Jarstein scrambling, but it flies just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Hertha Berlin will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Dennis Jastrzembski (Hertha Berlin) replaces Maximilian Mittelstadt.
The referee shows the yellow card to Robert Bauer (Nurnberg).
Dennis Jastrzembski (Hertha Berlin) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Tobias Welz had an easy-decision to make.
Hanno Behrens goes off the pitch and Torless Knoll (Nurnberg) comes on.
Wait! The referee wants to check the penalty to Nurnberg using VAR. He's heading over to the monitor now as the players anxiously wait.
Handball! A player from Hertha Berlin handled the ball. The referee gives a penalty kick to Nurnberg!!
Penalty saved! Mikael Ishak (Nurnberg) sends the penalty towards the left hand side of the goal, but Rune Jarstein pulls off a wonderful save to deny him.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Palko Dardai (Hertha Berlin) will replace Salomon Kalou.
The game has come to an end for Vedad Ibisevic. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Marko Grujic (Hertha Berlin).
Michael Kollner has decided to make a change. Patrick Erras (Nurnberg) replaces Robert Bauer.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.

What a wasted opportunity by Ihlas Bebou (Hannover)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the bottom left corner, but Jiri Pavlenka makes an astonishing save to thwart him.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Ludwig Augustinsson (Werder Bremen) is first to react to a loose pass inside the box, but slices his shot just wide of the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Milot Rashica (Werder Bremen) comes onto the pitch for Max Kruse.
The defence just can't clear the ball and a rebound eventually falls to Yuya Osako (Werder Bremen) deep inside the box, but his well-hit shot flies just wide of the right post.
Andre Breitenreiter has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marvin Bakalorz (Hannover) replacing Pirmin Schwegler.
Substitution. Linton Maina makes his way off the pitch and Genki Haraguchi (Hannover) comes on as his replacement.
Walace (Hannover) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) will replace Florian Kainz.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) gets on the end of a cross from Ludwig Augustinsson, but his shot goes a whisker over the crossbar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Takuma Asano leaves the pitch and Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) comes on.
Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) jumps for a cross in the goal area and produces a fine header which goes just a few inches over the bar! What a huge opportunity!
Hendrik Weydandt (Hannover) is released by Ihlas Bebou, he surges into the box and smashes a great shot into the top corner after a one-on-one with the goalkeeper.
Florian Kohfeldt decides to make a substitution. Philipp Bargfrede will be replaced by Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen).
It's a goal! Theodor Gebre Selassie (Werder Bremen) does well to meet a cross inside the box and strikes a perfect header inside the right post.
Yuya Osako sends a terrific cross into the box. Claudio Pizarro (Werder Bremen) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just over the bar.
What a chance that is! Johannes Eggestein (Werder Bremen) displays good awareness near the penalty spot to get on the end of a cross, but he sends his header narrowly wide of the right post.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
The referee gives a yellow card to William (Wolfsburg).

William (Wolfsburg) unloads a good strike from the free kick just outside the box. His effort towards the top left corner is stopped by Ralf Fahrmann, who pulls off a glorious save! The ball goes out of play. Wolfsburg are awarded a corner kick.
Patrick Ittrich shows the yellow card to Salif Sane (Schalke) for a heavy challenge.
Gooal! Maximilian Arnold takes over corner duties. John Brooks (Wolfsburg) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the left side of the net. 1:0.
Patrick Ittrich shows a yellow card to Josuha Guilavogui (Wolfsburg), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Bruno Labbadia gives a chance to Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) and Josuha Guilavogui is off.
The foul by Weston McKennie (Schalke) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Patrick Ittrich.
Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) latches onto a lofted pass from Maximilian Arnold on the edge of the six-yard box, but misdirects his header and sends it just wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Breel Embolo (Schalke) replaces Amine Harit.

It's been a while since that contentious challenge by Matija Nastasic (Schalke), but referee Patrick Ittrich must have received some information as he makes the VAR signal. He's going to review and it could result in a red card!
The referee pulls a red card out of his pocket and shows it to Matija Nastasic (Schalke) for his challenge.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Guido Burgstaller (Schalke).

It's been a while since that contentious challenge by Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg), but referee Patrick Ittrich must have received some information as he makes the VAR signal. He's going to review and it could result in a red card!
Wout Weghorst (Wolfsburg) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Substitution. Cedric Teuchert (Schalke) replaces Guido Burgstaller.
Bruno Labbadia has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) replacing Wout Weghorst.
Yannick Gerhardt (Wolfsburg) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Patrick Ittrich had an easy-decision to make.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Suat Serdar leaves the pitch and Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) comes on.
John Brooks (Wolfsburg) gives away a foul for a clumsy challenge. Referee Patrick Ittrich saw the whole situation. Penalty awarded! Schalke will take a penalty kick.
The game is interrupted. John Brooks (Wolfsburg) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Goal! Nabil Bentaleb (Schalke) calmly steps up and places the ball low into the middle of the goal.
Substitution. Josip Brekalo walks off the pitch and Admir Mehmedi (Wolfsburg) comes on as a substitute.
Goal! Daniel Ginczek (Wolfsburg) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the middle of the net. It's 2:1.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Jerome Boateng (Bayern Munich) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked.
Nuhu Kasim (Hoffenheim) sees a yellow card from Bastian Dankert after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Gooal! Joshua Kimmich takes over corner duties. Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
Leonardo Bittencourt (Hoffenheim) is the one who receives a yellow card.
What a miss! Joelinton (Hoffenheim) is left standing right in front of goal with only the keeper to beat after a clever pass, but he somehow contrives to toe poke the ball just past the right post.
David Alaba (Bayern Munich) clips a neat ball into the box in the direction of Thomas Muller, but he can't get on the end of the pass.

Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) bursts into the box after a fine solo run. He looks up and tries to place a shot inside the right post, but Oliver Baumann makes a great save to deny him his moment of glory.
Pavel Kaderabek (Hoffenheim) is cautioned by the referee.
Nico Schulz (Hoffenheim) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Problems for Niko Kovac as Kingsley Coman (Bayern Munich) is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Arjen Robben replaces him.
Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Julian Nagelsmann has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Steven Zuber (Hoffenheim) comes on the pitch for Vincenzo Grifo.
Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Adam Szalai (Hoffenheim), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 1:1.
The manager makes a subsitution with Kevin Akpoguma (Hoffenheim) coming on for Nuhu Kasim.
Niko Kovac decides to make a substitution. Javi Martinez will be replaced by Leon Goretzka (Bayern Munich).
Kevin Vogt is substituted due to injury. Julian Nagelsmann gives a chance to Havard Nordtveit (Hoffenheim).

Referee Bastian Dankert sees the trip by Havard Nordtveit (Hoffenheim) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. The referee blows his whistle and awards Bayern Munich a penalty after chaos inside the box.
Goal! Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich) slams home the penalty with a precise low shot into the bottom left corner.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) comes onto the pitch for Franck Ribery.
The goal by Thomas Muller (Bayern Munich) won't count as it has been disallowed on the advice of the video assistant referee!
Oliver Baumann pulls off a great save to deny James Rodriguez (Bayern Munich) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Thomas Muller feeds the ball through to Arjen Robben (Bayern Munich), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the top left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 3:1!
That was close by Robert Lewandowski (Bayern Munich)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the left post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
